loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns income from fishing herself. Amalia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her retail fish business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric, who used his previous loan to rent land for asbestos dumping, is 43 years old. He is married and has nine children. He lives living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His businesses are motorcycle transportation, asbestos trading, and farming. He has been in business for seven years and does not regret his choice of jobs. His dream is to build a proper permanent house for his family, even though he is challenged by high transportation costs when he delivers his services to his customers. He will use the loan to rent land for asbestos dumping.

loans.use: to rent land for asbestos dumping.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 23 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Crisanta has a food vending business in the Philippines. Crisanta requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Crisanta has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 41 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rubber trees.

She aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Michel Johanna

texts.es:
La señora Michel es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de café internet.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar sillas, mesas, equipos de computo, entre otros.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una mujer con gran empuje!
texts.en:
Sra. Michel is an enterprising and creative woman. For the longest time, she has wanted to become independent and have her own Internet café. She is now able to fulfill her dreams due to her great capacity for work, the support she is receiving from Interactuar, and people who want to see her succeed in her business.

Michel is requesting financial assistance in order to buy chairs, tables, computer equipment, and other items.

With this loan, you can support a woman who has tremendous drive!

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, computer equipment, and other items.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a 61-year-old married woman from the village of Gamarjveba. She lives with her husband and small grandson. The only source of income for this family is Lili's husband's job. He works as a collector and generates 400 GEL monthly.

Lili has a great desire to do her bit for her family's welfare and generate her own income. For this purpose, she requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. The creditors didn't find enough family income to be sufficient to approve the loan.

The start up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL, which she plans to use for purchasing a milk cow and starting agricultural activity. Lili will take care to the cow and will produce milk products for local trading. The business will be profitable she thinks, as the demand is high, and she will get her own customers.

Lili and her family rely on the good of Kiva lenders and will be grateful for the help, as the family income will be doubled after starting the agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and start producing milk products.

loans.name: Nhóm 2-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khuyen, 36, works as a farmer with a monthly income of about VND 650,000. She has two children still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2005. Her husband's health is not good, and her family is classified as a poor family and could not afford to have a sanitary latrine. 

With this loan, she will use the fund to build a septic tank toilet. This will improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, she is pictured first from the right in the first row.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Tersa

texts.en: Fifty-two year old Tersa engages in basket weaving. She makes and sells baskets made of native palm. She is a married woman with three children, from Antequera, Bohol. One of her children is still attending school. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter. She is applying for a loan to buy materials, such as palm, bamboo strips, and wicker. These materials will be used to produce more baskets to sell. These will improve her income and permit her to manage her finances. With these changes, her income will slowly increase, and she will be able to pay her bills. She will be also able to continue sending her children to school. Tersa would like to expand her business and make it modern, so that she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as palm, bamboo strips and wicker, to make baskets to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is 38 years old. She lives in the Dusheti region with her brother. Nana trades clothes from home. She is very hardworking woman and does her best to cover all the expenses of the family. Nana needs 600 GEL to add to her savings and purchase a stock of clothes. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, provides credit for her trading. She purchases a wide assortment of clothes for women, men and children. She already has her clients, who visit her home in groups to buy clothes.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Caren. She is a smallholder farmer from the Chemanui location in the Kericho region of Kenya. Caren enjoys the support her mixed-farming business gets from her parents. She is looking to expand by leveraging her business. 

Caren is seeking a loan to purchase more heads of poultry to increase the number from the 10 she already has on the farm. This will ensure that she cuts costs, reduces waste and increases egg production. She also makes supplementary income from a dairy cow she named Karon. 

Besides livestock farming, Caren grows food crops such as vegetables, bananas and trees. Her plan is to invest this loan in a way that will give her enough income to take care of her seven siblings' basic and educational needs.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Mildy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mildy works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.  Mildy is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her business to sell.

Mildy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and a married woman with eight children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Emma has a general store business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Emma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Kwet Thit Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Kwet Thit Village, in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region of Myanmar. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 31 village customers (17 men and 14 women). This loan will help some group members purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed (costing $25 for four days worth of feed for 100 ducks).

Kwet Thit Village has over 96 households and 400 villagers. Most of the villagers are farmers planting rice paddy and seasonal vegetables. For additional income, some households raise livestock, including pigs and chickens.

Pictured above are five CBO members named U Kyaw, U Tin, U Kyi, U Tun and U Win. Included in the picture, U Kyaw (first from left) is 48 years old and married. He and his wife farm their seven-acre farm for crops, mostly rice paddy. They also plant flowers and sell them in the town market.

U Kyaw's family will use Proximity's loan to purchase fifty ducks. More ducks will increase his income from more ducks' eggs.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Mais

texts.en: Mais, a 20-year-old single woman, lives in Zarqa. She has been interested in monuments and in historical legacy since she was young. When she finished high school successfully, her father supported her to study something innovative that she would like, so Mais chose heritage resources administration, which would enable her  to achieve her dream. She has two brothers, both of them are in the army. They are all doing their best to help Mais have a comfortable life. They also give her moral support, wanting to see her be a successful lady in the future. Mais is a simple, adorable and creative lady. Her only thought is to finish her studies, so that she can find work and then complete advanced education, because her dream to become a teacher at the university. Her father is retired from the army, and his pension is not enough to cover Mais’s university fees. Therefore she applied for an education loan to pay for her university education. Mais needs your help to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Nhóm 5-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh, 32, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately VND 550,000. Her husband passed away, so she has to raised their school-age child on her own. She has been a member of local Women's Union since 2012. 

Currently, her family is in an economic hardship situation and cannot afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will build a septic tank latrine to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to environmental protection. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left in the first row.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is a 38-year-old married man with three children. He lives with his family in a small house in the city of Sana'a, Yemen. He is a solider with a very small salary. He can't provide his children with all that they need. 

The house where Hamid lives with his family lacks of a lot of housewares, and the rest are old. Unfortunately, Hamid's salary is inadequate. Therefore, he applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase many of the necessary housewares.

Hamid looks forward to providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase many of the necessary housewares.

loans.name: Ghadir Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Ghadir Al- Hodeidah group is comprised of four women who are friends and neighbors. They live in different parts of the city of Hodeidah, Yemen, a hot climate area noted for its beautiful  sea. 

The members are friendly people, kind and warm-hearted, who charm visitors. They are hard workers who work hard every day to improve their household economies and get their families ahead. They asked for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

One of the members is Ezia. She is a 37-year-old married woman, living with her family in a poor area. Ezia runs a small business of selling ice-cream in the streets under the sunshine and winds. 

She works Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule and for a very limited income. Her work is her passion. 

In order to enlarge her business, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of many items, like sugar, drinks and things to make ice-cream to sell on the street. 

Her goal is to expand her business through purchasing more than one refrigerator for selling ice cream.

loans.use: To purchase many items, like sugar, drinks and things to make ice-cream to sell on the street.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es:
Susan es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 10, 9, 6 y 3 años, y trabaja como administradora de un club de raquet ball.
Ella es independiente, inteligente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la localidad de ‘el Torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Susan es de tez morena, cabello negro largo creso, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y hala español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza (sentada al centro, usa solera de color marrón y short de jean). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al autotransporte, y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su deseo de superación la llevo a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller de costura, venta de productos cosméticos, elaboración de colchones,  venta de chamarras, venta de mandiles y lana, venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de polleras, venta de chamarras para  niños y taller de soldadura, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su actividad principal es la atención y administración de un club de raquet ball, labor que realiza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, dejándole el tiempo restante para ocuparlo en su 2 actividad. Por recomendaciones de amigos y futuros clientes decidió comenzar un emprendimiento en la venta de cosméticos de marcas como; yanbal, revlon, Avon y natura. Y productos como; perfumes, cremas, lápices para ojos, labios y otros. Labor que realiza desde las 3 de la tarde en adelante. “Gracias a mi disposición de tiempo he pensado en tener mi negocio propio, la venta de cosméticos tiene mucha demanda y por eso me animé a realizar mi emprendimiento…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su negocio propio para ser su propio jefe. Ella desea realizar la compra de cosméticos por mayor para realizar su emprendimiento y tener una segunda actividad comercial. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando la venta de cosméticos.
Es por esos motivos que Susan solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para desarrollar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Susan is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her partner. They have four children (ages 10, 9, 6, and 3). She works as a manager at a racquetball club.

Susan is a good mother who is independent, intelligent, responsible, and hardworking. She goes to her job in the town of El Torno, a rural community that is located 45 minutes outside of the city by automobile. This area is known for its agricultural trade. Rural producers, vendors, and distributors gather in this town. The weather is warm, tropical, and humid. The temperature varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade throughout the entire year.

Susan has a dark complexion, long curly black hair, short stature, and dark eyes. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks it in her town. However, she speaks Spanish to integrate herself into the general culture and to conduct her work. In the photo, she is seated in the middle, wearing a brown tank top and denim shorts. She shares her life with her partner who works in the transportation sector. Her older children are in school and the youngest one is under her care. They live in a rented brick house that has well water and electricity. Her drive to succeed has resulted in her becoming the leader of a Communal Bank that includes people who operate the following types of businesses: operating a sewing workshop, selling cosmetics, manufacturing mattresses, selling coats, selling aprons and wool, selling alpaca wool sweaters, selling traditional skirts, selling children’s jackets, and managing a metalsmith shop. By requesting a loan, the members will be able to expand their businesses.

Susan’s main job is operating and managing a racquetball club. She works from 7:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. This gives her time to manage her side business. Due to suggestions from friends and prospective customers, she decided to begin a business of selling brand-name cosmetics such as Yanbal, Revlon, Avon, and Natura. These products include perfumes, crèmes, eye pencils, lipsticks, and other items. She works at this business from 3:00 P.M. onward. “Thanks to having this available time, I’ve always thought of having my own business. There is much demand in selling cosmetics, so this has made me excited about pursuing my business,” she says. Her dream has been to have her own business so that she can be her own boss. Susan wants to buy cosmetics in bulk so that she can keep her business running and have a second source of income. This is her second loan cycle with Emprender and she has been selling cosmetics for one year.

For the reasons previously mentioned, Susan is requesting a loan in order to buy cosmetics in bulk, which will help her business develop.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 30 years old, married and the mother of three children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For six years Rosemarie has been running a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, eggs, sardines, etc. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ghaidaa

texts.en:
Ghaidaa is from Ajloun, and she is working hard to grow, study, and become someone in life. Ghaidaa's parents are helping her with her education, and her goal is to finish her degree and become an English teacher so that she can help her family and repay them for their efforts. 

Because her dad is facing financial problems, Ghaidaa is requesting this loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian comes from Nyabuhikye town in the Ibanda district. He is married with one child who is still too young for school.

He runs a retail shop with capital of 1,000,000 UGX where he earns income to look after his family. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to help him buy more stock of daily household items, like water, soda, sugar, flour, salt, soap and toilet tissue, among other items to sell in his shop. 

He will use the rest of the money to renovate his house since it is in poor condition. Brian is a very honest and hardworking man who is striving hard to provide the best for his family.

loans.use: To buy daily household items to sell.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with eight children and three of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members - her grandchildren. 

She has a business of selling local gin and has been in this business for 7 years, selling to all categories of people on both a retail and wholesale basis. 

Besides this business she also generates additional income through selling used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She is wanting to start selling local gin from her home and also to build rental rooms. Hadjah is requesting a loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin, crates of beer and spirits. 

She resides in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of local brew, crates of beer and spirits.

loans.name: Sabrositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SABROSITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de gorras de lana, venta de mantas, venta de joyas, venta de mantillas, servicio de construcción, venta de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mandiles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al ir a apoyar en su negocio a su madre, quien hace varios años tienen el negocio, cuando obtuvo un pequeño capital decide independizarse. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mandiles por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Bolivia - Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “SABROSITAS” communal bank is starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the .German Busch branch, It is made up of 8 members lead by a board of directors with Maria as president. The businesses of the members are varied amongst them are: the sales of wool hats, selling blankets, selling jewellery, selling aprons, construction services and the sales of back-packs.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs of which Maria is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago joining on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institute. She currently has a business selling aprons. She says that she learned the business by going and helping her mother with her business who during a number of years had this business. When she amassed a small amount of capital she decided to go independent.

This current loan is to increase her capital (buying aprons wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesalers on the Bolivia-Peru border. She will then sell them in her sales space. Working in this way will allow her to support her family economically as she is single and has 2 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the health services that the institute provides.

loans.use: to buy wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Esther

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee un negocio de venta de refrescos desde hace varios años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes ya establecidos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de refrescos, jugos, gaseosas, agua, etc. todo por mayor para poder tener mejores ganancias y asi una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and their three children. For several years, she has been selling soft drinks from her place of residence. She has many established customers.

Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy soft drinks, juices, sodas, water, and other products in bulk so that she can generate better earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, sodas, water, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates a a beauty salon business on a retail basis. She works three days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. Her major challenge is not having electricity.

Christine has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy weaves, relaxers, shampoo and braids. Her goal and aspiration is to own a fully stocked beauty salon. 

She rents a house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy weaves, relaxers, shampoo and braids.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 62 years old and married with 10 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Purita has a business selling fruit in the Philippines. Purita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Purita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Purita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old, married, and has three children. One of them is in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money in order to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Masira

texts.ru: Масира, 55 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1997 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Масира на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 3 лошади и 13 овец. На участке мерою 4,0 Га она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 7 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность накопить на строительство дома для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Masira is 55 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this in 1997. Thanks to persistent work, Masira currently has two cows, three horses and 13 sheep. She grows clover for farm use on a plot of land of 4.0 hectares.

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase seven sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, in order to get the opportunity to save money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seven sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Soltan Al- Hodiedah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Soltan Al- Hodiedah. It consists of three women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.
Fatima is 37 years old, married and has seven children. The family lives in a small house. In 2010, Fatima established her sambusa (traditional food) business in the area where she lives with her family. She began her business because the income of her husband did not cover the daily needs of the family. She decided to start her own business to make traditional food working seven days a week and 15 hours a day.  Fatima has a lot of customers because she make a very delicious sambusa. Fatima would use the loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients to make traditional food to sell.
In the future, Fatima hopes to expand her business by opening a small store for making traditional food. The loan will help her to generate more income and improve her family's standard of living. She is hard working and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients to make traditional food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her university tuition so she can continue with her studies.

loans.name: Edgar Armando

texts.es:
Edgar, de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, luego decidió a viajar a Estados Unidos en donde vivió seis años, se acompaño y tiene dos hijas, luego decidió volver al país a vivir con su madre.

Edgar, desde que regresó de  Estados Unidos, está administrando un negocio familiar de venta de comida, ya tienen ocho años, desde que su madre empezó el negocio y ahora él le ayuda.- Venden desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, además venden panes de lunes a domingo.
 
Edgar, solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para reparar el techo de su casa y hacer otro tipo de reparaciones dentro de su casa, el préstamo mejorara su calidad de vida, porque dormirá en mejores condiciones . 

Los sueños de Edgar son, volver a ver a sus hijas y siempre seguir apoyando a su madre.
texts.en:
Edgar is 32 years old and a secondary school graduate. After that he decided to travel to the United States where he lived for 6 years. He is married and has 2 children. Later he decided to return to his country and live with his mother.

Edgar since his return from the USA is managing the family;s food vending business. It as been 8 years since his mother started the business and now he helps her. They sell breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as selling bread from Monday to Sunday.

Edgar is requesting a loan to buy materials to repair the roof of his house and to make other repairs to the house. The loan will improve his quality of living as he will sleep in better conditions. Edgar's dream is to return to see his children and continue to support his mother.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix the roof of his house.

loans.name: Berfine

texts.en:
Berfine is single lady, who is 19 years old.  She lives in Jarash. 

She is a second year student majoring finance, and she has six siblings.  Her family depends on her dad`s salary, and so it is not enough to cover Perfine`s study. She wants to complete her study and find a good job so that she can help her family. 

She applied for an educational loan to cover university fees and complete her study.

loans.use: to cover university fees and complete her study.

loans.name: Chanthea

texts.en:
Chanthea is a 21-year-old university student, who lives in Kandal Province in Cambodia. She is studying banking and finance in her third year.

Her parents are farmers who cultivate rice, corn and herbs to sell. Her father is also a construction worker. Chanthea doesn’t have enough money to pay her third year tuition fees, so she would like to apply for a loan. This loan will help her to go through the third year at university successfully. 

After graduation, she wants to have a good job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to pay her third year tuition fees.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Vera is divorced. She has her own business. Vera sells cosmetics and perfumes. 

Vera has three retail outlets and two salesmen. She is very responsible and hardworking person. She want's to develop her business further.

Vera is asking for a loan of 40 000 UAH to increase the assortment of cosmetics and perfumes for the holiday season. The loan will help Vera to increase her income and take better care of her children.
texts.en:
Vera is divorced. She has her own business. Vera sells cosmetics and perfumes. 

Vera has three retail outlets and two salesmen. She is a very responsible and hardworking person. She wants to develop her business further.

Vera is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to increase her assortment of cosmetics and perfumes for the holiday season. The loan will help Vera to increase her income and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods such as coffee, sugar, toothpaste, eggs, cooking oil, bath soap, soft drinks and condiments. She is a married mother of children from Antequera, Bohol. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 5. 

She has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, canned goods and liquor. These supplies will attract more buyers to come to her store and purchase. Her income will increase she will start to handle her finances. She could now prepare healthy diets. Because of that, she will continue to support the schooling of her children.

Elenita would like to expand her business to be productive and to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods and liquor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her shop inventory.

loans.name: Holanda Mercedes

texts.es:
La gastronomía de la provincia es muy reconocida a nivel nacional por lo que Portoviejo es la capital de la gastronomía manabita, en Picoaza se saborean los mejores ceviches y una gama de platos nativos. 
La señora Holanda tiene 55 años, es casada, su esposo es dueño de una tienda, tiene 6 hijos de este matrimonio, 5 son mayores de edad y el ultimo de 17 años estudia en el colegio y vive con ellos en su casa propia.
Doña Holanda y su esposo para salir adelante junto a su familia, tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos¡ como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo pero por lo general es ella  la que más pasa en su negocio ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 3 años y le gusta porque el grupo es responsable. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The gastronomy of the province is nationally recognized, so Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí cuisine.  The best ceviches and a range of traditional dishes are enjoyed in Picoaza.

Holanda, 55, is married and has six children from this marriage.  Five are adults and the last one, 17, attends high school and lives with them in their own home.  Her husband owns a store.

Holanda and her husband have a grocery store in their house so they can make progress with their family.  She sells all types of products, including rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, and fruits.  She works every day from 6 a.m until 8 p.m., and sometimes later.  Her husband helps her with her job but generally it is she who spends the most time in the business because, in addition to earning a living, she enjoys herself and learns about what's going on around her.  She has worked in this job for five years and it's going very well for her.

She's going to use this loan to stock her store more.  She's going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other staple products.

Holanda has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes it because it's a responsible group.  Her goals are to keep making progress with her business and for her store to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other staple products

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 48 years old and married with six children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Arlene has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Arlene has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is 20 years old and is studying for a degree in business administration. She is from Jarash and is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.
Haneen dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her daily expenses and help her family with household expenses.
Haneen applied for an education loan so that she can continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 21 years old and from the Kutaisi district. She works as a saleslady at a local shop and gets a small monthly income. Nino wants to generate additional income. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL and begin a trading business. 

With the received credit Nino will go to Tbilisi and purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then resell them in Kutaisi with a price markup. 

This will give her a chance to generate additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes in order to get additional income.

loans.name: Mziana

texts.en:
Mziana, 64 years old, lives in Samtredia district with her pensioner husband. Mziana cultivates a small family-owned piece of land and grows maize and   nut trees. A very hardworking woman, she sells the harvested nuts and maize locally. 

In order to earn more income, Mziana wants to start an additional and stable business purchasing wholesale stocks of fruits and vegetables, reselling them with a price markup. This will give her an additional income. The Start Up program, which is a joint Kiva-Credo initiative, enables her to obtain a loan of 1000 GEL to begin the new business.

loans.use: to begin to trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelly has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.  Nelly has been in this business for twenty years. 

In the future, Nelly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.ru: Гулсанам 44 года, в разводе, мать 4 детей. Образование у Гулсанам высшее. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей фруктами. Гулсанам оптом покупает фрукты, в том числе из-за границы, и перепродает их на местном рынке. Она арендует складское помещение для хранения фруктов, в обороте у нее есть товар на сумму 200,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход Гулсанам составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, ведь Гулсанам одна растит младших детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Гулсанам планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса, она хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Gulsanam is 44 years old, divorced and the mother of four children. Gulsanam has higher education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with selling fruit. Gulsanam purchases fruit wholesale, including from abroad, and sells them at the local market. She rents storage room for keeping the fruit, and has goods worth 200,000 som (KGS) in stock. 

Gulsanam's monthly income is up to 20,000 som (KGS). This amount of money is not enough for a decent life, as Gulsanam raises small children by herself. With an aim to develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the turnover of goods. 

Gulsanam plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business. She would like to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase fruits in order to increase her turnover and improve her family's well-being

loans.name: Seyil

texts.ru: Сейил, 50 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей, младшие дочери учатся в школе. У Сейил высшее образование, много лет проработала учителем в школе. С 2004 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 6 овец. Дополнительно у Сейил есть земельный надел мерою 4,0 ГА, где она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации.  Благодаря упорному труду Сейил, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Сейил в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Сейил планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sayil is 50 years old, a widow and a mother of three children. Her youngest daughter is in school. Sayil has higher education, and worked many years as a school teacher. She has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 2004. She has two cows and six sheep at the farm. In addition, Sayil has a plot of land of 4.0 hectares, where she grows clover for farm use and sale. 

Thanks to Sayil's persistent work, her farm has around 10,000 som (KGS) per month, that serves as the basis for the cost of food and household needs of the family. This money is not enough for a decent life, and therefore Sayil turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase ten sheep with an aim to further develop her business. Sayil plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep in order to increase her income

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza, is a 22-year-old young woman from Tbilisi City. She lives with her husband, grandmother and aunt, who is the only employed person in the family. She works as a sales lady at the local store, and generates 400 GEL. 

Luiza and her husband were unable to start any stable job. In order to have her own income and cover even basic needs, Luiza decided to be involved in her own business. She lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Luiza to get a loan of 650 USD and start a trading business.  She will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and will sell them retail over the counter. 

Luiza thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in great location, and also because of the high demand for these products. After starting the trading business, the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  

With the support of the Start Up program, Luiza will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle financial difficulties. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to start her own business trading in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Illampu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILLAMPU” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Remedios es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ganado, venta de papa, producción de papa, venta de queso, venta de ganados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Remedios es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al observar a sus padres realizar esta actividad, posteriormente con un poco capital decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en comunidades cercanas a su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "ILLAMPU" group are about to begin their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors with Remedios as it's president. The members run a variety of different businesses, including: selling livestock, growing potatoes, selling potatoes and selling cheese. The loan will help small micro entrepreneurs, Remedios among them. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, having following a huge publicity campaign at the institution which was built in the area where she lives. She currently runs a business selling livestock; she learned her trade some years ago by watching her parents working. Later, with a little capital, she decided to set up her own business. She will use this loan to boost her capital so she can buy livestock from local wholesalers and then sell it within the local area. Her work allows her to generate an income with which to support her family, as she is a single mother of two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training which the institution provides.

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single, with four children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

Justine operates a kiosk, selling soft drinks. She has been in this business on a retail basis for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. 

Justine has requested for a loan of UGX 600,000 from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy boxes of mineral water, crates of soda, other juices, and snacks. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. 

Justine's goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and to buy a van to transport her merchandise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy boxes of mineral water, crates of soda, other juices, and snacks.

loans.name: Yohana Yasmin

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital provincial e igualmente es cabecera cantonal del cantón del mismo nombre. Esta urbe es la primera ciudad establecida en la costa ecuatoriana con un clima cálido seco. En  la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen el grupo, en casa de una de las socias quienes se reúnen cada quince  días en el  sector San Pablo.
La señora Yohana  tiene 33 años, es  casada, de este matrimonio tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 2 años los mayores estudian en escuela y colegio; el esposo trabaja para una institución Privada.
Doña Yomara se dedica a la comercialización de agua (bidones, botellas personales, fundas) y ropa, esto venta la realiza todos los días corriendo diferentes lugares y al público en general, la ropa vende por cuatro horas y el agua ocho horas al día.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en la compra ropa (camisetas, camisas, shorts, medias, etc.). Ella tiene cuatro años haciendo los créditos, le gusta los intereses bajos y resalta el buen trato que recibe de parte del promotor y del personal de la Fundación.
texts.en: Portoviejo is the provincial capital and also the main town in the canton of the same day. It was the first city to be set up on the Ecuadorian coast with its hot, dry climate. The group meets in the city of Portoviejo, holding fortnightly meetings in one of the member's homes in the San Pablo district. 33-year-old Yohana is married and has three children of 12, 10 and 2 years of age, the older two of whom go to primary school and secondary school; her husband works for a private institution. Yohana runs a business selling water (in containers, people's own bottles or pouches) and clothing, selling her goods daily by travelling to different places and selling to the general public. She sells clothing for four hours a day and water for eight. She will use this new loan to buy clothing (t-shirts, shirts, shorts, tights, etc.). She has been benefitting from loans for four years; she likes the low interest rates and stresses how well she is treated by the promoter and the foundation's staff.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shirts, shorts, tights, etc.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is the oldest of five siblings. What inspired him to follow a course in computer science is the growth in the technology field that's facing the world. He wants to be a part of the scientific explosion. He wants to follow a career that's related to this work, since he has good possibilities of finding a good job. 

Raed is requesting this loan to be able to cover the fees at his university and to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to be able to cover the fees at his university and to continue with his studies.

loans.name: Phionah

texts.en:
Phiona lives in Bufunda, just a few metres away from Ibanda town. She is married with three children, all in school.

She runs a boutique in Ibanda town. She deals mainly in ladies’ clothes. Her customers are passersby and the people around town.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to help her buy stock of more clothes to sell so that she can maximize profits. She is assured of a large clientele, since more middle and low class people wear used clothing. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children. Her major challenge is limited capital to run her business.

Despite the few challenges, Phionah is a very hardworking woman who thanks Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for the commendable job they are doing.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is single and has no children, but does care for other family members. For the last six years, she has operated a retail shop. She is requesting this loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour, and rice to sell to her customers.

She generates additional income from selling fruits and vegetables, and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She hopes to expand her shop into a wholesale operation.

She lives in the family house with access to electricity, but does not have piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Mwananchi Group

texts.en:
Esther, who is in her mid forties, is single. She has been selling chips and chicken for four years now. She works from 11:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Esther's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, chicken, and charcoal for cooking chips and to fry chicken. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to take care of herself and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to still buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, chicken, and charcoal for cooking chips and to fry chicken. She dreams of buying more sacks of Irish potatoes and more chicken to make more chips and sell to more people.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group, "Mwananchi", which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, chicken, and charcoal for cooking chips and to fry chicken.

loans.name: Charylyne

texts.en:
Charylyne is a 37-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children, from Montebello, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. Charylyne has been in the business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. 

Charylyne is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell, such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, bread, and snack foods. This loan will help Charylyne improve her inventories, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, bread, and snack foods.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 45% of Kenya's gross domestic product, generates 70% of Kenya’s export revenue, and employs approximately 70% of Kenyans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain underserved by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Clara, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mother who is 22 years of age! She hails from the Kericho area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of two lovely, school-going children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Clara’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". She faces financial challenges, and because the Kericho area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereal for resale and thus improve her income.

Clara’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. But this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Clara has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Clara is quite visionary and, with her accumulated profits, hopes she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy cereal for resale

loans.name: Marestila

texts.en:
Marestila is a 33-year-old married woman with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marestila has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marestila would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa is 59 years old, married and has eleven children. Three of her children are in school.

Elvisa is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elvisa has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elvisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marleg España

texts.es:
En el corazón de Portoviejo se encuentra el parque Vicente Amador Flor, parque de cantantes, poetas, intelectuales y enamorados, la glorieta que recoge la historia de la ciudad está ubicada desde el año 1910, fecha en que instalaron la verjas de las Glorieta como un símbolo de reunión y tradición, la misma que fue traída de Alemania y fue elaborada con hierro forjado.
La señora Marleg tiene 54 años, es viuda y tiene una hija mayor de edad  que es soltera y estudia en la Universidad, viven en su casa propia.
Ella tiene una tienda que está ubicada en su casa, tiene ayudantes y atiende su negocio nueve horas al día todos los días
El Crédito que le fue otorgado es para invertir en productos que son solicitados por sus clientes a diario como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.
Doña Marleg tiene diez  años haciendo los créditos, le gusta el apoyo y el trato excelente del personal.
texts.en:
Located in the heart of Portoviejo is the Vicente Amador Flor Park. It is the park of singers, poets, intellectuals and lovers.  The gazebo covers the history of the city, is located there since 1910 when they installed the gates of the roundabout as a symbol of union and tradition.  The gates were brought from Germany and were made from wrought iron.

Marleg is a 54 years old widow. She has an older daughter who is single and studies at the University. They own the house they live in. She has a store located in her house. She has helpers and works in her store nine hours each day, every day.

The loan she received is to invest in products that her clients are requesting daily, such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. 

Marleg has been taking out loans for 10 years. She likes the support and the excellent personal customer service.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen, 32, is a mother of two lovely children seeking capital to acquire a chaff cutter for preparing fodder for her dairy cows. She lives and works on roughly a half acre piece of land together with her husband of five years. Doreen also keeps poultry and grows trees.  

Doreen's main source of income is milk. In order to maintain a high level milk production from her cows, she needs to ensure that they are healthy. This she does through maintaining a hygienic environment for the animals, animal dipping and proper feeding.
 
Over the five year period she has been in farming, however, she has been spending a lot of energy and time cutting fodder into pieces favourable for her cows. To put things in perspective, reckon a lady farmer having to chop a cartload of maize stock using a using a machete.

With your loan investment, Doreen will be able to do thrice the work in half the time. This electric machine will free her to do other responsibilities while it draws in stalks, chops them into small even pieces and discards them inside the store.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutting machine

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a married 38 year old with two children. She lives in Zarqa, Jordan.
She wants to meet the needs of her children, and dreams that their future will be full of success and excellence.
All that depends on the financial situation of her family, so she has been running a business from home for ten years, selling general household products, as well as making sweets to sell. Hanady is also doing hair and makeup for the girls. She is doing all of this to provide a good life and good education for her children. She wants to expand her work to increase her income, so she asked for a loan to help her buy more raw materials and other new items.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials and new items.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Portoviejo ofrece a los turistas nacionales y extranjeros una gran variedad de la deliciosa e incomparable gastronomía que halaga gratamente al paladar más exigente, esto lo podrá  disfrutar viajando por La Ruta del Encanto, el corazón de la ciudad sitio ideal para quienes gustan de la práctica del turismo rural, que es  una aventura pura  por el contacto natural, con su clima cálido seco.
Aquí vive la señora Rosa, tiene 56 años, es casada, su esposo es albañil y de este matrimonio tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad y casados,  vive en su casa que es propia.
Ella tienda una tienda donde vende (arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc.) y también tiene una cabina telefónica, su negocio lo atiende todos los días desde hace más de 16 años.
La señora Leonila  invertirá este crédito en comprar víveres en general (arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, etc.) para ampliar la variedad de productos.
Los créditos los realiza desde hace 8 años, le gusta la facilidad y el apoyo  que brinda la Fundación para incrementar el negocio, ella espera crecer  y ser una de las tiendas más grandes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Portoviejo offers tourists a large variety of delicious and unmatched foods that satisfy even the most demanding palates.  One can enjoy these treats traveling down "La Ruta del Encanto" (The Road of Enchantment). The heart of the city is an ideal place for those who enjoy rural tourism and want a pure adventure in nature in the warm, dry climate.  Rosa lives in this city.  She is 56 years old and married to a mason.  She has four children from this marriage who are adults and are married. She lives in a house that she owns.

She has a store where she sells rice, sugar, oil, milk and other goods.  She also has a phone booth.  She has worked in her store everyday for more than 16 years.  Leonila will use this loan to purchase groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, salt, etc. to increase the variety of products that she offers.  She has been receiving loans for eight years, and she enjoys the ease and the support given by the foundation to expand her business.  She hopes to grow and be one of the largest stores in the city.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, oil, salt, etc...

loans.name: Carlos Rodolfo

texts.es:
El cantón Portoviejo, al igual que todo el Ecuador tiene dos estaciones: invierno o época de lluvias, la cual comprende una temporada de enero a mayo aproximadamente; y la época de verano o época seca que va desde junio hasta diciembre.
Posee pequeñas elevaciones que están a 200 y 250 metros sobre el nivel del mar, hay pequeñas cordilleras como las de Portoviejo las de Río Chico, la del calvario y las de Picoazá. Portoviejo su capital se encuentra a 53 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Aquí vive el señor Carlos, tiene 29 años,  es soltero y vive con los padres que tienen casa propia, el es maestro Albañil
Don Carlos se dedica a la albañilería de lunes a viernes y los sábados y domingos  se dedica a la venta de alimentos (verduras, tomate, pimiento, etc.) de  4 de la madrugada hasta las 11 de la mañana en el mercado de Rocafuerte, tiene un ayudante para este negocio; esto lo lleva realizando 7 años y con los créditos a fortalecido el negocio.
El dinero que solicito es para comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. y herramientas de albañilería
El señor Carlos realiza los créditos desde hace dos años y le gusta el apoyo que le da la fundación para el fortalecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Like the rest of Ecuador, Portoviejo has two seasons: winter, or the rainy season, which lasts from January to May; and summer, or the dry season, which lasts from June to December.  It has small mountains which are at 200-250 meters above sea level, and small ridges such as Portoviejo, Rio Chico, Calvary and Picoazá.  Portoviejo is located 53 meters above sea level.  This is where Carlos lives.  He is 29, single and lives with his parents in their own.  He is a master mason who works as a mason from Monday to Friday, and on the weekends, he works selling groceries (vegetables, tomatoes, peppers, etc.) from 4am to 11am in the Rocafuerte market.  He has a helper for this business which he has worked in from seven years.

With the loan, he plans to strengthen his business.  The money that he is seeking will be used to purchase groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. for his store, and tools for his masonry.  Carlos has received loans for the past two years, and he likes the support that the foundation gives him to strengthen his business.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, oil, etc. and tools for masonry.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 34 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nina requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nina has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica  a la venta de ropa en el centro de la ciudad, aun no tiene hijos y actualmente vive en una casa alquilada.

Edwin, tien 8 meses de trabajar en una empresa de telefonía, él es el encargado de manejar la un vehiculo de la empresa que viaja a varios lugares del país, decidio aceptar este trabajo porque no encontró trabajo cerca de su casa, su horario no es fijo y trabaja de lunes a domingo.

Edwin, necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la venta de ropa que tiene su pareja, ella comprará calcetas, camisolas, entre otro tipo de ropa que se vende en época escolar, de esta manera esperan obtener mejores ingresos que les ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Edwin es, que el negocio de su pareja crezca, para dedicarse solo a este tipo de trabajo y no tener que salir lejos de su casa por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Edwin, 30 years old, studied through 9th grade. He is married and his wife earns a living selling clothing in the city center. They still do not have children and currently live in a rented home.

Edwin has worked at a telephony business for 8 months. He is in charge of driving a work vehicle that travels to several places in the country. He decided to accept this work because he could not find work close to his home. His schedule is not fixed and he works from Monday to Sunday.

Edwin needs a loan to invest in the business selling clothing that he has with his partner. She will buy stockings, sweaters and other types of clothing that she sells during the school year. In this way, they hope to obtain better income to help them improve their quality of life.

Edwin’s dream is for his partner’s business to grow, to dedicate himself only to this type of work and to not have to go far away from his home for long periods.

loans.use: to invest in clothing for sale.

loans.name: Liliana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Liliana, de 45 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos.

Liliana, tiene un cafetín en un centro escolar del caserío en donde vive, sus hijos le ayudan a atenderlo, gracias a un crédito que se le dio anteriormente, pudo remodelarlo.

Ahora Lilian, necesita el dinero para remodelar su cafetín y surtir con más productos, ya que vende mucho los productos de la canasta básica y actualmente no puede atender la necesidad de algunas personas, por no tener los productos que buscaban.

El sueño de Lilian, es que su cafetín crezca y que pueda ser más rentable para que esa sea una fuente de ingresos para sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Liliana is 45 years old, has a third-grade education, and is the single mother of three children. 

Liliana has a snack stand at a school campus in the small town where she and her family live. She's previously received a loan for this business, and her her children help her manage the stand.   

Liliana now needs funds for renovations to the stand and to stock it with more goods. She sells a lot of basic grocery items, but doesn't stock other items, and can't meet the demand from some of her customers.

Liliana's ambition is to grow her business so it will become more profitable. The stand his her only source of income for the support of her children.

loans.use: to renovate her snack stand and stock it with more goods.

loans.name: Sonilda De Mercedes

texts.es:
Sonilda es caracterizada por su espíritu trabajador y familiar. Durante sus 43 años de edad que lleva, siempre ha trabajado para otorgarle la mejor educación a sus dos hijos de 18 y 14 años de edad. No fue hasta hace tres años cuando empezó con su pequeña pulpería con la ayuda de su esposo. Esta comerciante con poco tiempo va caminando con pasos firmes, pues quiere montar un nuevo negocio elaborando helados con su propio equipo.
Dice un dicho que la sonrisa muestra más que mil palabras, y así es con Sonilda, ya que con tan solo esa sonrisa refleja lo bien que se siente por el camino donde va. Por esta razón es que desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de helados. Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de bolsas, jugo en polvo y azúcar para continuar con la fabricación de helados. En sus metas está convertirse en una de las más grandes empresarias para brindarles la mejor educación y vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonilsa is known for her hardworking and family spirit.  Over her 43 years of age, she has always worked to provide her two children (ages 18 and 14) with the best education.  It wasn't until three years ago that she opened her small grocery store with the help of her husband.  In a short amount of time, this business owner has reached steady ground and now wants to start a new business making ice cream with her own equipment.  There is a saying that says "a smile says more than a thousand words," this is how Sonilda lives her life.  Her smile alone reflects how well she feels about the path she is on.

For this reason, she wants to continue investing in her ice cream business.  She is seeking a loan to purchase bags, powdered beverages, and sugar to continue making ice cream.  One of her goals is to become one of the biggest business owners so that she can provide her children with the best education and life.

loans.use: purchase bags, powdered drinks and sugar.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila engages in making and selling native baskets made of palm. She is a 53-year-old married woman with two grown children from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in making baskets for more than 20 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like palm, bamboo split and wicker.  These materials will be used in making baskets, and the baskets will be sold to her respective customers. With these, slowly, her earnings will improve and she will be able to handle her finances and start to pay her obligations.

In the future, Cirila dreams of expanding her business to make it successful and to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials like palm, bamboo split and wicker

loans.name: Junice

texts.en:
Junice is 42 years old and married. She has seven children, four of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Junice has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Junice would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Maria Lenalyn

texts.en:
Maria Lenalyn is 51 years old and a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

Maria Lenalyn has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy stock of rice to sell. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maria Lenalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar, 35 years old, lives in Ajloun. She is a divorced woman. After her divorce, she wanted to begin a new life and started to think about her future and how she will be a successful woman. She is studying for a degree in Nursing. Samar has always wanted to help people, so she decided to pursue her studies. Maybe that will be the beginning of change.

Samar has requested this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. This will be a great help as she achieves her goals. She needs your help to start her new life.

loans.use: To pay her Nursing degree fees.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, pero solo 3 hijos y una nuera viven con ella.

Sandra, siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos.- Anteriormente, solicito un crédito para comprar lámina para arreglar el techo de su vivienda, ya que estaba quebrado y se mojaba cuando era época lluviosa.

Ahora, ella necesita el crédito para comprar lámina para reparar el techo de la vivienda en donde vive uno de sus hijos.

Sandra, desea poder ayudar a sus hijos para que cuando ella muera, todos tengan sus casas buenas en donde puedan darle buenas condiciones a sus familias.
texts.en: Sandra is 54 years old and she studied as far as second grade.  She is a widow with four children, but only 3 children and a daughter in law live with her. Sandra has always dedicated herself to housework. Previously, she requested a loan to buy sheet metal to fix the roof of her house, because it was broken and it got wet during the rainy season. This time, she needs the loan to buy sheet metal to repair the roof of the house where one of her kids lives. Sandra wants to help her kids, so that when she dies they all have good homes to provide to their families.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Massy

texts.en: Massy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children and five of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She makes chips and crisps at the market on a retail basis. She gets additional income from plaiting hair. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, fish and spices. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal and spices

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 56 years old and a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Roselyn has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. Roselyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 46 years old. She is married with four children aged between 16 and 22 years, and all of them go to school. She sells small fish and has been in a business for 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more small fish to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more small fish to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Editha has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. Editha has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en: Denyse is 24 years old. She is not married. She sells vegetables and has been in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more onions and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Suglo Mali Nyori - Darigohi Group

texts.en:
Zuweira is a 35-year-old hard working woman from Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has two children. Zuweira is the individual pictured with the hand raised among members squatting.

Zuweira is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 20 years. The name of the group is Suglo Mali Nyori – Darigohi. Zuweira earns a good profit from the business simply because the group has a lot of experience processing high quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian local markets. 

Zuweira and Suglo Mali Nyori - Darigohi group have asked for a loan of 13,200 GHS. Zuweira’s share of the loan is 400 GHS, which will be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. She aspires to produce in large quantities in the future and earn more income. She also wants to repay this loan, support her family with food stuffs, and pay for her children's educational expenses.

Zuweira thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice for processing.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en: Lukia is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis.
