She has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, cassava, flour, beans, and green bananas. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenge is seasonality. She aspires to buy better serving dishes and other utensils. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, cassava, flour, beans, and green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to sell like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 24-year-old, single man from Jenin City. He works as a construction worker, sometimes with a low and unstable income. He is also a student where he studies Business Administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job.

Osama took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments and also to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to pay part of his urgent expenses.

Osama appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments and also to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Yazeed

texts.en:
Yazeed, 22 years old and single, lives in Al Mafraq, studying in the university in his fourth year, majoring Chemical Engineering.

As a result of problems that were faced by Yazeed`s father with his work, they face financial problems. Yazeed tried his best to find work that would help him to cover his university fees, but he didn't find suitable work to suit his studies. 

He applied for an education loan to cover his semester fees to complete his study and achieve his dreams, one of which is to complete an advanced education.

loans.use: to cover his semester fees to complete his study and achieve his dreams, one of which  is to complete an advanced education.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school. She has been farming rice and sugarcane in the Philippines for five years now.

Virginia has taken out and successfully repaid seven loans in the past through NWTF for her farm. She is now applying for another loan, this for 9000 PHP, in order to buy more fertilizer and other farm supplies. Her goal is to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jean Je

texts.en:
Jean Je is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and all of her children are in school.

Jean Je has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Jean Je has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 30 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She has sold fish in the Philippines for the past seven years.

Joy has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She is working hard to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Marta Gladis

texts.es: Marta tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos. Marta es un mujer emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para apoyar a su familia. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la costura. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir. Ella desea mejorar las paredes de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de pintura, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para repellar y pintar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their five children. Marta is an enterprising woman who does whatever she possibly can to support her family. She earns a living as a seamstress and has been making clothing for a long time.

She would like to fix up the walls of her house so she is asking FUSAI for a loan. She will use the money to buy paint, cement, sand, and to  pay for labor to plaster and paint the walls.

loans.use: to buy paint, cement, sand, and to pay for labor for plastering and painting the walls of her house.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es: Jorge es un hombre de 48 años de edad que vive en una pequeña vivienda hecha de lámina junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos 2 varones de 17 y 16 años de edad y una pequeña niña de 10 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y es de esta manera que siempre está buscando salir adelante apoyado en su trabajo como jardinero en el cual le va muy bien porque gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus servicios de corte de grama, poda de árboles, elaboración de figuras en árboles, siembra de plantas, etc. Jorge sabe que su vivienda no reúne las condiciones de seguridad necesarias para vivir, por lo que desea construir una pequeña vivienda de cemento y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pequeña vivienda de cemento lo antes posible y aprovechar la época seca para evitar inconvenientes en invierno.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 48-year-old man. He lives in a small house that is made out of metal sheets with his wife and his 3 children: 2 sons, who are 17 and 16 years old, and a small 10-year-old daughter. He is a hard-working man, who is always looking for ways to improve his family's quality of life. In addition, he is always looking for ways to move forward, relying on his job as a gardener. He does very well because, thanks to his experience, he has many customers who seek his services: cutting grass, trimming trees, making figures in trees, sowing plants, etc.

Jorge knows that his house does not have the proper security features for a safe life. For this reason, he wishes to build a small cement house. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a small cement house as soon as possible. He wants to take advantage of the dry season in order to avoid the inconveniences of winter.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a small cement house.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en: Aurora is a 50-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 25 years now. This is the source of her income. She also runs a small electrical repair shop with her husband. Aurora is asking to take a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income and profit. In the future, Aurora hopes to expand her hog raising business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 61 years old, widowed, and has eight children. 

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Judith requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Judith has been buying and selling livestock for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, three windows, and one door, as well as paint to complete all the renovation of the hall and the room that she built.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeria, de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, ya que sus padres no le dieron la importancia necesaria al estudiar, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella solo vive una nieta que está estudiando.

Valeria, es costurera y le gusta mucho su trabajo, pero siente que ya es demasiado cansado para ella pasar sentada por mucho tiempo.- Ella aprendió este oficio, gracias a un programa que llego a su comunidad, antes de dedicarse a la costura, tenía una pequeña tienda de productos básicos.

Valeria, siempre le ha gustado trabajar con ropa, es por eso que ahora quiere el crédito para comprar ropa para vender, para descansar y dejar de coser.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos y nietos tengan su propio negocio, para que no dependan de nadie y trabajen desde sus casas.
texts.en:
Valeriana is 56 years old and only studied up to the second grade because her parents didn't think it was important to go to school. She is a single mother and has four grown children. Only one granddaughter lives with her, and she attends school.

Valeriana is a seamstress and she likes her work very much, but she feels that it is very tiring for her to sit for a long time. She learned this trade thanks to a program that came to her community. Before becoming a seamstress she had a small store where she sold staple goods. Valeriana has always liked to work with clothing and now she would like a loan so she can buy clothing to sell. This will allow her to rest and stop sewing.

Her dream is for her children and grandchildren to have their own business so they don't have to depend on anyone and can work from their homes.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Orwah

texts.en:
Orwah is a 20-year-old single man from Qalqilia city.  He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He is also a student where he studied Press.  He wants to complete his studies and find a better job.

Orwah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester.  This will help him to pay part of his urgent expenses.

Orwah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en: Theoneste is 33-years-old. He is not married. He has a shop and has been in a business for 7 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more rice, cooking oil and sugar to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cooking oil and sugar to  resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children who both go to school. Esther also takes care of additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last nine years. She earns additional income from farming.

Esther has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy sweet potatoes, cassava, banana leaves and fresh beans. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to increase her sales so as to expand her capital base.

Esther lives in rented houses and her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes, cassava, banana leaves and fresh beans.

loans.name: Ingrid Fabiola

texts.es:
Portoviejo está ubicado a 30 Km de la costa del Ecuador y a 35 km de la ciudad de Manta, principal puerto de la provincia. Soporte de su economía es el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo. La ciudad tiene tres universidades con campus y dos a distancia.
Aquí vive la señora Ingrid, tiene 32 años, es separada y tiene 3 hijos de  13, 10 y 5 años que estudian en colegio  escuelay jardín de infantes, tiene casa propia pero por el momento está viviendo en un alberge ya que su casa se encuentra en zona de peligro.
Doña Ingrid con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura con una amiga, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque reconoce que lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas ya que hay mas diseños y con estos aprende aun mas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, aunque en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde también pueda vender sus obras. Tiene dos años solicitando los créditos lo que le  agrada del grupo es su organización.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is located 30 km away from the coast of Ecuador and 35 km away from the city of Manta, the main port of the province. Its economy is supported by tourism, since this canton has beach, city, and country areas. The city has three universities with campuses as well as two at a distance.

In this place lives Ingrid, who is 32 years old. She is separated and has 3 children, who are 13, 10, and 5 years old. They are in middle school, elementary school, and preschool. Ingrid has her own house, but at the moment she is living in a shelter because her house is in a danger zone.

Ingrid, with the hope of obtaining her own income and taking advantage of her knowledge of tailoring, set up a small sewing workshop at her house with a friend. There, she makes all kinds of clothing for women, men, and children. She admits that what she enjoys making most is articles of clothing for women and girls, since these have more designs and allow her to continue learning. She works based on orders from individuals, although in certain seasons she also makes uniforms for institutions and schools in the area.

She is requesting a new loan to buy fabrics and other materials for sewing. Her dream is to have a larger workshop and a store in the center of the city where she can sell her creations. She has been requesting loans for the past two years. She likes the institution's organization.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is an example of an ambitious woman, and she is a 35-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in Jarash. 

Leena is studying for a degree in Nursing. She has always wanted to help people, so she decided to pursue this degree. She wants to work in this profession and become a successful professional who can help other people. 

Leena applied for an education loan, so that she can pay her university fees. This will be a great help as she achieves her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is 21 years old, and is finishing her degree in water and environmental management. She says that she wants to help people with something as important as their health. Her goal is to finish school and find a job where she can grow and make something out of her life. 

Haya applied for an education loan to help her pay university fees, so she can complete her study, then find a job.

loans.use: to pay university fees, so she can complete her study, then find a job.

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es:
El olor al maíz tostándose, el sonido de las palmas golpeando la masa, mientras los gallos terminan de despertar a los vecinos de doña Rosa de 62 años de edad, dan por comenzar el día laboral de esta pequeña comerciante con su vena de tortillas. Con más de 40 años de experiencia en costura y con más de 30 haciendo y vendiendo este producto culinario nacional, es como es reconocida por las calles donde habita. 
Ella cuenta con el apoyo económico y moral de su esposo e hijos. Ella desea que todo su pueblo conociera de sus excelentes tortillas, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar maíz y repuestos de su molino. Esto le permitirá aumentar un nivel de producción y podrá arreglar su máquina para moler el maíz. En sus planes está llegar a comprar otro molino y mesas para producir más tortillas que tanto le solicitan a diario.
texts.en:
The smell of roasting corn and the sound of palms patting the dough while the roosters finish waking up the neighbours hint that a new day of work selling tortillas is about to begin for this small merchant. 

Rosa, aged 62, has over 40 years of experience in sewing and has been making and selling this national culinary product for over 30 years. This is why she is well known in the neighbourhood.

She has the financial and moral support of her husband and children. She would like that everybody in her town tasted her superb tortillas. This is why, she is requesting a loan to buy corn and spare parts for her mill.

The loan will allow her to fix her mill to grind the corn and increase her production. 

She plans on buying another mill to produce more tortillas, which are in high demand daily.

loans.use: to buy corn and spare parts to repair her mill.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en:
Fazilat is a strong woman. She was born in 1983, and lives in a rural area. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an immigrant. 

Fazilat is starting a business. She is renting a shop and cooking pastries. Her mother-in-law and sister-in-law are helping her with preparation, cooking and selling pastries. Fazilat has a great number of satisfied clients. Every day, the demand for her pastries is greater than another day. She cooks well and likes doing it. Fazilat requested support to buy ingredients for her pastries. She is planning to buy vegetables, flour and oil for baking.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, flour and oil for baking pastries and for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is 49 years old and lives in Zarqa. She is a conservative woman and asked her son to take her place in the photo. Heba has two children who are university students. She has a dream, which is to see her children be successful and special.

Heba's son is Majed and he is in his second year, majoring in economics. He is working aside from his study to cover his expenses and help his family. 

Lately, Heba faced financial problems so she is applying for an education loan to help her pay for university fees.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Yanira Liseth

texts.es:
Yanira, de 43 años de edad, está estudiando administración de empresas, está casada, tiene 2 hijos y su esposo es transportista.

Yanira, trabaja de 8:00 a.m a 5:00 p.m en una alcaldía desde hace 16 años; anteriormente, trabajo en el destacamento militar en el área administrativa.

Yanira, necesita el dinero para comprar los útiles escolares de sus hijos, ya que inicio el año escolar y ella quiere contribuir con la educación de sus hijos, para que tengan una formación tanto espiritual así como también que obtengan conocimiento para que opten por un empleo formal. 

Yanira, desea que uno de sus hijos sea médico, pero ella respeta la decisión que ellos tomen en el momento oportuno.
texts.en:
Yanira is 43 years old and is studying business administration. She is married, has two children and her husband works in transportation.

Yanira has worked from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. at the city hall for 16 years. Previously, she worked for a military detachment in the administrative area.

Yanira needs money to buy school supplies for her children at the start the school year. She wants to contribute to the education of her children so that they have a spiritual background and will obtain knowledge to be qualified for a formal job.

Yanira wants one of her children to be a doctor, but she respects the decisions that they make as they proceed.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
Radik is 49 years old, married and has two children. He lives with his family in the Baku region. One of his children is 18 years old, another child is 16 years old, and both of them are going to college. Radik's wife is a housewife. 

Radik is a master locksmith. He learned this profession from his father and loves his job. Today he wants to buy a new apparatus, which is necessary for his business. Therefore, Radik has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He says thank you to the Kiva organization and lenders for the help. In the future, he wants to hire an assistant and help his children with their education.

loans.use: to buy a new apparatus and increase his locksmith business, and in the future he wants to help his children with their education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is a handsome man. He was born in 1965. He is living in a village, and is married with three children. He is a farmer and likes to be an agrarian man. He works as hard and eagerly as he can. He feeds his family alone. His wife is not working, but she is helping him with his business. He is planting vegetables, cotton, wheat and plants in his yard. He gets a benefit from doing a business. He is planning to work and prepare the land for planting crops and seeds. Mahmud is requesting financial support to buy mineral fertilizers for preparing land for planting. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for preparing land for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
Mahliyo is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1993, and she lives with her parents in the countryside. Her father is a builder and her mother is a cook at a kindergarten. 

Mahliyo had a dream to be a tutor and to help kids. She graduated with excellence from school. Mahliyo tries her best to support and help her parents. Unfortunately, her parents do not earn enough money to enter their daughter into university. 

Mahliyo persuaded her parents to study and enter a university. She needed to pay tuition for the university, so she requested financial support to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es: Arsenio de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su taxi desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Arsenio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Arsenio is 57 year old and lives in his own house with his son. He has worked for ten years giving rides in his taxi. He has many customers who prefer him because of his responsible driving. With what he earns he is able to pay for household expenses. Arsenio is requesting a loan to buy tires and give maintenance to his vehicle, since this is his only source of work. He will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and give maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Hello, world.  Meet Joseph. He is a 24 year-old farmer from Kithakanoro village in the Central province of Kenya. He owns three acres of land that he uses to keep two cows named Kathurima and Mutembeyi (vernacular for 'black' and 'brown' respectively). On the land, he also grows maize, vegetables and trees, and soon enough bananas.  
Joseph has a great sense of direction since he started farming two years ago. He plans to keep diversifying his farm products so as to maintain a steady growth in income. 
Joseph is seeking a loan to grow bananas. The costs of starting banana farming has proven to be prohibitive even to those rural smallholder farmers with an existing cash flow: A lot of labor is required for banana seedbed preparation. With your loan, however, Joseph will have secured capital to get the banana farm going. 
He will use income from milk sales to make initial payments towards the loans as the banana trees mature. Income that he will generate from selling bananas will greatly boost his living standard.

loans.use: to plant more bananas

loans.name: Rehemah

texts.en: Rehemah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child. She has no additional members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for one year. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges includes seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and start planting green bananas. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and utilities.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Kipkoiyan is a typical village in the Kericho area of Kenya, where around 100 families live, suffering from poverty and malnutrition. Most of the people make their livelihood by working as labourers in the agricultural fields belonging to farmers in neighboring and more distant villages. 

Julius has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. To afford a decent and comfortable life for parents and siblings, he has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from his farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, he has been engaging in other small personal businesses. 

The Kericho area has high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from his region, Julius finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and he stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” His biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. He lacks funds to increase his poultry farming, so he is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being from a marginalized community, he finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, he feels relieved knowing that his dream will be achieved, and he will be able to buy more poultry. With the loan, he will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary man, he intends to accumulate more profits and expand his poultry business to other markets. This will increase his income and improve his living conditions. The extra income he will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing his living conditions, and securing the future of his school-going siblings who depend on him for school fees.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 32 years old.  She is married and has four children aged between 4 and 12 years.  The children attend school.  Francine has a bakery and  she has been in  business for three years.  With the loan, she would like to buy baking powder, sugar and bread to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy baking powder, sugar and bread to resell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is a responsive woman. She was born in 1982 and is living in a village. She is married and has two children. For about ten years, she has been in business. She is a sewer, and sews traditional women dresses. Firuza serves women and all her clients are satisfied with her work. The income that she gets from her activity is profitable, and it is enough for her to feed her family and partly support her husband. During the ten years in business her sewing machines became unusable. She needs financial support to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira is an honest woman. She was born in 1988. She lives in small town. She is single. She graduated with excellence the university. Now she is studying and getting a second graduation. Also, she is working at an industrial complex. She is a superior in her department. She studies well and works hard at the same time. She is responsive, well- behaved and a generous woman. She tries her best to be helpful. She likes to study and to learn more. She needs to pay tuition of the university. She is asking for financial support for tuition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats and cows to raise and sell them in his community.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
"Patrick is a 61-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of nine farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Patrick has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Patrick described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Patrick’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina has successfully built her business selling milk, with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of animal selling. She owns two buffaloes, seven goats and one cow. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She is in her fifth  loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that the increase in business will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for generating more income.

loans.name: Robai's Group

texts.en:
Robai, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Robai will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Robai plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Robai’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a 39-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Stephen has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming training.

Stephen described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Stephen’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, 49 years old, is a married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a garment shop. He offers a variety of garments and has a good client base. In order to meet customers’ demands he needs to purchase more variety. For this reason, Balqees has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband, who wants to buy more variety of clothes to consistently meet the increasing demand at his shop and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothes to consistently meet the increasing demand at his shop and improve his earnings.

loans.name: Imrana

texts.en: Imrana is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. The man shown in the picture is her husband who has been involved in a cloth sales business for five years. He purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in his own town. He has a strong customer base. Currently, Imrana has availed Murabaha of 35,000 PKR. Her husband utilized this loan amount to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors and stuffs to increase his sales. They expect a boost in earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors and stuffs to increase her husband's sales.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 37 year-old married woman who has five children. Her husband is running a business of furniture making. The man shown in the photo is Shehnaz’s husband. Over time, he has become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. For the improvement of her husband’s business, she has availed Murabaha of 25,000 PKR to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to cater to more customers without delay.  That will ultimately help in bringing more cash home.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to cater to more customers

loans.name: Wazeran

texts.en:
Wazeran, 62 years old, is a married woman. Her son (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

For this reason, Wazeran has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her son, who wants to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices, etc.

loans.name: Akeela

texts.en: 52-year-old Akeela is a married woman with two children; she is shown in the photo with her son. Her husband has been running a business of cosmetics sales for a period of about 10 years. He earns sufficient income to cover the family’s expenditures. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Akeela has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy new stock of cosmetics such as cleansers, lotions, lipsticks and makeup kits.  This will help him to increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy new stock of cosmetics such as cleansers, lotions, lipsticks and makeup kits.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Tucked away in the countryside near the Ainamoi, Kericho area of Kenya is a jobless man turned farmer named Christopher and his beautiful family. He is a hardworking man and aggressive with the principle of truth on his lips; he is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. 

Ainamoi lies in a valley. In this valley are a people who, in their totality, constitute wrenching statistics. Hardcore poverty pervades every homestead, yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of people; a sea of about 5,000 bright, vibrant, open faces, searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible. 

Armed with this conviction, Christopher has kept hope and has been toiling on his farm for the past five years. His primary source of income is milk, crops and some vegetables that he plants. He also engages in a personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture. Christopher practices agriculture with a difference; employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the many agricultural trainings he has been attending to broaden his skills. 

Although he earns handsome profits from farming, he faces one big challenge, and that is he lacks a proper and modern dairy unit. Cows in his farm are affected by harsh weather conditions; hence, they become sick. He also faces challenges of properly feeding and milking his cows. He is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. 

Cows require a proper resting place and proper food so that they can produce the maximum amount of milk. Without a proper dairy unit, cows will be affected with diseases, and also, they will not have a good place to rest and feed, and that will result in a low production of milk. Christopher feels relieved knowing that there are partners such as Kiva lenders who assist aspiring men such as himself to achieve their dreams. With your loan, Christopher is going to change his life permanently. The increased income from high milk production will be used in paying back the loan fully and improving his living standards.

loans.use: To build a proper and modern dairy unit

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 30 years old and is married with a 2-year-old child. She sells shoes and she has been in the business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to used to reinvest and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a smallholder farmer based in Kaptumo village in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She owns a 2-acre piece of land that she uses to grow maize, keep three dairy animals and eight poultry birds. She has also planted  trees for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. Not only does the land provide her with capital for her business, but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have three children with a husband to whom she has stayed married for 25 years! Mary is seeking a loan to purchase cereal seeds. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for food and business. The demand for cereals in the Nandi Hills market, only a few kilometers from Mary’s home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Your loan will directly elevate Mary’s livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she had.

loans.use: To purchase cereal seeds

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a thirty-seven-year-old male married with three children, living in Kasese Uganda.
Julius runs a cutlery shop, a business that he has operated for seven years plus a salary job for additional income. He has a dream of having a model cutlery shop in the area. However, he is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Julius needs a loan to buy glasses, plates, spoons, forks and other items to resell.

loans.use: to buy glasses, plates, spoons, forks and other items to resell.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Mary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married and has three children. Mary has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Mary isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has learned  a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, Mary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Mary's Group will purchase a total of 14 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a 56-year-old proud mother of 10 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mwanahawa  has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Mwanahawa described her harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mwanahawa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a 52-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Josephine has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Josephine described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Josephine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nawf Al- Mater Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nawf Al- Mater. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.
Latifa is the leader of the group. She is a married woman, living with her family in a poor area. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, and she works as a housewife. The house where she lives with her family is old and needs a renovation. Most of rooms are without doors, and that makes the winds come easily inside the house. 

She doesn't have sufficient money to make the necessary renovations to the house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase new doors for the house. Latifa's dream is completing all of the renovations on the inside of the house and furnishing the house.

loans.use: To purchase new doors for the house.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira, 34 years old, is a married woman. Her brother (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

For this reason, Sumaira has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her brother, who wants to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices, etc.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 45 years old, married and the mother of four children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled vehicle. He has earned a living as a driver for many years as a way to meet family expenses, but his vehicle now requires maintenance to stay in proper condition. For this reason, Razia is requesting a Murabaha loan for 30,000 PKR for her husband, so that he can provide better service by buying new tires and a new auto body for his rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a new auto body

loans.name: Goycak

texts.en:
Goycak is a 47 year-old-woman. She is living in Baku region with her lovely family consisting of herr husband and two children, aged 19 and 17 years old. Her elder son is going to college and her younger son is going to eleventh class. In the future he wants to be a programmer. 
The family members are refuges from Xocali city for over 22 years and they live like IDP (Internally Displaced Persons). Goycak has been in poultry business for many years. She raises chickens and sells their eggs and meat. Today, to expand her poultry farm she needs a loan in the amount of 2200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Goycak is very grateful to Kiva organization and lenders for their helps.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farm to increase business. In the future she want help to her children with their education .

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking married man who used the previous loan to plant maize to sell. He was very successful that season because he managed to get profits that aided him to plan for another season and save for school fees for his children. His family dream is to educate his children to university and his business dream is to diversify his farming. John intends to use this loan to buy herbicides for spraying his tomatoes for better yields.

loans.use: to buy herbicides for spraying his tomatoes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells fried cassava, pancakes, and other snacks at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, baking flour, packing bags, and spices. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, baking flour, packing bags, and spices

loans.name: Donagul

texts.ru:
Her name is Donagul. She is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Children study the high school. Donagul and her family lives in the district of Vakhsh. Vakhsh located in the south-western part of Tajikistan.
Donagul for about 5 years of experience in animal husbandry, she raises livestock. Donagul taught this activity from parents.
The reason for her to apply for a loan is a business expansion. She wants at the expense of the loan to increase revenue and improve the living conditions of the family.
texts.en:
Donagul is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her children study at the high school. 

Donagul and her family live in the district of Vakhsh. Vakhsh is located in the southwestern part of Tajikistan.

Donagul has about five years of experience in animal husbandry; she raises livestock. She learned this activity from her parents.

The reason for her to apply for a loan is a business expansion. She wants the proceeds from the loan to increase her revenue and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and expand her activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase some goats to raise and resell

loans.name: Rahib

texts.en: Rahib is married, 31 years old, and has two children. His elder son goes to fourth class, and his younger son goes to first class. Rahib’s wife is a nurse in a local polyclinic. Rahib's family has been IDP (Internally Displacted Persons) from Fuzuli city for 22 years. Now they live in Baku region. Rahib is a taxi driver and transports passengers between different areas of Baku region. He wants to buy new wheels. For this reason, he applied for a loan amount of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is thankful to Kiva and Komak organizations for help.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and increase business. In the future, he wants help to his children in their education.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, 47, is a smallholder farmer in Chemamui village in the Southern Rift Valley area of Kenya. Chemamui village is a high-altitude mountainous region whose agriculture is sustained by heavy rainfall throughout the year. Like most farmers there, Thomas is a mixed farmer; he keeps animals and grows crops as well. 

Thomas is seeking capital in form of a loan investment that he will focus on crop cultivation. He is looking to grow the horticultural section of his farm to make it as productive as the dairy sector. In doing this, he will boost his income and mitigate risks associated in putting all eggs in one basket. Besides, he is growing old and grazing animals in a steep contour strip of land is becoming less fun for him. 

Your contribution toward this loan will help Thomas make more income to support his family, which consists of his wife of 30 years and 5 children aged between 17 and 30.

loans.use: to grow crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist in paying for materials needed for clothing fairs and additional stock.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 26 years old. She is not married. She sells shoes and she has been in the business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married with five children aged between 7 and 17 years old. He also does farming, whereby he grows maize on a large scale for both selling and home consumption. He usually complains of the bad roads that hinder his service delivery. In spite of this, Robert is a loving father who would love to have a healthy family and a good retirement. He will use the loan to prepare his farm for the coming season.

loans.use: to prepare his farm for the coming season.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a special-needs client from Iraq. He is a 40-year-old married man with four children. Ali is a beekeeper and he raises honey bees. He got this profession from his father a long time ago. Now he has great experience and a good reputation in the surrounding area. Ali applied for a loan of $3,000 USD to buy hives and build a roof. He aims to grow his business and buy more hives to increase his production. Then he will be able to increase his profits, which will help him to have better living standards and a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy hives and build a roof

loans.name: Getrida

texts.en: Getrida is a rural resident in the Kakasi parish in the Kamwenge district. She is married with eight children, six of whom are in school. She runs a retail shop where she earns income to look after her family. She supports this with income from agriculture. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to help her to add more stock to her business. This will help her increase her working capital, since she also expects to increase her sales because people will be buying a lot of items during the back-to-school season. She will be able to make enough profit to take her children back to school. Her major challenge is limited capital to run her business, since she also has to pay school fees for her children. Getrida is a very honest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items like sugar, books, soap, bread, toiletries, among other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to use in his garage.

loans.name: Jacqcline

texts.en:
Jacqcline is a single woman and has two children whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With a loan of Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан 52 года, замужем, 4 детей. У Уулкан среднее образование. Она по характеру: ответственная и целеустремленная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес 30 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Уулкан в хозяйстве имеется: 1 корова, 20 овец, а также есть земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, на котором она выращивает фасоль. Ее деятельность приносит около 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади. Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Uulkan is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education.  By nature, she is responsible and focused on her goals.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for many years already (she started 30 years ago), and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns one cow, 20 sheep, and she also grows beans on two hectares of land.  Her farming activity brings her a monthly income of about 25,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy a horse.  Uulkan is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one horse in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran is a 55-year-old IDP farmer. He is married and has two kids. The family is IDPs and lives in an IDP settlement. Tehran does everything in order to provide for his family. He keeps small lambs and fattens them. Then he sells the lambs to local cafes and at the local bazaar. 

Lambs are in high demand because their meat is very tasty and things made from wool are warm and comfy. Tehran enjoys his job very much. He is a very friendly and cheerful man. He takes care of his lambs and tries to raise them to be healthy and strong. He applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to buy a lamb and two cows. He loves farming very much and wants to increase his farm and build a big farm for livestock in the future. He hopes lenders help him.

loans.use: to buy a lamb and two cows

loans.name: Elyunora

texts.ru: Элянора, 27 лет, замужем, мать четверых детей (1 сын и 3 дочери). Образование-среднее. Элянора на протяжении 9 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом (KGS). Элянора знает чего хочет и старается добиваться всего своими силами. Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности Элянора на сегодняшний день имеет хорошее хозяйство: корову, 5 лошадей и 6 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 11,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элянора обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Элянора планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Elyunora is 27 years old, married, and the mother of four children (one son and three daughters).  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for the past nine years, having started in this business with an initial capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Elyunora knows what she wants, and she tries to achieve everything on her own.  Thanks to her constant work and sense of responsibility, she has managed to develop a strong farming business: she owns one cow, five horses and six sheep.  Her family's monthly incomes comes to 11,500 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her activity, Elyunora has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some livestock.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Love Lom Group

texts.en:
Nengneilhing, 24 years old, is the representative of the group ‘LOVE’ consisting of five members. She is pictured with her hand raised in the photograph. They liver e in the hilly region of Manipur, in the northeastern part of India. Nengneilhing is a married woman and her husband is working as a missionary with a monthly income of 6,000 INR. She opened a small medical store in her village and provides health care facilities to the people. Both of them dedicate their life to the betterment of the village within their capability. Since there is no other medical store available in her village, she aspired to expand her medical store to meet the needs of the people. But her plans were left undone because of her financial difficulties. As most of the villagers are engaged in daily wage earnings, they do not get time to buy the medicines of their choice at other places when there is lack of medicines at her store. So the villagers have to bear the consequences of limited medication choices. 

She took this problem as her own since she belongs to the same village and began to think of putting more varieties of medicines in her store. This will help both her and the villagers to meet their needs. Her Kiva loan will be used to buy the necessary medicines for her store. It will provide the people with sufficient medicine and at the same time, she can make more profit. She expresses her heartfelt gratitude to WSDS for the loans they provide, which have made her life much better and well settled.

loans.use: To purchase stock of medicines (tablets, syrups, ointments) to restock her medical store (pharmacy).

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 27 years old and not yet married. He has a shop and he has been in business for one year. With the loan, he would like to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr:
Madame Marie est une dame tés engagée dans les activités du banc villageois, son activité connait une bonne amélioration et elle reste une femme exemplaire et soucieuse du devenir de sa famille. Elle est mariée, mère de 06 enfants dont 04 filles et 02 garçons. Elle est propriétaire d’un frigo où  elle vend des jus à bas de produits locaux et crème glacée pour enfant. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années. Elle compte aussi s’investir dans la vente de légumes. 

Avec son crédit, elle prévoit d’acheter 10 sacs de singe, du sucre, divers colorants alimentaires et 150 000 Fr CFA de légumes frais, 10 sacs d’oseille sec et divers produits de consommation..

Avec les bénéfices,  elle compte assurer la prise en charge alimentaire, sanitaire et vestimentaire pour ces enfants d’une part et d’autre part renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: Ms. Marie is a woman who is very involved in her banc villageois's activities. Her business has known great improvement and she remains an exemplary woman and very caring about her family's future. She is married and the mother of six children, of which four are girls and two are boys. She is the owner of a refrigerator from which she sells juices made from local products and ice cream for children. She has enjoyed a great experience in this domain, having worked in it for several years. She also expects to put money into the sale of vegetables. With her loan, she plans to buy ten bags of baobab, some sugar, various food dyes, 150,000 francs CFA of fresh vegetables, ten bags of dried sorrel and various consumer products. With part of the profits, she expects to ensure that the food, sanitary and clothing needs of her children are taken care of and with the other part she expects to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to purchase ten bags of baobab, some sugar, various food dyes, 150,000 francs CFA of fresh vegetables, ten bags of dried sorrel and various consumer products.

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy is a young resident of the J.Rumy district in Tajikistan.  She is 20 years old, lives with her husband, and together they are engaged in the livestock business.  Tursunoy began working with livestock 1 year ago and has had positive results.  Thanks to this business, they have improved their life. 

At the moment Tursunoy's activity is growing, but she wants to expand more and earn a good income.  She likes milking cows and providing her family with milk and dairy products.  She is taking a loan to buy a few head of cattle to expand her livestock business.  She hopes you will see her request and lend your support.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Aymama

texts.en:
Aymama is 45 years old. She lives in the J. Rumi district. She is married and has three children. Her two sons and husband immigrated to Russia. They are working there to earn money. For the second year, she is engaged in a livestock business.  She learned this activity with the help of her father. 

Aymama is an honest and polite woman. She always has to care for her animals and like her works very much. This kind of business gives her a good income. Today, Aymama wants to significantly increase her livestock and develop her family's economy. She hopes that with the support of Kiva lenders, she will be successful in her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a married man and has four school-going children. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a business buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. He faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in his place of operation. 


With the loan of 50,000 that he is requesting, he wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Theodette

texts.en: Theodette is 46 years old and married. She sells shoes and she has been in the business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Bujubuli Abango Clan Development Group

texts.en: Patrick is a member of a group and a very hardworking married man living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He acquired his start-up capital from farming. He opened up a retail shop for general merchandise to serve the people in his village and the surrounding areas. Patrick has had the challenge of inadequate capital and the problem of price fluctuations due to inflation, hence high prices for the commodities. In the future, he wants to become a wholesaler. Therefore, Patrick is requesting a loan under the Bujubuli Abango Clan Development to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil for the retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil for the retail shop.

loans.name: Boneface

texts.en:
Bonefas comes from the Kanyamuroba cell in Kamwenge district. He is married and has three children who are all in school.
He operates a retail shop where he earns income to look after his family. He supports this with a piggery project in the village. He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to help him add more stock of stationery, sugar, soda, corn, and flour to sell in his business. He will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children.
His major challenge is poor transportation from his area of operation to town where he usually goes shopping. He is a very honest and hard working man.

loans.use: to buy retail stock.

loans.name: Kodjema Group

texts.fr: Magnamada, membre représentatif, est une femme battante, mariée et mère de  7 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle fait le commerce du charbon de bois depuis 15 ans. Tous les ménages burkinabés n'ont pas la possibilité d’utiliser le gaz butane donc Magnamada leur rend un service. Elle a besoin du prêt pour acheter 40 sacs de charbon pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Avec son commerce, elle arrive a aidé son époux gardien a géré sa famille. Après les ventes, les bénéfices lui permettront de continuer son commerce et s'occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en: Magnamada, the representative member, is an energetic woman, married and the mother of seven children, all of whom are in school. She has sold charcoal for fifteen years. None of the households in Burkina Faso have the possibility of using butane gas, so Magnamada provides them with a service. She needs a loan to buy forty bags of charcoal to meet the needs of her clientele. With her business, she has started helping her caretaker spouse to manage their family. After the sales, the profits will allow her to continue her business and to see to her children.

loans.use: to purchase 40 bags of charcoal to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Kafunda Small Christian Community Group

texts.en: Robert is a 32-year-old man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been trading in agricultural produce for now eight years. He started by carrying out farming, basically maize, beans and Irish potatoes on a commercial basis and eventually he opened up a store of produce.  He has the challenge of inadequate capital to meet the demands of his customers. He has a personal goal to move to other places for wider coverage and for better earnings. He is very committed towards his business and to Kafunda group of which he is a member. Robert wants a loan to buy produce such as maize, coffee and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize, coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley, 31, is a smallholder farmer from Kibianga division in the South Rift region of Kenya. Wesley started farming 14 years ago when he was still trying to set himself up for family life. Four years later, he married a lovely lady by the name of Mercy, to whom he is committed to this day. Together, they have three children; the youngest is five and the oldest is 10 years old. The family lives on a 0.5 acre farm together with cows and poultry. Wesley also grows vegetables and bananas.

Wesley is seeking a loan investment from Kiva for growing fodder on his farm. It is much cheaper for a small scale farmer to dedicate a small portion of his farm and grow fodder than to purchase feed from the market. 

Your loan will uplift Wesley to a position where he will make more returns from his dairy enterprise, afford to get more earth space and grow more fodder in the near future. Excess fodder can be sold at the market where the demand never plummets.

loans.use: To grow fodder

loans.name: Fatoumata Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 01 Juin 2007, et vient d’entamer son quatorzième cycle. Malgré les difficultés de la zone à maintenir une activité génératrice de revenues, ces membres sont d’une détermination assez solide et très courageux. Les membres sont solidaires entre eux et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce, accompagné de la culture sous pluie.

 Madame Fatoumata (assise à  droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 58 ans, est veuve, en plus de ses enfants elle prend en charge 03 de ses petits enfants. Elle est vendeuse de légumes et d’huile de palme qu’elle achète au marché international pour la revente dans son village. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années. 
 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des légumes frais pour une valeur de 100 000 Fr CFA et 07 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme.

Les bénéfices lui serviront de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: This group was created on June 1, 2007 and is starting on its fourteenth loan cycle. Despite the zone's difficulties in maintaining a revenue-generating business, these members are very courageous and solid in their determination. The members are united together and live in the same village. The main businesses are small shops, along with rainy season farming. Ms. Fatoumata (seated to the right with her left hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 58 years old, widowed, and cares for three of her small children. She is a saleswoman of vegetables and palm oil, which she buys at the international market for resale in her village. She has enjoyed a great experience in this field having worked in it for several years. With this loan, she expects to buy fresh vegetables for a value of 100,000 francs CFA and seven 20-liter barrels of palm oil. The profits will serve to better care for the needs of her family and to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to purchase some fresh vegetables for a value of 100,000 francs CFA and seven 20-liter barrels of palm oil.

loans.name: Ramia

texts.en: Ramia is a 28-year-old married woman, from the village Nazarlo. She has two children and a husband, who is a private artisan and generates a small income. Ramia works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing greens seasonally and trading with them. However, the family doesn't have a large enough income for living in normal living conditions or for covering all daily expenses. Ramia has a great desire to expand her agribusiness and start farming. She sought credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The startup program that is the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 GEL for purchasing cattle and starting to sell it to the local market for increased prices. The loan will greatly assist Ramia and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life, especially a good education for her children. Ramia awaits your support.

loans.use: to start trading with cattle and expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: Angella is a new client with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. She is 35 years old, married to Stephen and they have five children all below the ages of 18 years and still school-going, She is a farmer who grows bananas for both home consumption and sale of surplus. She needs the money to buy mulch for this banana plantation so that she can increase her yields and income. She is hard working and resilient. Pictured from right is Angella, her husband and the guarantor. They all signed the waiver form.

loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs. 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is single with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her mother). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from selling chicken. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
In Kenyan villages where smallholding is commonly practised, most smallholders do keep some poultry, especially chickens. Ezekiel, who started 10 years ago on a 0.7 acre land, says he keeps cows and poultry and grows maize. He prefers to have his main income sources diversified to spread risk and make more income out of the limited land space he has. He is particularly appreciative of the the role poultry plays in his farm; Chickens provide his family of a wife and four children with the meat and eggs they need on little area.  

Ezekiel is seeking a loan to purchase more heads of poultry. More heads of poultry will certainly increase the quantity of meat and eggs produced on the farm. The surplus of what his family consumes will be sold to the market. Income from this investment will help him to meet his family's basic needs and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 32 years old and she is married. She sells vegetables and she has been in business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy onions, collards and cabbages to resell. The profits from the business will used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy onions, collards and cabbages to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de: comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and lives in her own home along with her life companion. She has a store at her place of residence that she has managed for the past 10 years. Maria has many customers, especially her neighbors. The income she earns is used to cover the expenses that she incurs.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products. As a result, Maria can earn more income so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Filerma Narciza

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
En este lugar vive la  señora Filerma, tiene 56 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Ella aprendió hace varios años corte y confección en una Academia.
Doña Filerma es modista y tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, ella también le da parte del crédito a uno de sus hijos el cual tiene un taller de metalmecánica, ella trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, lleva más de 22 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, cierres, latas, pinturas y otros materiales que su hijo utiliza. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Amigas Trabajadoras” (Working Friends) meets every 15 days in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place where a wide variety of sweets are prepared. These products are known nationally for their delicious flavor.

Sra. Filerma lives in this place. She is 56 years old, divorced, and has four grown children. One child still lives with her. Several years ago, she learned sewing and fashion design at an academy.

Doña Filerma is a seamstress and has a small sewing workshop where she has spent many years producing all types of clothes. She works by taking orders from individual customers. Filerma will give part of her loan to one of her children who has a metalsmith shop. She works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 10 P.M. and sometimes much later when she has orders to deliver. Filerma has been in this business for more than 22 years and it has allowed her to get ahead.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics, thread, zippers, as well as tin, paints, and other materials for her son to use. Filerma is a founding member of her Communal Bank and she enjoys being a member because of the help the loans have provided. Her dreams include providing the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, zippers, as well as tin, paints, and other materials for her son's business.

loans.name: Jaime Reynaldo

texts.es:
Jaime Reynaldo tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Las actividades principales que realizan los habitantes de esta zona son el comercio y la agricultura.

El se dedica al comercio de productos de granos como maíz, fréjol, menestras, café, etc, según campaña de cada producto. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y comercio de cuyes. Cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona.
