El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como maíz, café, menestras, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su negocio. Con esto Jaime Reynaldo espera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y satisfacer sus gustos y preferencias, logrando de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime Reynaldo is 28 years old and married. He lives with his wife and child in the District of Pucará in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The main business activities that the local residents engage in are trade and agriculture.

Jaime Reynaldo sells staple products such as corn, beans, legumes, coffee, and other goods according to the season for each product. In addition, he raises and sells guinea pigs. He has more than three years of experience in this business and he has excellent personal and work-related references who are from this area.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of a large quantity of products such as corn, coffee, legumes, and other items so that he can increase the inventory of his business. With this loan, Jaime Reynaldo hopes to offer a wider variety of products to his customers and satisfy their tastes and preferences. As a result, he expects to increase his earnings and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy corn, coffee, legumes, and other staple goods.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim  a 55-year-old married man and lives with his family. He has two sons. The family is IDPs and lives in an IDP settlement. Ibrahim does everything in order to provide for his family. He has raised sheep and lambs for 17 years.  He sells the lambs to local cafes and at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN.  It is not enough money to provide for his family.

Lamb is in high demand because their meat is very tasty and things made from wool are warm and comfortable. Ibrahim enjoys his job very much. He is a very friendly and cheerful man. He takes care of his lambs and tries to raise them to be healthy and strong. 

He applied for a   700  AZN loan to buy a lamb. He loves farming  and wants to increase his farm and build a big farm for livestock in the future. He hopes lenders help him.

loans.use: to  build a big farm for livestock.

loans.name: Rubango Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Margret is a 31-year-old hard working business woman with 2 children who are 4 and 2 years old.  They live in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She is happily married and earns a living growing Irish potatoes.  She is faced with the problem of weather changes which at times affects crops negatively.  Margret is an honest woman and is a member of the group where every member guarantees each other to repay a loan. 

Margret wants a loan to buy Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Jonan

texts.en:
Jonan is a 28-year-old married  male  living in Kasese Uganda. He has operated a mobile money shop for five years.  He also earns a salary as an additional source of income. 

His  dream is to  become a money lender. However, he has limited capital. Jonan will use the money to increase his mobile money business.

loans.use: to improve his mobile money business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Reina is 41 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She has been selling clothes for the past six years from her business that is located at the municipal market. Reina has many customers because of the good prices.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk so that she can continue her sales and have more income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Siria Paola

texts.es:
Siria es una mujer de 24 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos varones de las edades de 2 y 8 años, su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es una mujer joven, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sivingani’ un área rural que se caracteriza por su crecimiento y por su potencial comercial y productivo. Ubicado en un valle semi-tropical, dónde la venta de comida es abundante, variada y todo se acompaña con chicha (bebida fermentada de maíz). De clima templado durante todo el año.
Siria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo  habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al transporte público, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ella vive en la casa de la familia de su esposo con quien se lleva bien, su actividad es la venta de comida que la realiza junto a su suegra quien le ayuda, solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos por mayor para la elaboración se sus platillos, como aceite y abarrotes, ella vende a medio día según menú que varía todos los días.
texts.en:
Siria, 24, is married and has two sons, ages 2 and 8.  She runs a food business.  She is a young, responsible, hard-working entrepreneur and her business is set up in "Sivingani", a rural area known for its growth and commercial and productive potential.  The setting is a semi-tropical valley where food sales are abundant and varied, and usually accompanied by chicha (fermented corn drink).  The climate is warm all year round.

Siria has a dark complexion, long black hair and speaks Spanish on a general cultural level and for the commerce she does.  She shares her life with her husband who works in public transportation.  They live in a brick house which has basic utilities.  The house belongs to her husband's family whom she gets along well with.  

Siria sells food with the help of her mother-in-law.  The loan she is requesting is to buy goods wholesale such oil and groceries to make different dishes.  Her lunches vary every day depending on the menu.

loans.use: To buy goods such as potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Denish

texts.en:
Denish is a married 34 year old father of five, whose children are aged between five and 12 years old. He lives with his family in Kampala, but is originally from Northern Uganda.  He holds a diploma in Law which he wants to upgrade to a Bachelor’s degree and he is currently saving money to make this possible. 

Denish started out in business as an entrepreneur selling tea flasks in Kampala. While doing this, he met another micro-entrepreneur, who works for UpEnergy, and assisted him for one week. Realizing that the demand for the product was high, and that he enjoyed selling energy-efficient stoves, Denish decided to become an UpEnergy distribution partner as well. He has been successfully selling UpEnergy products for three years. He attributes his success to the uniqueness of the product on the Ugandan market as well as appreciates the well managed operations at UpEnergy which provides  quick and reliable service.
 
In addition to earning a living from the sale of these stoves, he believes that  protecting the environment by reducing deforestation is the biggest benefit of selling energy-efficient stoves. He is also proud to be able to improve the livelihood of people in the communities who are able to save from improved fuel use. These savings are being channeled to other expenses like school fees for children and housing expenses.

He aspires to extend his business and distribution network and eventually own his own sales store.  
His dream is to improve the education in his home area of  Northern Uganda, a region that was plagued with civil strife for over 20 years by setting up a school in the future.

The KIVA loan will make it possible for Denish to improve his business and allow him to increase his stock, so that he saves time and transportation cost by not having to travel as often to replenish his stock in order to meet the high demand for stoves.  A portion of the loan will also go towards leasing a space that he can use as a storefront both to warehouse product and also serve as a central point of sale for customers. The KIVA loan will also enable Denish to invest in basic marketing materials, such as business cards, T-Shirts and other promotional items. These important steps will help him to scale up his business considerably.

loans.use: to increase his business.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es: Marta de 69 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nuera, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 30 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta, 69, lives in her own house with her son and daughter-in-law.  She has a small store set up at home and has been in business for 30 years.  She has many customers, especially her neighbors, because of her low prices.

The loan she is requesting is to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. and improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Nely Graciela

texts.es:
Nely es una mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de carne de llama.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Corqueamaya’ que se encuentra ubicado en cercanías al lago Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; camélido, vacuno, ovino y porcino, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales, tubérculos y cereales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc., de clima frío y seco; con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados, donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Nely es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, de baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general, su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y junto a sus dos niños, ambos estudian en la escuela. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de carne de llama; esta tiene un mayor contenido de proteínas en relación con otras carnes, y el bajo contenido de su grasa no incide en la formación de colesterol, es sana ya que no tiene ninguna enfermedad contagiosa que pueda poner en peligro la salud, y es muy popular la elaboración de charque de llama que consisten el el salado y deshidratación de esta. “la carne de llama es muy popular, por sus características nutricionales y se puede cocinar de mil maneras…” comenta. Actualmente no cuenta con sierra cortadora de carne, realiza el trabajo de forma manual con un cuchillo y una pequeña hacha, sus clientes son fieles y constantes. Su sueño es tener una carnicería amplia y desea realizar la compra de una sierra cortadora de carne para proveer del producto con mayor higiene. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nely solicita un préstamo para la compra de una sierra cortadora de carne para vender carne de llama de mejor manera.
texts.en:
Nely, 32, is married and has two children, ages 13 and 10.  She sells llama meat for a living.  She is an enterprising, independent, responsible, hard-working, good mother.  Her business is set up in the community of "Corqueamaya" which is located near Lake Titicaca.  It is an agricultural area where livestock such as cattle, camelids, sheep and pigs are raised.  People also live from fishing and growing vegetables, tubers and cereals such as quinoa, freeze-dried potatoes, broad beans, potatoes, etc.  The climate is cold and dry and the temperature varies during the day 1-12 degrees Celsius, and the sunshine beats down very hard on the surface.

Nely has a dark complexion and wears her long black hair braided.  She is short and her mother tongue is Aymará which is spoken locally, although she speaks Spanish for general culture purposes.  She shares her life with her husband who works in agriculture and their two children who attend school.  They live in their own brick house which has well water and electricity.  

She sells llama meat which has more proteins than other meats and it is low in fat which prevents cholesterol.  It is healthy and has no contagious diseases that can put health at risk.  It is very popular to make "charque" which is salted, dried version of the meat.  "Llama meat is very popular because of its nutritional characteristics and it can be cooked a thousand ways..." she says.

Since she does not have a meat cutter she cuts the meat with a knife and small hatchet.  Her customers are loyal and steady.  Her dream is to have a larger butcher shop and to buy a meat cutter for greater hygiene.  This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the nine years she has been in business.

Nely is requesting the loan to buy a meat cutter so she can sell llama meat better.

loans.use: To buy a meat cutter.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 37-year-old married  woman living with her husband ( a car mechanic) and four children.  The children attend school.

 In 2009, she began to grow vegetables in a small area adjacent to her house so that she could  increase the family’s income and improve the living conditions. 

Malak says that she doesn’t have enough money to continue with her business properly and this is why she wants to borrow from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.  She will use the loan to purchase seed and fertilizer to produce more and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a thirty-five-year old single woman one child, living in Kasese Uganda.  

Jane operates a bar, she has been in that business for two years. She has a dream of becoming a well established business with a fully stocked bar that will attract more customers and increase her sales and profits. She is faced with the challenge of seasonal changes and clients who default on payments. 

She is a hard working woman and needs a loan  facility to buy beer, liquor, and wine.  Jane used the previous loan to buy a freezer.

loans.use: to buy beer, liquor, and wine.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank SAN VALENTIN.  She alternates her daily activities with her activity of selling clothing.  She has been in business for quite some time and it is going well for her because of her hard work.  She sells her goods to customers like friends and relatives, among others.  She wants to continue this work so she can support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy jackets and other clothing.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy jackets and other clothing.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Juhudi Kilimo formed a partnership with Kiva in order to help source funds for smallholder rural farmers.

Robert, 28, wants to access financing to generate an income. Robert owns a 0.5 acre farmland to raise cattle, poultry and sheep and grow various crops. 

The farm has progressed  greatly compared to it's beginning 6 years ago. Much credit also goes to his wife, Gladys.  The couple has children who are 4 month and 3 years old. 

Robert seeks a loan investment from Kiva lenders to expand his greenhouse. Growing of crops inside a greenhouse is more lucrative since the farmer has a higher degree of control on environmental factors within the glasshouse. 

Ground work on the additional greenhouse space has already started. Your loan investment is needed to complete the remaining part of the project.   Robert has planned to make loan payments using income generated from his other income sources which include sale of last season's produce. Income from this investment will help him raise the family's living standards. The greenhouse will enable Robert to sell fresh produce all year round.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 24-year-old  woman from the Bolnisi district. She lives with her husband and father-in-law. Both family members have stable jobs and generate a fixed salary. This region has a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  Nino decided to start a business with a loan but the local credit providers  require the borrower to have experience and a stable income. Nino's credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Nino plans to start a business to raise pigs.  This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. The Start Up program will enable Nino to save money and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 38-year-old married man with four children, living with his family in the city of Haja, Yemen. He is a farmer. Mohammed has raised goats for seven years and buys them to raise until a specific time of the year that the goat prices are higher.  He then goes to the local market to sell his goats. 

Mohammed wants to earn more income this year and buy  small goats. He needs a loan of 98,000 YER to purchase goats to raise and resale them.

Mohammed wishes to have a large number of goats.

loans.use: to purchase  goats.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, all attend school. She takes care of two additional family members. 

She has operated a home-based restaurant for the last eighteen years and works six days a week. 

Rose has requested  300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bananas, rice, beef, flour, and cooking oil. She generates additional income through frying cassava chips. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations include owning  her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has electricity and but not running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: to buy bananas, rice, beef, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Maria Clemencia

texts.es: Maria de 33 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, vende una variedad de productos a buen precio, por eso posee muchos clientes, Maria esta solicitando un crédito paa la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. todo por mayor para tener mejores ganancias y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria, 33, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her four children.  She runs a small store set up in her home and has been in business for several years.  She sells a variety of products at a low price and therefore has many customers.

The loan Maria is requesting is to buy wholesale soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to improve her earnings and enjoy a more stable economy.

loans.use: To buy wholesale soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Souraya

texts.en:
Souraya is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband (a painter) and two children.  The children attend school. 

She has ten years of experience as a saleswoman and in 2009, she was able to become the owner of a clothing and gift store. Souraya  need to acquire more clothing and gadgets and believes that the Kiva loan will augment her sales and income. 

In the future, Souraya says that she will add woman's shoes into her store to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and gadgets.

loans.name: Ghouroub

texts.en:
Ghouroub is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She has three children who attend school.   She has been a private teacher since 2008. She likes her occupation and she is a hard worker who does her best to  support her family no matter what. 

She requests  a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a laptop to  develop her professional teaching skills. Ghouroub is very positive and thankful for Kiva lenders for the support which she will get financially and morally.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a hardworking man living in Masindi-Uganda.  He is married and has 10 children,  5 are school-age.

He sells general merchandise and raises livestock to earn an income. He wishes to build a permanent house and educate his children.  He does not have the capital to do this and will use the loan to buy tea leaves, sugar, and soap.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman with four children. 

Eight years ago, she began a home-based business  to produce food. These traditional provisions are prepared very carefully, are well preserved, and they are very tasty and in demand. 

Aman needs pots, jars,  and bottles and requests a loan to acquire these items.

In the future, Aman states that she will ask for additional Kiva loans in order to  open a store to better display her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase pots, jars, and  bottles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Noe Abed

texts.es: Noe de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar (guacales, escobas, ollas, sartenes, platos, etc.) desde hace 5 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas artículos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Noe is 49 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his family. Noe has been making a living selling household items (such as crates, dustpans, pots and pans, dishes, and more) for five years. He runs his business out of his home. Noe is applying for this loan in order to buy more household items in bulk in order to continue with his sales and thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more household products (crates, dustpans, pots and pans, dishes, and more) in bulk.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 45-year-old Lebanese single woman who lives with one relative. She has owned a bakery since 2009 and produces tasty pastries.   She is well known for her friendliness , hospitality and generosity. 

She  requests a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy an oven and specialized machinery designed to ease pastry preparation. Mariam is pretty sure that this loan will help her serve more clients and increase her  income.

loans.use: to buy an oven and specialized machinery.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y vanta de productos de belleza, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante . La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas,blusas y polos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda continues to work at her business selling clothes and beauty products. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman and she wants to move forward with this business. Hilda is applying for a loan in order to buy sweatshirts, blouses and t-shirts.

Hilda is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy sweatshirts, blouses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Julio Demetrio

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Julio, el socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
El socio continua con su negocio de alquiler de computadoras en sus  cabinas de internet en un cibercafé, el socio Julio está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en el mantenimiento de su actividad económica, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de las maquinas.
texts.en:
Julio is a member of the "Kanchary" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

He continues to work at his renting computers for internet use in an internet café. Julio is very grateful to Kiva for helping him to keep his work going. Julio has had the business for quite some time and it is going very well thanks to his determination.

Julio is applying for a loan in order to carry out maintenance on computers.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on computers.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Rossana, pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
La socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia Rossana está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica, la socia continua vendiendo arroz,azúcar,leche entre  otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche, gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en:
Rossana is a member of the "Kanchary" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

She continues to work at her grocery store. Rossana is very grateful for this help from Kiva to strengthen her business. Rossana continues to sell rice, sugar, milk and other products. This business allows Rossana to move ahead with her family.

Rossana is applying for a loan in order to buy milk, fizzy drinks and other items.

loans.use: to buy milk, fizzy drinks and other items.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  KANCHARY, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
El socio continua trabajando en una empresa privada, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio continua trabajando para esta empresa el cual el va bien y le trae satisfacciones personales, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico.
texts.en:
Jaime is a member of the "Kanchary" communal bank in the department of Cusco, Peru.

He continues to work at a private sector business. He is very grateful for this loan and promises to make his repayments. Jaime continues with his job; he enjoys it and it is going very well. Jaime is responsible and persevering. This job allows Jaime to move forward with his family.

Jaime is applying for a loan in order to buy an electrical appliance.

loans.use: to buy an electrical appliance.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Alicia se dedica al negocio de venta de pescado, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el pescado. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pescado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia has a business selling fish. She is very enterprising and hard-working and, through this business, wants to move forward. Alicia's dream is to have premises where she can sell fish. Alicia is applying for this loan in order to buy fish.

Alicia is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, es casado, con su esposa ya han procreado un hijo, tienen un hogar muy unido y ambos se encargan de cubrir todas las necesidades familiares, don Juan con ayuda de su esposa realiza la venta de tamales y el destazo de cerdos, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el negocio.
Está solicitando capital para comprar cerdos, hojas de banano, condimentos, maíz, verduras, etc., para continuar realizando sus actividades y llevar el sustento diario a su familia,  espera tener mayores ingresos, ganar popularidad y resarcir su deuda.
El sueño de Juan es tener su propia casa  para brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has a son with his wife. The family is very close and the couple pays for all family needs. Juan, with the help of his wife, sells tamales and also slaughters pigs. He has a lot of experience with this business.

Juan is applying for a loan in order to buy pigs, banana leaves, condiments, corn, vegetables and more in order to continue with his business and support his family. He wants to earn a higher income, have a more popular business, and pay off his debt.

Juan's dream is to own his own house in order to offer his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs, banana leaves, condiments, corn, vegetables and more in order to continue with his business.

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio, de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, debido a la situación económica, decidió dejar sus estudios para poder trabajar y ayudar a sus padres en lo necesario, está soltero, vive con sus padres, las personas que dependen de él son su madre y su padre. 

Mauricio, tiene tres años de trabajar en una finca, limpiando y sembrando plantas, gracias a su trabajo y dedicación hoy en día tiene mucha experiencia y el trabajo se le hace fácil.- Él  pudo obtener ese trabajo gracias a su padre, que tiene muchos más años de trabajar en la finca, esto le permite generarle un ingreso para el y su familia. 

Aparte de esta actividad también, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra granos básicos junto a su padre, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, tiene que caminar aproximadamente media hora y su horario de trabajo es de siete de la mañana, hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Mauricio, utilizará el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta, para facilitar su transporte ya que la que tiene es de un tío y él quiere tener su propia motocicleta, de esta manera ahorrará tiempo para llegar a su trabajo y a su casa.  
Mauricio, planea poder construir su propia casa, para poder estar más cómodo; también desea poder seguir estudiando y terminar la secundaria y por lo menos la educación media para tener más posibilidades de un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 20 years old and has a seventh grade education. Owing to his family's financial situation, Mauricio left education in order to study and help his parents. Mauricio is single and lives with his parents, who depend on him.

Mauricio has been working on a farm for three years. There he cleans up and sows plants. Thanks to this work, he now has a lot of experience and the job is easy for him. Mauricio found this job through his father, who has many more years' experience working at the farm. This job allows Mauricio to earn an income for him and his family.

Aside from this job, Mauricio also works in farming with his father. They grow basic grains. To arrive at this work, Mauricio has to walk for around 30 minutes. He works from 7am until 5pm.

Mauricio will use this loan to buy a motorcycle in order to get around more easily. His current motorcycle belongs to his uncle; he wants to own his own bike to save time travelling between his work and his home.

Mauricio plans to build his own house in order to live more comfortably. He also wants to return to education and finish high school and have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rakip

texts.en:
Rakip is a 56-year-old  married man with three adult children. 

Rakip has operated a bar-cafe hostel for 3 years with the help from his wife.   They served traditional cooked meals. The place is located in the city of Elbasan and is frequented by locals. Prior to this job, Rakip worked in the military; but the passion for cooking, communicating with people, and serving them, made him switch to this new challenge. 

At present, he also works as shift supervisor with a local security guard company.

Rakip is requesting this loan to repair his bar-café hostel.

loans.use: to repair to his bar-cafe.

loans.name: Mirian Silvana

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 2 años y una hija mujer de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos de temporada.
Ella es generosa, comprensiva, sensible, sincera, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Chasquipampa’ área que antiguamente era sitio de pastoreo de ganado y casas construidas de adobe, actualmente se encuentra totalmente urbanizado, de clima templado en verano y muy frio en invierno.
Miriam es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al comercio, y sus hijos; viven en una casa en anticrético (especie de alquiler) que esta construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio en navidad es la venta de panetón o pan dulce, que se trata de un bollo hecho con masa de tipo brioche, pasas, frutas confitadas o cristalizadas, chocolate, etc. Tiene forma de cúpula y la masa se elabora con harina, levadura, huevos, mantequilla y azúcar, es un postre tradicional de navidad. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de juguetes en la feria de alasitas (feria tradicional para niños), posteriormente se dedicó a la venta de productos por temporada. “en navidad vendo pan dulce, luego vendo juguetes, para carnavales globos y pistolas de agua, así gira mi vida en el año…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, ella desea realizar la compra de juguetes para ser vendidos es la próxima y tradicional feria de Alasitas. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Miriam solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes de temporada para la próxima feria tradicional de Alasitas.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 30 year old woman, married, with a 2 year old boy and a 5 year old girl. Her business is selling seasonal products.

She is generous, understanding, sensible, sincere, responsible and hard working. She runs her business in the Chasquipampa zone, an area that was historically the site of a cattle grazing and homes built from adobe. Currently, it is completely urbanized with a mild climate in summer and very cold during winter.

Miriam is dark skinned with long, black, tied back hair. She is short, her native tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and because of the work she does. She lives her life with her husband, who works in commerce, and their children. They live in an anticretico home (a type of rental) built from brick, with potable water, electricity and a sewage system. 

Her business during Christmas is selling sweet cakes or sweet bread which is a bollo (spongy bread roll) made with cake dough, raisins, caramelized or crystalized fruit, chocolate, etc. It has a dome shape and the dough is made from flour, yeast, eggs, butter and sugar. It is a traditional Christmas dessert. 

Previously, she earned a living from selling toys at the Alasitas fair (a traditional fair for children). Later on she worked selling seasonal products. “During Christmas I sell sweet bread, and then I sell toys for carnivals, balloons and water guns. My life goes that way during the year…” she says. 

Her dream is to have her own home. She wants to purchase toys for sale at the next traditional Alasitas fair. This is her third loan series with the institution in the 8 years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Miriam is requesting a loan to buy seasonal toys for the next traditional Alasitas fair.

loans.use: to buy seasonal toys for the next Alasitas traditional fair.

loans.name: Senia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Senia, necesita capital para comprar ropa interior, calcetines, camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas y calzado, para obtener mejores ingresos en la temporada de inicio de año escolar.
Su negocio es más rentable con la ayuda del crédito anterior, la familia tiene mejor alimentación y salud, su forma de trabajar ha cambiado, ya que hoy lo hace solo en su tiempo libre porque temporalmente tiene empleo en un proyecto de introducción de agua potable en su comunidad, al finalizar dicho proyecto se dedicara plenamente a su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Senia needs capital in order to buy underwear, socks, shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts and footwear, so that she can improve her income at the start of the school year. 

Her business is more profitable now due to the help of the previous loan. Her family has a better diet and health. The way she runs her business has changed, and she can only dedicate herself to it in her free time, as at the moment she is working on a project to introduce drinking water into her community. When she finishes working on the drinking water project, she will dedicate herself fully to selling clothes and footwear.

loans.use: to buy underwear, socks, shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts and footwear, so that she can improve her income at the start of the school year.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
La socia  Jacoba se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,el sueño de la scoia es tener una tienda donde vender la rtesania. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jacoba works in the business of traditional crafts. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the crafts. She is asking for the loan to buy textiles, sweaters and looms.

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy textiles, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Kukuli Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUKULI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Hermenegilda, la socia continua con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas entre otros  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de artesanía, productos de belleza, carpintería, negocio de venta de zapatillas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tienda de abarrotes.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “KUKULI” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco. It belongs to the province and department of Cuzco.  

One member is Hermenegilda. She continues with the grocery selling business. She is thankful to the people who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time. She continues to sell rice, sugar, milk, soda and more to the customers who ask her for them. She is a responsible and hardworking person and this is how she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy sodas, and more. 

The other members work in the business of handmade crafts, beauty products, carpentry, selling shoes, selling groceries, and a grocery store. The members who are in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy sodas and more.

loans.name: La Solidarité Group

texts.fr: Koniba Mariam est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est la présidente de ce groupe de 7 membres qui est à son troisième prêt avec ACFIME. Ce groupe de femmes battantes fait bien ses remboursements et à la bonne date. Ces femmes exercent diverses activités qui leur permettent de s’épanouir. Koniba Mariam vend des céréales et elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de haricot, 4 sacs de mil pour son commerce. Après les ventes, elle fera un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire l’épargne, de prendre soin de ses enfants et de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Koniba Mariam is married and the mother of three children. She is the president of this group, composed of 7 members, who is asking for their third loan from ACFIME. This group of ambitious women have always reimbursed previous loans on time. These women are all involved in diverse activities that allow them to blossom. Koniba Mariam sells grains and is asking for this loan in order to purchase 5 bags of corn, 3 bags of beans and 4 bags of millet. Their sale will allow her to save some money, take care of her children's needs, and continue this commercial activity.

loans.use: purchase grains (corn, millet, beans...) to sell

loans.name: Rina Deysi

texts.es:
Rina, es dueña de una panadería, administra su negocio con ayuda de un hijo, quien sale a vender pan en diferentes zonas, es así como ha podido sacar  a su familia adelante; ella vive junto a su hijo y dos nietos, la vivienda es propia, es una madre y abuela responsable.
Invertirá en la reparación de una amasadora y un cilindro triturador, tendrá el equipo de trabajo en perfectas condiciones para aumentar la productividad, ventas y ganancias, espera sacar el mejor provecho del préstamo y resarcir su deuda sin dificultades.
Sus sueños son lograr tener equipada la panadería para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Rina is he owner of a bread bakery. She runs her business with her son's help. He goes out to sell the bread in different areas. This is how she has been able to get her family ahead. She lives with her son and two grandchildren. She is a responsible mother and grandmother. 

She will invest in repairing a kneading machine and a grinding cylinder. She will have her work equipment in perfect condition to increase productivity, sales and earnings. She hopes to make the best use of the loan and pay off her debt without difficulties.  

Her dream is to have her bread bakery well equipped so that her business will grow.

loans.use: to invest in repairing a kneading machine, and a grinding cylinder, to have her work equipment in perfect condition.

loans.name: Dawlat

texts.en: Dawlat is a 63-year-old married woman who lives with her husband. Both of them work in the agricultural field and they are working mutually to meet the needs of life. Despite her older age, Dawlat declares that she must keep on working otherwise she won’t be able to live properly. And presently, Dawlat looks forward to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and seeds in order to increase her production hence her sales thus her income. Dawlat is eager to receive the funds and sends her sincerest thanks for Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Sanije

texts.en:
Sanije wanted to add another dairy cow with your financial help. In addition to the previous cow that she bought with your loan and from which she sells raw milk to her neighbors, she has also 30 chickens from which she sells mostly eggs.

Sanije owns 5 dynym (5,000 square meters) agricultural land where she has planted chestnuts and other orchards such as grapevines, apples and walnuts. Currently, she doesn't sell any fruits, but she does sell chestnuts to whole buyers.

loans.use: to add another cow; currently she has one that she bought it previously with your loan.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia. Here is her story:

“My parents always wanted me to enter a prestigious university, where I could get a high-quality education. I decided to enter AUCA long ago, because I was sure that I would get a deserving education only here in my country, and would be able to build successful career on this basis. We started to save money for this purpose from the 6th grade. Unfortunately, in 2010 we lost my father and were forced to spend our savings for his funeral.

Now I live with my mother, who works as a psychologist in the state institution and as a budgetary servant, gets small salary, that she isn’t able to save money. She is a smart and strong person; she doesn’t lose the hope and works hard, believing that she can do everything. Not far from our house lives my grandmother alone, so we help each other. She is retired and depends on us.

I am applying to Kiva loan, because my mother can’t pay my university full tuition herself. I am sure that AUCA degree will help me to build successful career, what is needful for me due to two reasons. Firstly, I want to help society becoming a sociologist, and secondly, I wish to have a good job in the future in order to be able to support my mother and my grandmother, because they gave me everything that I have now. I want to provide them a life, which they deserve.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Erlan

texts.en:
Erlan is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, studying journalism and mass communication. Here is his story:

“As I remember, I was always an active school-boy, taking part in every event and conferences. I don’t forget how we helped to publish a book about my Kochkor village for a GIZ project. As I loved History, it was amazing to discover unknown facts about our village. Bettering my English level, I volunteered at my school, teaching the 1st-2nd grades. The other important event happened when I got Informatics Certificate by USAID. The USAID staff came specially to our village to take exams and to award us. After that I participated in the competition organized by the local College of Informatics and Applied Mathematics and won a Certificate to study there for free. As that time I finished the 9th grade, I could go there, but I loved my school and preferred to stay at it. I was a Culture Minister in the School Parliament and used to hold shows and different competitions, take videos about our school and out of it.

The best my achievement can be called my full scholarship at New Generation Academy of AUCA. My social activity, knowledge of English and my big desire to study in Bishkek, helped me to realize my goal. This one year Program allowed me to gain more knowledge and skills to be able to enter AUCA, what even could be my dream at school. AUCA is the best university with the well-equipped lab and library, we have “A New Star” newspaper for the students, and actually I am a reporter at it. In AUCA I have a great chance to learn the theory and practice at the same time.

Kiva loan will contribute to my self-development and be one of the active and important students of AUCA. As my mother is not able to pay the full tuition, I am requesting this loan and wait for the lenders’ mercy.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Aldef Group

texts.fr: Salimata est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des pagnes et fait des jus de fruits pour vendre. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des pagnes de qualité pour vendre. En plus de cela cette brave dame fait de la glace et des jus de fruits. Ce prêt aidera beaucoup Salimata à renforcer son commerce.Elle aide son époux dans la gestion de leur famille. Avec son bénéfice, elle pourra continuer a aidé sa famille, à continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Salimata is married and the mother of four children; She sells traditional cloths and fresh fruit juices.She is asking for this loan in order to purchase quality cloth to sell. In addition to this, she makes ice cream and fruit juices. This loan will help Salimata increase her working assets. She helps her husband in taking care of the family. Profits earnerd will allow her to continue to support her family, and continue this activity.

est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des pagnes et fait des jus de fruits pour vendre. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des pagnes de qualité pour vendre. En plus de cela cette brave dame fait de la glace et des jus de fruits. Ce prêt aidera beaucoup Salimata à renforcer son commerce.Elle aide son époux dans la gestion de leur famille. Avec son bénéfice, elle pourra continuer a aidé sa famille, à continuer son activité.

loans.use: purchase traditional cloths and fruit juices to sell

loans.name: Kachuruzi Group

texts.fr: Kitumaini est commerçante, présidente de la banque villageoise Kachuruzi, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 41 ans, mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est sociétaire d’une boutique avec divers articles manufacturés. Elle va acheter les savons, bougies, sardines, biscuits, stylos, cahiers etc. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kitumaini is a storekeeper and the president of the village bank Kachuruzi, a customer of the MFI Hekima. She is married, 41 years old, and the mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. She began her business with funds she received from her husband. She is the owner of a little store that sell diverse products. She stocks soaps, candles, sardines, cookies, pens, notebooks, etc. Her partner is also a shop keeper. She hopes to be awarded this loan in order to increase her sales, and educate and feed her children. She would like to thank Hekima for the support they provide entrepreneurs without bank accounts.

loans.use: purchase soaps, candles, sardines, cookies, pens, notebooks, etc

loans.name: Lagafuaina

texts.en:
Lagafuaina is a 40-year-old mother with six children. She runs a small plantation in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Lagafuaina has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, taro roots, banana tube, hand gloves, water tank, chemicals, shovel, safety boots, pick-up(car) to help her run the business. 

Lagafuaina will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, taro roots, banana tube, hand gloves, water tank, chemicals, shovel, safety boots, pick-up (car)

loans.name: Najil

texts.en:
Najil is 38 years old and lives in P1 Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their school age. Najil earns a living from her little store that sells groceries and other consumable products. At present, she is also receiving support from her husband as a seaman. She has been doing this business for four years, and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. 

Najil has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional 45 kilos of feed, groceries, and other consumable products to sell. 

Najil has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional 45 kilos of feed, groceries, and other consumable products

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan is 42 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. He is married, with two children who are now at their school age. 

Alan earns income from a transport service, being a motorcycle driver. He has been a driver for 20 years already.  He earns approximately PHP2, 000 each month from this type of work; that amount is so helpful to support their family needs. 

He has requested a loan to be used in paying the renewal fees of their franchise, and purchase motor spare parts for repair and maintenance.

Alan has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Alan hopes to acquire additional motorcycle units for hire to add to their family income.

loans.use: to pay the renewal fees of their franchise, and purchase motor spare parts for repair and maintenance

loans.name: Laurito

texts.en:
Laurito is 69 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with five children now at their adult age. 

Laurito is engaged in a fishing activity as his means of earning a living. He is also receiving a monthly honorarium as a barangay resort care taker. He earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing marine boards, marine epoxy, nails and paints for pump boat repair. 

Laurito has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Laurito hopes to expand his fishing business by means of acquiring an additional unit of pump boat.

loans.use: To purchase marine boards, marine epoxy, nails, and paints for pump boat repair

loans.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Flores Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Flores Marie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional varieties of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Flores Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 53 years old and has three children.  Gaudiosa is married, and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Gaudiosa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gaudiosa has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hergelyn

texts.en:
Hergelyn is 32 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal selling business in the Philippines and has requested an 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

Hergelyn has been running the business for 10 years and also earns an income from running a general store. She has already taken out and paid back 11 loans from NWTF and has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Hergelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

Gloria has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 30 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now at their school, and infant age. 
Aileen earns an income from managing their hollow blocks, sand, and gravel supplying business. She’s been engaged in this business for seven months already.  She earns approximately PHP20,000 each month doing this type of business activity; that amount is so helpful to support their family needs. 

She has requested a loan to be use in purchasing a boom truck cranes for their hauler truck. 

Aileen has been a member of PMPC for eight years. 

In the future, Aileen hopes to expand their family business and become a subcontractor for all the government projects in the province.

loans.use: To purchase a boom truck cranes

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is 80 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon,  Misamis  Occidental. He is married with six children who are now at their adult age. 

Sergio earns income from the harvest of his riceland. At present, he is also receiving a monthly pension from the government security agency for 15 years already.  He earns approximately PHP3,500 each month, which is so helpful to support their family needs. 

He has requested a loan to purchase four sacks of commercial fertilizer and chemical sprays for his rice production activities.

Sergio has been a member of PMPC for almost nine years. 

In the future, Sergio hopes that all his family members will become a member of this cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of commercial fertilizer and chemical sprays

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy buttons, threads and zippers.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 54 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children now all adult ages.

Leonila is engaged in operating a public utility van business, and agricultural activities, specifically rice production, for 13 years already.  She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month from doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations. 

Leonila has been a member of PMPC almost three years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other type of business aside from operating a PUV.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy small cows and pigs and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es una mujer casada de 56 años vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada las Palmas,  ella tiene una hija. 
Pascuala es una señora que no sabe leer ni escribir, pero con la ayuda de sus padres aprendió esta actividad, ella ahora se dedica a la venta de bananos en la comunidad donde vive, ella es muy reconocida y tiene mucha clientela, por la cantidad de años que lleva vendiendo, de esta manera es como Pascuala genera sus ingresos, tanto para los gastos de la casa y sufragar los estudios de su hija. Pascuala siempre piensa en el bienestar de su hija, lo que ella necesita ahora es conseguir un prestamo para comprar un terreno que más adelante le donara a su hija, ya que es su única razón por lo que ella está trabajando. Pascuala para realizar esta compra necesita diez mil quetzales. 
Pascuala pagara el prestamo con las ganancias que genera su venta, ella aspira a algo más, su meta es que más a futuro quiere poner una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a 56 year old married woman who lives with her family in a community called Las Palmas. She has one daughter. Pascuala is a woman who doesn't know how to read but with the help of her parents learned how to do this business.

She now works selling bananas in the community in which she lives. She is well known and has many clients due to the amount of years she has been selling. This is how Pascuala makes her income to pay the household expenses and cover the cost of her daughter's education.

Pascuala always thinks of the well-being of her daughter. What she needs now is to get a loan to buy a plot of land that she will give to her daughter as her daughter is the only reason she is working. Pascuala needs 10,000 GTQ. Pascuala will pay the loan with the profit that her business generates. She aspires to more, her goal for the future is to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is married and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Mis.Occ. She joined PMPC in 2012 in order to access the programs and services of the coop. She requested her third loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy a variety of rice to sell in the local community. Lydia hopes to continue her business and  save enough for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida, 42 years old, is married. She is a resident of Lao Proper, Plaridel, in the Philippines. Nida has rented a space in the fish market where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already and it has a good return, supporting the needs of her family. Since she wants to generate more income, Nida joined PMPC to gain insurance and financial assistance and purchase fish in bulk for resale at market. She has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. With Paglaum’s help, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and hopes to become a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 45 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children who are now adults. Lolita has been engaged in a hog fattening business for 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP during each harvesting and selling period of the pigs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 2  sacks of pollard feeds and rice bran for her hog fattening business. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. In the future, Lolita hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase 2  sacks of pollard feeds and rice bran.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is gaining a profit through her retailing business, buying and selling a variety of commodities like rice in the local community. At the age of 64 and married, she never gets tired of displaying and tending her stall. She has a passion for selling and she earns a meager income from it that sufficiently supports her family. Natividad is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to purchase more sacks of variety rice to sell to increase inventories and her sales. Natividad  continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of variety rice to sell to increase inventories and her sales.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor, 45 years of age, is married and lives with her family in Usocan, Plaridel, Philippines. She has 3 children. Flor and her husband manage their fishing activities. They own a fishing boat and have hired 5 fishermen to work for them. They also have fish cages. Flor personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She has been a member of PMPC in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from PMPC amounting to PHP 20,000 for the purchase of new nets, foams and other fishing accessories. As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where she will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children finish their college education and have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets, foams and other fishing accessories.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old, married, and has two adult children. She lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Gloria operates a sari-sari store, which she has been doing for 21 years. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month. 

Gloria requested a long from PMPC, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Lomita

texts.en:
Lornita is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Lornita has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Lornita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix, de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 3 hijas.

Félix, desde pequeño se ha dedicado al cultivo de café, aunque de manera indirecta pues ayudaba a trabajar a sus vecinos para obtener ingresos, que en ese entonces le servían solo para subsistir.-  Pero llego un momento en que tomó la decisión de viajar a los Estados Unidos, para cambiar sus condiciones económicas y patrimoniales, permaneció en el extranjero 8 años, pues su  misión era hacer su casa y comprar un terreno donde trabajar, pues en este país para crear esas condiciones es muy difícil.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para sembrar 800 plantas de café,  todo esto implica que tiene que abonar, comprar las plantas y sembrarlas.

Sus sueños son, ver a sus tres hijas graduadas de una carrera universitaria y con un trabajo estable.- Además, desea cultivar más café, para que mejoren los ingresos y nunca dejar de apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Félix is 43 years old and studied up to Grade 7. He is married and has 3 daughters. His wife is a housewife. Félix since he was young has been growing coffee, although in an indirect manner as he helped work for his neighbors to make money and this only helped him subsist. But at a certain moment he made the decision to travel to the United States to change his economic and  family situation, He remained abroad for 8 years as his goal was to make a house and buy land to work on as in this country to achieve these things is very difficult. The money from the loan is needed to plant 800 coffee seedlings, which will involve applying manure, buying the plants and planting them. His dream is to see his 3 daughters graduate from university and with stable work. He also wants to grow more coffee to increase his income and never stop supporting his family.

loans.use: to plant 800 coffee plants.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has always had an enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated her rice land in Bato, Plaridel, and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Lilia knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Lilia hopes to buy a land tractor for easy land cultivation.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to market his business

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio has mastered his hog raising business in Polo Pitogo, Plaridel. This is how he makes a living and is able to support his family. 

He was at his lowest point when he didn't have enough capital for his business. When he joined PMPC, he was truly grateful to obtain credit to fully support his business. Just as he takes care his hog raising business, it is so with his membership with PMPC. He wants to maintain his membership in good standing so he can always apply for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of 5,000 PHP will help him build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen.

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has been preparing considerably for the post harvest operations of her corn in Plaridel. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the shelling, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and made a loan. Irene hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea always has enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income, helping her husband in support of their family. At the age of 51 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for labor costs in land preparation for growing her crops. 

In the future, Aurea wishes to own a motor cab for easy transport of her produce to the market and neighborhoods.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in land preparation for growing her crops.

loans.name: Patrociana

texts.en:
Patrociana finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, but she earns income as well. At the age of 58 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Patrociana wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can obtain financial assistance for her chosen business.

Feliciana has maintained her membership in good standing without record of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Feliciana wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 42 years old and married, with three beautiful children. She has been a snack vendor in her neighborhood for almost ten years. From this long time experience of selling, she already has high knowledge in dealing with this kind of business. 

Even though there are many competitors in the area, Maribeth still gets more customers than the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. 

For now, Maribeth is planning to manage a new business, which is to create a small pigpen for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase more raw ingredients for the snacks she sells to increase her sales, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for the snacks she sells to increase her sales, so that she can start a second business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade her computer and create a website

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita works hard to support her family. Lucita is married, and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell at her business.

Lucita has been in this business for 20 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Lucita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell at her business.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is 50 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items for resale, such as sugar, coffee and eggs.

Magnolia has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns income from a welding shop.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Magnolia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for resale, such as sugar, coffee and eggs.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar medicina natural y diferentes especias, mejorara el inventario para mantener su negocio competitivo y mantener su lugar en el mercado.
La ayuda que le dan los créditos le permiten a José lograr tener la mercadería suficiente para complacer a sus clientes y  tener ingresos con los que cumple con sus compromisos, su familia le da apoyo para atender el negocio.
texts.en:
José needs another loan to buy natural medicine and various spices.  He'll improve his inventory to keep the business competitive and hold his place in the market.

The help from the loans allows José to have the necessary merchandise to satisfy his customers and the income to fulfill his commitments.  His family helps him tend to the business.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine and various spices.  He'll improve his inventory to keep the business competitive and hold his place in the market

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José, es una persona que se dedica cultivar granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado, son oficios que desarrollo de muy joven y lo aprendió con ayuda de su padre; es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela, su esposa se encarga de las labores domésticas, no cuenta con  ayuda del extranjero.
Está necesitando el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto e insumos agrícolas con los que acondicionara la tierra para cultivar granos básicos, con la inversión aprovechara el zacate sembrado que tiene en sus propiedades y el que saca de sus cultivos, de está manara venderá el ganado a un mejor precio en el mercado. 
Sus aspiraciones son dar a sus hijos en mejor estilo de vida, poner en práctica la buena experiencia que ha tenido con créditos anteriores y mantenerse trabajando.
texts.en:
José is a person who works growing basic grains and raising cattle. These are activities that he developed quite young and learned with the help of his father. He is married and lives with his wife and 5 children who attend school. His wife takes acre of the housework and he receives no help from abroad.

The loan is needed to buy cattle and agricultural inputs to prepare the land for planting basic grains. With this investment he will take advantage of the grasses planted on his properties and that he gets from his crops. In this way he will sell the cattle at a good price in the market. His goal is to provide his children with a better style of living, put into practice the good experience he has had with the previous loans and continue to work.

loans.use: to buy cattle and agricultural inputs to prepare the land to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, de 33 de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, luego se dedicó a trabajar en una farmacia, después en una zapatería, tiempo después dejo el trabajo para ayudarle a su hermano, en los oficios domésticos, ya que él trabajaba desde las 6 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde y llegaba muy cansado, después de un tiempo él se acompañó y Doris, regreso a su casa  donde actualmente, se dedica trabajar en un negocio de ropa en el mercado, ella vive con su mamá y un hermano.

El dinero lo necesita para construir un muro de retención en la casa donde vive, ella teme que con la llegada del invierno se le derrumbe su casa, considera que con este crédito le ayudaremos, ya que le brindara mayor seguridad a ella y a su familia.

Su sueño es tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa, para ayudar a sus hermanos y a su madre para que vivan en condiciones de vida estable y digna.
texts.en:
Doris, 33 years of age, studied until ninth grade, after which she began working first in a pharmacy, then in a shoe store. Some time later, she quit working to help her brother by doing housework, since he worked from 6am to 6pm and was always exhausted when he got home. A while later, he got married and Doris returned to her home, where she currently works selling clothing in the market. She lives with her mother and a brother. 

She needs this loan to construct a retaining wall for her home, as she is afraid that when winter comes, the house will collapse. This loan will help her by improving the safety of her and her family.

Her dream is to have her own business selling clothing, to help her siblings and her mother so that they can live in more stable and respectable conditions.

loans.use: to construct a retaining wall for her home.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 52 years old, and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, now at adult and school ages. 

Florida has been engaged in a snack vending business for more than ten years. She earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity, which is a great help for her family's income. She is also receiving support from her husband, who is a farmer, and from her son, who is a seaman. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional varieties of snacks and other food products for resale. Florida has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Florida hopes to diversify her snack vending business.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of snacks and other food products for resale.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina is 55 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their adult and school ages. 

Joaquina earns a living from her gardening business, particularly growing string beans, mongo, okra, and pechay, and from banana production. At present, Joaquina earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.
