She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing nine sacks of fertilizer and chemical sprays for her gardening business. Joaquina has been a member of PMPC for ten years. In the future, Joaquina hopes to expand her gardening activity by cultivating an additional parcel of garden lot.

loans.use: to purchase nine sacks of fertilizer and chemical sprays for her gardening business.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo has always had an enthusiasm for farming. He has cultivated corn on his land in Pagadian and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the corn field is ready for planting. Camilo knew that he has to get things right in order to yield more income for this cropping season. 

In the future, Camilo hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 63 years old, married, and lives at Lopez Jaena, in the Philippines. In order to help her husband to earn a living for their family, she raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  

Wanting to increase her earnings, Teopista decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglet and feed. She now is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy two piglets and bags of grower feeds. She hopes that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. In the future, she wants to open a meat shop in the market.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and bags of feeds

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials to create buttoned shirts, hats and home decor items

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is 56 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five adult children. Alejandra earns income from her RTW (ready-to-wear) and cosmetics direct-selling business, which is already one year old. She earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of business activity. That amount is very helpful to support her financial needs. At present she is also receiving a monthly pension as the surviving spouse of her late husband. She is also an active president of an NGO in her area. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock of RTW and cosmetics for resale. The income from the business also helps a lot in supporting the educational needs of her grandchildren. Alejandra has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Alejandra hopes to expand her RTW and cosmetics direct-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of RTW (ready-to-wear) and cosmetics

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre has been painting for over eight years, and has owned his own company for the last four. It is with his well-honed craft that he supports his wife and children, and some of his family members back home in Brazil.    

He’s proud of surviving in a competitive market, but needs to update his equipment to boost his efficiency. “I need a spray gun and ladders,” he says.    

In the long run he believes that education could get him on the path to greater success. “I want to study business administration at a college. I need to improve my accounting skills.”  

For now, Alexandre will use this loan to ensure that he can continue painting and providing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a spray gun and ladders

loans.name: Davia

texts.en:
Davia’s passion in life is helping others achieve good health. Davia runs a private chiropractor practice and is a mother of one. She immigrated to the United States from Jamaica 10 years ago. She has worked in health care for the past 12 years and has owned her private practice for the past four.   

The biggest challenge for Davia has been finding the capital to finance her business. Her goal is to establish herself as the best chiropractor in Connecticut, but she needs this loan to ensure she has the working capital to expand the business.

loans.use: to have working capital to expand her chiropractor business

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is 32 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Jenneth works very hard to provide for them.

Jenneth's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jenneth is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Jenneth has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell such as soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, candies, biscuits, peanut butter, and etc.. 

Jenneth is committed to rebuild and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 41 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Lita works very hard to provide for them.

Lita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc..

Lita has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, soap, and etc.. 

In the future, Lita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, necesita capital para comprar 3 reses y cerdos para comercializarlos entre sus clientes, espera recuperar la inversión con mayores utilidades, el destazo lo realiza esporádicamente, ya que tiene mejores al ingresos comercializar específicamente ganado.
El financiamiento anterior le permitió hacer la adquisición de ganado para fortalecer el destazo, ha tenido ingresos suficientes para cubrir los gastos del hogar y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en: Jose needs capital to purchase three cows and pigs in order to sell them to his clients. He hopes to make a return on his investment with higher profit margins. He butchers the animals sporadically, given that he makes more money specifically selling livestock. The previous loan allowed him to acquire livestock to increase his butchering. He has made enough money to cover his household expenses and to pay off his debt.

loans.use: to purchase three cows and pigs in order to market them to his customers

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, de 48 años de edad, estudió solo primer grado, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, 4 ya tiene sus propios hogares y solo 1 vive con ella.

Rosa, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años, pues su papá siempre la llevó al campo para que le ayudará y aprendiera el oficio; luego que se casó y siguió haciendo la misma actividad con su esposo.- Ahora, siembran  maíz, maicillo y pipían; ella le agradece a su padre, el haberle enseñado a trabajar, pues es de esa forma que ha ayudado a su familia a salir adelante.

Además de la agricultura, le gusta la crianza de ganado, se levanta  a las 4:30 de la madrugada para ordeñar una vaca que tiene, luego la lleva al potrero por que alas  6:00 a.m. tiene que estar en la milpa, ella camina 20 minutos de su casa hasta donde tiene sus cultivos, ella trabaja 6 horas diarias de 6:00 a.m a 12:00 m.d y algunas veces regresa a trabajar 3 horas por la tarde, así es su rutina diaria.


El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una bolsa de semilla de maíz, 8 sacos de abono y veneno para preparar la tierra.
Sus sueños son, llegar a tener unas 10 vacas lecheras, comprar un terreno para trabajar y construir su propia casa, ya que actualmente vive cuidando una casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old and only studied until first grade. She's married with 5 children but 4 of them already have their own homes and only 1 lives with her. Rosa has been working in agriculture since she was 10 years old because her dad always to took her to the fields to help and to learn the craft.  She later married and continued working the fields with her husband. Now they plant corn, maicillo, and pumpkin.  She's grateful to her father for teaching her to work in agriculture since she's been able to help her family move forward.
In addition to agriculture, she enjoys raising cattle.  She wakes up at 4:30 AM to milk the cow and then take it back to the stable since she has to be at the corn fields by 6 AM.  She walks 20 minutes  from her house to the fields and works 6 hours a day from 6 AM to noon and sometimes she comes back to work another 3 hours in the afternoon.  
The loan will be used to buy a bag of corn seeds, 8 bags of fertilizer and herbicide to prepare the land.  Her dream is to have 10 dairy cows, buy land to work and build her own house since she now lives taking care of one.

loans.use: to buy a bag of corn seeds, 8 bags of fertilizer and herbicide to prepare the land.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is a small dairy farmer who lives on his ranch with his wife and children. In addition to his cows, he owns a horse and cultivates corn, which serves to feed his cows. Before acquiring his biodigester, an important portion of the income generated by the sale of milk used to go to the purchase of LP gas, chemical fertilizers and woodfuel. These expensive and unsustainable inputs were harming the environment, while the manure was being piled up outside the farm and contaminating underground water sources, emitting greenhouse gases and generating bad smells. From now on, Pablo will use this manure in a productive way to generate his own renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer, taking advantage of the natural methanisation process and the bacteria inside the biodigester. He will displace fossil fuels and turn his farm into a cleaner, more sustainable place to live. His corn will grow stronger, as the soil will be nourished with the natural nutrients from the biofertilizer. With his savings, Pablo plans to buy more cows to increase his milk production. He is also looking forward to improving the farmyard for his cows, as well as his house.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулнора жизнерадостная женщина 49 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. У неё высшее образование. По профессии она учительница. Она добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. 
Когда она узнала о зеленном кредите  (новый продукт) решила подать заявку на кредит. Она хочет получить кредит для приобретения пластиковых окон. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulnora is an optimistic 49-years old degree. She is married and has five children. Gulnora is a college graduate and works as a school teacher. She is a kind and hard-working person.

Once she found about about this new type of “green loan” [usually a personal cash loan] having been introduced, she decided to apply for a loan. She would like to obtain a loan to buy plastic windows. She hopes for a  positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy windows.

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Sokkea, 32, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been involved in the farming business since 1995, growing rice and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. She is able to generate a net profit of USD 2.00 a day, on average. She is married to Kun, 54, a farmer with a daily earning of USD 2.00. This couple has no children yet.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her farming, she is borrowing funds from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
La Sra. Marcelina, continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, la socia lleva años dedicándose a sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le ponen a cada uno de ellos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”.  This bank is located in the town of Zurite, province of Anta, department of Cusco. Mrs. Marcelina continues to work in agriculture and cattle raising.  
The member has been working on her businesses for years which are going well thanks to the effort she puts into all of them; she's responsible and hard working.  The member wishes to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.  
She is requesting this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can obtain financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Paulina has maintained her membership in good standing without record of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she obtained a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. 

Paulina wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is 65 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children now at adult age. 

Elina has earned a living from her snack vending business for 15 years. She is also supported by her husband, who is a farmer. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month from her business. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing flour, sugar, eggs, margarine and evaporated milk for her snack vending business. 

Elina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Elina hopes to have her own refreshment shop.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, margarine and evaporated milk.

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy is 57 years old, living in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married and blessed only with one child who is five years old. 

He joined PMPC on April 29, 2013, in order to access the programs and services of the co-op. Recently, he's accessing his third loan in the amount of 14,900 PHP for additional working capital of his existing business to buy beauty parlor materials like medicines and scissors. In the future, Zaldy hopes that he can provide for all the financial needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy beauty parlor materials like medicines and scissors.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Perlinda

texts.en:
Perlinda has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning income as well for her family. 

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Perlinda wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and has five children. Susan is widowed and has two children who are in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been in this business for 3 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, condiments, etc..

Nancy has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, bread, eggs, candies, vinegar, soy sauce, and etc.. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is 37 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelsie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nelsie has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sally works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Sally is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas, de 64 años de edad, estudió hasta segunda grado, tiene 5 hijos, está casado, su esposa se dedica los oficios del hogar, él se dedica a ayudar a sus vecinos en trabajos de finca, para obtener ingresos para el sustento de la familia.- También, de manera propia cultiva café, maíz y frijol, en donde se involucran sus hijos, ya que todos viven con él, son una familia que trabajan muy unidos.

Los padres de Lucas, fueron personas dedicadas al trabajo agrícola, por lo que él desde pequeño se ha dedicado a este tipo de trabajo, pues es una manera de que a su familia no le falte nada.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para pagar un tanque y unos caños, que adquirió para almacenar agua, pues donde él vive, le llega poca agua y no tiene un recipiente lo suficiente grande para almacenarla, con la ayuda que tiene de los créditos, aprovechará para trabajar siempre con los cultivos, pero más que todo con el cultivo de café.

Su deseo es adecuar mejor la casa donde vive, para tener mejores condiciones para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Lucas is 64 years old and studied up to second grade. He is married, has 5 children and his wife does the housework. He works helping neighbors with their farm work in order to obtain money go sustain his family. He also grows coffee, beans and corn on his own, involving his children as they all live with him. They are a family which works closely together. 

Lucas' parents were people who worked in agriculture so he has worked in this type of activity since he was young so that his family doesn't go without.  The money from the loan will be used to pay for a water tank and piping, which he will use to store water. Where he lives they get little water and he doesn't have a big enough container to store it. He will take advantage of the help he has from the loans to continue working with his crops, but above all with coffee. 

His dream is to better equip the home he lives in order to have better conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and some pipes.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is an experienced dairy farmer who decided to invest in a biodigester.  He hopes that this will reduce his operating costs, which are essentially composed of LP gas and wood fuel to cook and heat water in the house. 

His wife used to inhale the toxic smoke produced by burning wood on a daily basis, which was damaging to her health. By transforming his cows' and sheep's manure into renewable energy (biogas) and biofertilizer, Jesus will eliminate the need for wood fuel and LP gas in the house. The biogas will be directly connected to the stove and boiler in the house. 

Jesus is looking forward to spreading the nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer on his vegetables and fruit garden in his backyard, where he plans to grow more seeds for his own consumption. His animals' waste will be transformed into a precious resource. This will allow Jesus to save money and improve his quality of life, while contributing to the reduction of deforestation and displacing contaminating fossil fuels on his farm. With his savings, Jesus wants to buy additional tools for his daily activities on the farm.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester. The remaining part will be covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a biodigester.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $ 1000.00 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business, a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as cigarettes,sugar, salt, milk, water, body lotion, coffee and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Domingas independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy cigarettes,sugar,salt,milks,water,body loosen ,coffee, milk and biscuits

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia owns several cows and a large field where she cultivates corn to feed them. She dedicates herself to sell the milk they produce on a daily basis, and is looking forward to producing her own biogas and biofertilizer. Indeed, investing in a biodigester will allow her to reduce her operating costs, as she will be able to displace the LP gas and chemical fertilizers she used to buy. Taking advantage of her cows' manure will improve Patricia's and her family's quality of life, as the waste will not be piled up outside the farm anymore, where it was attracting flies and smelling badly while contaminating underground water sources. Instead, Patricia will become more self-sufficient and environment-friendly in her supply of energy and fertilizer, by transforming waste into a resource and thereby closing the natural cycle on her farm. Her children will grow up in a farm where fossil fuels are no longer necessary for food production. By spreading the nutrient-rich fertilizer on her field, Patricia will increase the corn's yield in a natural way. She plans to use her savings to send her children to a good school and improve the backyard for her cows.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE,la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia a la vez sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en: Bernardina belongs to the communal bank San Martin de Zurite. She continues to work in agriculture. She is very thankful for the loan, and promises to make her loan payments. She is a responsible and diligent woman. She also continues to work in animal husbandry. She wishes to be able to continue this work so that she can keep supporting her family. She requests this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
Doeun, who is 57 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has three children in total, two are single and one is married. To make a living and support the family, he has been involved in the farming business since 1979, growing rice and selling his agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that he can generate is USD 5.00 a day, on average.

In this farming season, Doeun is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 54 years old and lives in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is widow with four adult-age children. She loves doing her agricultural business and earning money as well. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan to buy a variety of ornamental plants and fertilizer. 

She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Concepcion hopes that she can provide what her grandchildren need.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ornamental plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 56 years old and married. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

For the past two years, Asuncion has been a farmer. She earns 1,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Asuncion is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marrisa

texts.en:
Marrisa is 42 years old and married with three children.

Marrisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, etc. Marrisa has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from direct-selling.

Marrisa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 50 years old and married with three children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, groceries, etc. Nilda has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nilda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fredis Orlando

texts.es:
Fredis, vive con su esposa y su hija de 7 años de edad, se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino nixtamal, tiene  un horario de 4:30 a.m. a 10:00 a.m., su ventaja es que ya conoce muy bien el negocio, el oficio lo aprendió dentro de su familia y el negocio propio funciona aproximadamente desde hace 5 años.
Será de mucha utilidad el préstamo para adquirir fajas, grasa, discos, tolvas, entre otros repuestos para los molinos, así tendrá un mejor equipo, será más eficiente y ofrecerá un buen servicio a todos sus clientes, por el momento no representa riesgos en el negocio.
Fredis sueña con crecer con su negocio, construir su casa propia y que su hija pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Fredis lives with his wife and their 7-year-old daughter. He works from 4:30am to 10:00am grinding nixtamal (boiled corn). His advantage is that he is very familiar with the business, having learned the trade from his family. He has been running the business for approximately five years.

This loan would be very useful to purchase belts, grease, disks, hoppers, and other parts for his mills. This would allow him to have better equipment, be more efficient, and offer great service to all of his customers. At the moment, the business presents a low risk. Fredis dreams of growing his business, building his own house, and being able to send his daughter to college.

loans.use: to purchase belts, grease, disks, hoppers, and other parts for his mills and in that way have better equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and certified potato seeds to sow again.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 53 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros,  desde hace 15 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Rosa esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasión es para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rose, 53 years of age, makes her living selling men's and women's underwear. She has been doing this work for 15 years and has many steady customers which allows her to keep her business afloat. With the money she earns, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. She lives in her own home with her family. Rosa is requesting another loan, but this time, it will be used to purchase a larger quantity of underwear in different styles and colors, with varied prices, so that she can attract more customers and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of underwear in different styles and colors, with varied prices

loans.name: Panchita

texts.en:
Panchita is 66 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children who are now adults. 

Panchita earns income from her little store and sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be use in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for resale. 

Panchita has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Panchita hopes to expand her sari-sari (general) store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 36 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children who are now schooling age.

Julie is engaged in a copra trading business (copra is the dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut used to extract coconut oil), and he has been in this business for three years as his main source of income. He earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month from doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of copra for resale. Julie became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, he hopes to become a major copra trader in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of copra for resale.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paolo is a gifted writer. He has been telling the stories of his community for over 10 years.   “I love working with my community,” he says.    The reputation he has built is his greatest success.   Paolo is an entrepreneur, has no partners, and relies solely on  his camera and computer to get the job done. 

Paolo’ loan will help him purchase a used car to get him to the places he needs to go to interview members of his community.

loans.use: To purchase a used car to get him to the places he needs to go to interview members of his community

loans.name: Raziel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Raziel works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Raziel is borrowing PHP 7,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Raziel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Dora Lisseth

texts.es:
Dora, vende joyería, cosméticos y además tiene una mini librería, es casada y tiene un hijo de 6 años la venta de joyería y cosméticos de marcas reconocidas la realiza por las mañanas cada día, ella visita a sus clientes ubicados en hospitales, alcaldías escuelas y otras oficinas en las que ya tiene clientes y por las tardes atiende la mini librería.
Con el financiamiento comprará aretes, pulseras, cadenas, anillos, lociones, sombras, desodorantes, etc., al realizar dicha inversión al mayoreo ahorrara y tendrá accesos a mejores ingresos y cancelara su deuda.
Su mayor sueño es lograr instalar un laboratorio para ejercer su carrera  como Lic. En Laboratorio Clínico.
texts.en:
Dora sells jewelry, cosmetics and has a small bookstore.  She's married and has a 6 year old son.  She sells brand name jewelry and cosmetics in the morning when she visits her clients who work at hospitals, the town hall, schools, and other offices in which she has clients and in the afternoon she takes care of her small bookstore. 
With the loan she will buy earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, lotions, make up, deodorants, etc. By making this wholesale investment she'll be able to save money and will have access to better income and be able to pay off her debt.  Her dream is to establish a laboratory to work in her profession as a licensed medical technology professional.

loans.use: to buy earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, lotions, make up, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Karla Sofia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
Aquí vive la señorita Karla, tiene 29 años  de edad, está soltera.  Ella vive en casa de los padres.
Doña Karla es una joven muy trabajadora que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a sus padres se dedica a trabajar muy duro ya que ella trabaja en las oficinas de una cooperativa de trasporte interprovincial y también se dedica al comercio, vende zapatillas por catalogo así como también productos de Avon y  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella vende en su casa y en el lugar donde trabaja ya que tiene muchas personas conocidas que siempre le compran sus productos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 6 meses  que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo. 
Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, perfumes, cremas y otros productos que vende. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Amigas Trabajadoras credit group meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton, a place known for the wide variety of sweets prepared there, recognized nationwide for their delicious flavor.

Karla lives there.  She is 29 years old and single.  She lives in her parents’ home.

Karla is a very hardworking young woman who went to work in order to have her own income and thus be able to help her parents.  She works very hard in the offices of an interprovincial transportation cooperative as well as working in trade, selling shoes and products such as Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories) from a catalog.  She makes her sales from her home and her workplace because she has many acquaintances who always buy her products.  She makes her sales on credit and collects payments weekly.  She has been doing this for six months; it is how she earns her living.

This loan is to buy shoes, perfumes, lotions, and other products that she sells.  This is her second loan cycle in the credit group and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumes, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally opened ABA Therapy Center, along with her husband Billy, to provide a higher quality of life for people living with autism and their families.   Their personal experience of raising six children, including two with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD), inspired  Sally and Billy to help families such as their own to navigate the challenges that come with ASD.  

While ABA Therapy Center has only been in operation for just under two years, the impact has been greatly felt.     Sally says that her greatest achievement is hearing “you saved my child’s life” from a parent’s mouth.   

Her biggest challenge has been keeping the important services that ABA Therapy provides accessible for all types of families.   Without proper insurance, many families cannot receive the care Sally and Billy provide.  One of the main goals for this loan is to expand services, and become a non-profit organization that all families can access.  

Sally’s long-term vision is to build a ranch, where ABA therapy can foster interest for the outdoors in their clients,  and provide the supervision they require.  “Ultimately, we aspire to provide ABA Therapy to all children,  young adults, and adults who need it. “

loans.use: To hire additional staff and purchase supplies

loans.name: Tammy

texts.en:
Tammy is from Minnesota and is married with two children. She runs a health-centered business providing massage therapy and hydro-therapy. The business has been in operation for almost three years. She enjoys helping improve the health of her clients. 

Tammy is the sole employee. She has requested a loan for a new computer and spa-booking service software. She says this loan will  make it easier to book client time and manage her schedule. In the future Tammy says,  "My vision is to continue to offer services that provide opportunities for others to achieve a better state of health." She is a first-time client. 

You can check out her website here: http://www.peacefulwaters.us/services.html

loans.use: to pay for a new computer and client management services software

loans.name: Huoch

texts.en: Huoch is 29 years old and married.  She has three young dependent children. She lives in Siem Reap province in Cambodia. To earn a living and support her family, she fattens pigs to sell and she has been in this work since 2000. Her husband is a 30-year-old construction worker. Huoch and her husband make USD 13 per day. As a construction worker, her husband needs to travel to different places to work.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to commute to work. This loan will help her husband to have good traveling conditions in earning the income to support the family. Huoch plans to expand her piggery for more pigs and renovate her house. For her children, she will help them to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad, el mayor esta en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña María  es una gran mujer que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en sus actividades en el campo, en la actualidad necesita del crédito porque tiene varias hectáreas  listas para sembrar maíz, maní, arroz y verduras, el con la ayuda de dos personas a quienes les paga prepararon el terreno y ahora solo esperan el crédito para poder comprar las semillas, los insecticidas y fertilizantes para sembrar en esta época invernal, el siembra en toda época del año ya que cuenta con un buen sistema de riego. 
Este crédito es para semillas, fertilizantes  e insecticidas para obtener una muy buena cosecha. Lleva dos ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Amigas Trabajadoras credit group meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton, a place known for the wide variety of sweets prepared there, recognized nationwide for their delicious flavor.

María lives there.  She is 28 years old and is married.  From this relationship she has two children, ages 1 and 4.  The older child is in Kindergarten.  Her husband is a farmer.

María is a great woman who, in order to help her husband, is taking out a loan so that he can use it in his farming work.  Currently he needs a loan because he has a number of hectares read to sow with corn, peanuts, rice, and vegetables, with the help of two people he pays to prepare the soil.  Now he is only waiting on the loan to be able to buy his seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers to plant during the winter season.  He plants in every season of the year because he has a good irrigation system.

This loan is for seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, in order to get a really good harvest.  She has  had two cycles with this credit group and she likes it because of the help that the loans always provide.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Edita Ines

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años  de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y  el menor en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista. Ella hace tiempo atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la localidad.
Doña Edita con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque reconoce que lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas ya que hay mas diseños y con estos aprende aun mas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que saben de la calidad de sus trabajos. Lleva más de 15 años con esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar maquina de coser industrial que necesita, así como también telas y materiales de costura. Esta desde el inicio   en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su taller.
texts.en:
The Amigas Trabajadoras credit group meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton, a place known for the wide variety of sweets prepared there, recognized nationwide for their delicious flavor.

Edita lives there.  She is 40 years old and is married.  From this relationship she has three children, ages 10, 13, and 15.  The older ones are in high school and the younger one in elementary school.  Her husband is a woodworker.  A while back, she learned to sew and do seamstress work from an academy in town.

With the goal of getting her own income and taking advantage of her knowledge of sewing and dressmaking, Edita set up a small seamstress workshop in her home.  There she makes every type of clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, although she realizes that she prefers to make clothing for women and girls.  There are more designs and so she can learn even more.  She takes orders from private clients who know the quality of her work.  She has been doing this for more than fifteen years, and it has allowed her to get ahead.  

She’s going to use this new loan to buy an industrial sewing machine that she needs, along with fabric and sewing supplies.  She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are a help to her.  Her dream is to keep improving her workshop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Pastora Dolores

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 8 y 1 año, los  mayores estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en metalmecánica.
Doña Dolores en con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto darles lo mejor a sus hijos desde hace seis años atrás con lo que tenia y con la ayuda de su marido surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en la casa en la cual vive, poco a poco la ha ido aumentando y hoy en día vende además de víveres también ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería. Parte de este crédito es para el taller de su marido ya que el necesita de materiales para realizar su trabajo de una mejor forma y así poder cumplir con los arreglos de varios carros que está por hacer.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para  surtir su tienda, pinturas, latas y otros materiales.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras meets every 15 days in the Cantón Rocafuerte known for the great variety of candy that's made there which are recognized nationally for their delicious flavor.  This is where Dolores lives.  She's 31 years old and is in a committed relationship fruit of which are three children of 1, 8, and 11 years of age.  The oldest ones attend school.   Her husband's profession is as a metalworker.  
Dolores wanted to earn some money on her own and with this give her kids a better life so 6 years ago she opened a small store selling foodstuffs in her house with what she had at the time and her husband's help.  She's been growing it slowly and today she sells stationery and bazaar articles in addition to foodstuffs.  
Part of the loan is for her husband's workshop since he needs some materials to be able to do his job and meet some pending commitments for fixing a few cars. This loan is to buy foddstuffs to stock her store, paint, cans, and other materials.  Her dream are to keep moving forward and give the best life possible to her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, paint, cans and other materials.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and married, with five children. With one child in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

Rosita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Arely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arely, desea fortalecer su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital necesario, es por ello que opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito que utilizara para comprar un juego de cocina, platos, vasos, tazas, etc., le servirán para tener mejor productividad, higiene y  atención a sus clientes.
Relata que con el financiamiento anterior ha mantenido surtido el inventario del comedor, de tal forma que la temporada de fiestas patronales en el mes de Agosto le genero nuevos ingresos y los sutiliza para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Arely wants to boost her business but does not have the necessary capital, so she has decided to apply for a new loan, which she will use to buy a set of dishes: plates, glasses, cups, etc. This will allow her to improve her productivity, cleanliness, and customer service.

She reports that the previous loan has allowed her to keep her kitchen stocked, so she will be able to make money during the patron saint festival season in August and thus help her husband with the household expenses and pay off debts.

loans.use: to buy a set of dishes: plates, glasses, cups, etc., which will allow her to improve her productivity, cleanliness, and customer service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is 29 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $ 600 to improve her business.  She opened her business in 2000 with her own working capital of $ 100.  She earns a good income from her business.
 
She will use her loan to buy some to keep in her store, such as a sewing machine, sewing thread and fabric. She is a very hard working woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, sewing thread and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en: Selenge, 34 years old, lives with her son and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has passed away so she is working hard to raise her son. She has been working as an event organizer since 2012. Now she is requesting a loan of 500 USD to pay her sister's tuition fee. Her sister came to Ulaanbaatar from the countryside in order to study at the university. Due to a lack of cash, her sister didn't pay her tuition fee and the university administration is demanding payment. If Selenge pays her sister's tuition fee, her sister will concentrate only on her study and eventually graduate successfully.

loans.use: to pay her sister's tuition fee

loans.name: Reina Aminta

texts.es: Reina de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con sus gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reina, 60, lives in her own house with her daughter. For 10 years, she has run a small store located in her home. She has many customers due to her good prices and the kindness she shows them. With the money she makes from her sales, she manages to cover her household expenses. She is requesting this loan to purchase more soup, eggs, bulk grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc., and in this way have more income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, bulk grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia Haydee pertenece al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores y al negocio de kiosco escolar, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo gaseosas, galletas, tortas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tortas, gasesosas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Haydee belongs to the communal bank SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE.  The member continues to work raising small animals and runs a food stand in a school.  The member feels grateful for the credit given to her and promises to comply with the established payments.  The member continues selling soft drinks, cookies, cakes and other things.  The member is a very responsible and hard-working person, which is how she provides for her family.

The member is requesting a credit to buy cakes, soft drinks and other things.

loans.use: to buy cakes, soft drinks and other things.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina continua con su negocio de venta de maíz y habas, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar maíz al por mayor.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”. This bank is in the town of Zurite, province of Anta and department of Cusco. Paulina is still selling corn and beans. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make repayments on time. She continues selling wares to clients who request them. The business, which is going well, has endured for some time thanks to the determination and dedication Paulina puts into it every day. She is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk.

loans.use: buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a website, marketing materials and advertising for his social media business

loans.name: Rum's Group

texts.en: Rum, a member of Rum’s Group, lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Rum makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the two women of Rum's Group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ol's Group

texts.en: Ol, a member of Ol’s Group, lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ol makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the two women of Ol's Group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water.

loans.name: Naysron's Group

texts.en: Naysron’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Naysron makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en: Sokheang’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokheang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work working in a grocery store to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nouv

texts.en:
Nouv is a 56-year-old married rice farmer with three children. She resides in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 1984. Her husband is 57 years old and is also a rice farmer. Two of her children are working in a factory and one is a student. Together, they can earn approximately $16 a day. 

Nouv wants to improve her family’s finances, therefore she has decided to get a loan to buy more farmland to cultivate rice. In the future, she will keep expanding her rice farm and help to support her child in earning higher education.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy raw materials to be able to go on with her business, which is her only livelihood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; La socia sigue dedicándose  a la ganadería y agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jesusa is a member of the communal bank "San Martin de Zurite", which is located in the district of Zurite, belonging to the Anta province and Cusco department.
Jesusa makes a living raising livestock and from agriculture. She is a responsible and committed person, who hopes to be able to continue working so as to continue supporting her family.
She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer among other things. Jesusa is thankful for the loan and she commits herself to keeping her scheduled payments up.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer among other things.

loans.name: Edgar Naveli

texts.es:
Edgar, es una persona que se destaca por su compromiso y responsabilidad en su comunidad, factualmente vive con su compañera de vida, aún no tiene hijos, ni cuenta con familiares en el extranjero, su fuente de ingresos es atender una tienda de productos de primera necesidad con ayuda de su esposa y también ofrece el servicio de transporte de personas en un pick up, su mayor ventaja es que la tienda está ubicada en un local propio y el negocio de transporte lo atiende personalmente.
 Está solicitando un crédito para invertir el 50% en la tienda y el otro 50% en el negocio de transporte, comprara aceite, huevos, pan, golosinas, bebidas, azúcar, etc., y dará mantenimiento al motor del pick up, será de ayuda para mejorar su posición económica y para tener más clientes fieles. Los riesgos son la competencia, inseguridad ciudadana y posibles accidentes en la carretera.
Su objetivo es mantenerse trabajando para tener en un futuro un negocio mucho más rentable, permitiéndole tener ingresos económicos necesarios para tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Edgar is a person who stands out because of his commitment and responsibility in his community. He lives with his partner, however he does not have any children or any relatives living abroad. His source of income comes from running a shop where he sells basic products which he does with the help of his wife. He also offers transport services to people in his pick up truck. His main advantage is that the shop is on suitable premises and he runs his transport business himself.
He is asking for a loan of which he will invest 50% in his shop and the other 50% in his transport business. He will buy oil, eggs, bread, sweets, refreshments, sugar, etc., and will maintain his pick up truck. This will help him to improve his economic situation and to have more loyal customers.
The risks are competition, public insecurity and possible road accidents.
His aim is to continue to work in order to have a more profitable business in the future, allowing him to have the necessary income to have a better family lifestyle and to pay his debts.

loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, bread, sweets, refreshments, sugar, etc. and to maintain his pick up truck in order to help him improve his economic situation.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married, and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

Maria will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sagiko, Sprite, beer, noodles, sugar, salt, coffee and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Maria is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sagiko, Sprite, beer, noodles, sugar, salt, coffee and biscuits

loans.name: Pakouythong Group

texts.en: Kan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Kan and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Kan and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years and within this two years, filter users like Kan’s family will see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: Kim’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Kim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sary makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Nakhamnoy Group

texts.en: Keo is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Keo and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Keo and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Keo and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Keo and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters

loans.name: Nakhamyai Group

texts.en: Phosa understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Phosa knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phosa purchases will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the money spent buying charcoal or the time spent foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Phosa is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters

loans.name: Nalouang Group

texts.en: Nang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Nang and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Nang and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years and within this two years, filter users like Nang’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Amar

texts.en:
Mr. Amar, 40 years old, lives with his wife, three children and mother in an old house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been making and selling wooden products like horse fiddles, souvenirs and furniture since 2012. His wife works as cashier at a grocery store. Their children go to secondary school. His mother has retired from work and takes care of household chores. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,100 USD to buy equipment such as a trimmer, saws, and a hammer mill. Doing so will enable him to make wooden products in great variety and increase his customer base.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as a trimmer, saws and a hammermill

loans.name: Myanganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Myanganbaatar has used his previous loan for paying workers' wages. Now his family lives in a comfortable and warm house. He has been working as a plumber since 2012. His wife is physician and works at local hospital. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,075 USD to connect his house to central heating and sanitation system. By doing so, his family will save money on coal. Because the house is not connected with central system, his family has needed to burn coal for heating during winter. With the central system connected, his house will be warmer, coal will no longer be burned, and the air will be less polluted.

loans.use: to connect his house with central heating system in order to stop burning coal

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Uuganbayar, 28 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an assistant driller at a mining company since 2011. His wife is currently staying at home, looking after their new born. As winter came to Mongolia, the drilling work stopped and his main income generator became taxi service. He is requesting a loan of 1,100 USD to buy spare parts in order to repair his automobile which has deteriorated over the years. By doing so will increase his income and client satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his automobile

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Agdas with her family. She is married and has two sons, who are studying in school. Her husband has permanent job and sometimes helps his wife. Parvana lives in very poor condition.

Parvana has been raising cows, sheep, and poultry on her land. She sells meat, wool, and milk at the local bazaar. Her monthly profit from this business is 230 Azerbaijani manat (AZN). This is not enough income to cover her family's expenses.

Parvana wants to change her life for the better. She needs to create a little meat shop at the bazaar. This will be useful to her and her family. Parvana has requested 1,500 AZN from Kiva.

loans.use: to create a little meat shop in the bazaar

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a polite and kind woman who lives in Khujand town. She has her own grocery store business, with which she provides for her family. She always has fresh and high quality products in her store, which is very important for attracting customers. 

She is a very hardworking woman and always trying to develop her business. It is her second application to Humo. The first time, she paid back the loan in time and successfully expanded her business. 

Mavjuda has been involved in this business for three years. Her son helps her. Today with your support, Mavjuda wants to further expand her business and buy a car to facilitate the necessary work so she will be able to increase her income and save time.

loans.use: to buy food products for her grocery store and to buy a car.

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is in her late 30s and is a single mother of one child, who is in school. She has been taking care of her family through her general store business, selling a variety of items such as cooking oil, soap, rice, baking flour, and maize flour. Beatrice has been in this business since 2008, working from 8:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. every working day. With a good season, she is able to make a good profit.

As a single parent, she has to work hard to make sure her child has a good life. She has decided to find financial support to improve her business and raise her monthly income. Beatrice has approached Tujijenge, a Kiva partner, to request a loan. This is her second loan and she has paid back successfully her previous loan. She used the first loan to restock her shop. Her business still needs some more items to satisfy all customers. She will invest her new credit request to restock her shop with rice, cooking oil, soap, baking flour, and maize flour.

Her desire is to manage two shops so that her income grows. Beatrice will share this loan with her loan group,Temboni, consisting of three women who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her shop with rice, cooking oil, soap, baking flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Urozgul

texts.en: Urozgul is a hard-working woman. She was born in 1957, is married with six children and lives in a rural area. Her husband and son are helping her to raise livestock. She has great practical experience. Seasonally, she buys almonds from farmers and sells them in the domestic market. Urozgul wants to improve her cattle business. She is seeking ways of improving her business with animal sales. She needs financial support to buy additional cattle to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy additional cattle for raising and selling

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 51-year-old Lebanese married woman with seven children. She has a big family which requires a great effort from the parents to  manage their finances and pay everyday’s expenses. 

Fatmeh has a mini market and requests a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase daily and dairy products.  She wants to  improve sales  and  income to better support her children.

loans.use: to purchase daily and dairy products.

loans.name: Ulbash

texts.en:
Ulbash is a generous woman. She was born in a rural area and lives in the northern part of a country. She is married with five children.

She has been farming for about twenty years. She owns the land on which she plants. She does well and has the benefit of a good business, with which her husband helps.

Ulbash has requested a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. She plans to enlarge her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Valle Sagrado De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel ella es soltera y tiene 47 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes , la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Sacred Valley of Urubamba communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba in the Urubamba province in the Cusco department. 

The member's name is Isabel. She is single, is 47 years old, and has 3 children. She has a business where she sells groceries. She sells products like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has had her business for 5 years and it is going very well. She dreams of expanding her business. She requests a loan to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The members whose photos are pasted in the group picture took their photos after the meeting, which they needed to miss for work. The other members have businesses like food sales, clothing sales, grocery stores, and restaurants.

Isabel is grateful to those who have helped her with this dream and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Hidoyatjon

texts.en: Hidoyatjon is a generous woman. She was born in 1982, is married and lives in a remote district. She is a very responsive, kind, intelligent and hard-working woman. She has been in business about 10 years as a farmer. She grows potatoes, wheat and cotton, selling her crop to a domestic market. Hidoyatjon wants to enlarge her business to gain more profit to improve her standard of living. She is planning to buy additional seed and mineral fertilizer for planting. She needs financial support and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from New York. She is currently single. Ruzanna runs a health business providing medical billing services. “I have been in medical billing and management for almost 20 years.  This is my life’s work,” she says.  The business has been in operation for three years.  Ruzanna is the sole employee. 

She says her greatest success is helping medical offices be successful. Ruzanna has requested a loan to purchase upgraded software and a scanner. She says this loan will allow her to provide higher quality services in less time. In the future Ruzanna plans to grow her client base. This is her first loan with Accion.

loans.use: to pay for updated software and a scanner for her billing service

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Ruth works very hard to provide for them.

Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz, utilizo el préstamo anterior para comprar materia prima para elaborar petates, logro cumplir con los pedidos que ya tenía y ganar nuevos clientes, esta agradecida por  el apoyo financiero que la institución le ha brindado para mejor su negocio y tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo préstamo con el que podrá comprar tule al mayoreo, continuara produciendo petates para que su negocio tenga vida en el mercado.
texts.en:
Luz used the previous loan to buy raw materials to make petates [mats].  She was able to fill her orders and acquire new customers.  She's grateful for the financial support the institution gave her to improve her business and have a better lifestyle for her family.

She's requesting another loan so she can buy tule [palm fiber] wholesale.  She'll keep on producing petates so her business will stay alive in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy tule wholesale.  She'll continue producing petates [mats] so her business will stay alive in the marketplace

loans.name: Safi Group

texts.fr: Bagabo est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Safi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un agent de l’Etat, âgée de 36 ans, mère 6 enfants dont 5 étudient et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va acheter un sac d’haricots et un bidon d’huile de palme. Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Bagabo is an entrepreneur and the member of the Safi borrowers’ group, and a client of the Hekima microfinance institution. She is married to a government employee. She is 36 years old and has six children, five of whom are in school and one is still very young. She launched her business with the funds received from her husband. She has been selling staple foods out of her home, on a busy street in town, for two years. She will buy a bag of beans and a jug of palm oil. She would like to improve her family’s life conditions and pay for her children’s schooling and food.
