Finally, Bagabo thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: a bag of beans and a jug of palm oil.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
José, ha utilizado el préstamo anterior para fortalecer sus trabajos en el campo y mejorar la crianza de animales de corral, ya que ha incluido la comercialización de cerdos, hoy en día su alimentación, vestuario y salud familiar ha cambiado positivamente.
Para mantener el buen progreso de su negocio se ha decidido a requerir un nuevo crédito para comprar 10 qq de concentrado para cerdos y pagara mozos para recolectar una manzana cultivada de maíz.
texts.en:
José has used his earlier loans to improve his field work and livestock raising. This has included the marketing of pigs, which has led to improvements in his and his family's diet, clothing and health.
José has decided to apply for a further loan to maintain the good progress of his business. He will use it towards buying 10 Quintal of pig feed and towards paying the men that will help him harvest a Manzana of corn.

loans.use: to buy 10 Quintal of pig feed and to pay the men that will help him harvest a Manzana of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food supplies and put in a corner for stationery and school supplies because his shop is near the school

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna is a 45 year old married man from Rustavi City. He lives with his wife and daughter who works as a cashier and generates 250 GEL monthly. 

Datuna and his wife were unable to find any stable jobs, so they both started their own private activities. His wife sews clothing and various kind of things at home and has her own customers. Datuna also works as an artisan on private orders and generates approximately 400 GEL. He lacks the opportunity to do special work because he doesn't have the appropriate tools and that's why he requested a loan from local financial institutions. He needs financial support to purchase tools and continue running his business. 

Datuna has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will be great help to this hard-working man and his family, as he will get the chance to make his work more profitable and satisfy his clients' needs. He awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase improved tools of artisan and make his work more profitable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She is a conservative woman and asked her son to take her place in the photo. She earns an income via her husband. For Amani, this is her first loan with; she will spend the entire loan to pay the tuition fee for her son who is a fourth year student majoring in Mechanical Engineering. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates and become a successful person.

loans.use: To pay the university fees.

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en:
Yasmine lives in Zarqaa. She is 20 years old and a single lady who lives with her family.

Yasmine is a third-year student majoring in teaching. She chose this major based on the ease of finding a job in this area. She hopes to complete advanced studies and find a good job to help her family and help out with her sibling’s education.

Yasmine's father works in glass making, and her mother works as an accountant, but with the high cost of living, their income has become insufficient to cover household and education expenses.  Thus, Yasmine applied for an education loan to pay her university fees. She is waiting for your support.

loans.use: to cover education expenses

loans.name: Justino

texts.en: A loan of $800 will help Justino to send his children to primary school. She hopes that by continuing his children’s education, they will have more opportunities and a better life.The money will be used to cover educational costs including enrollment, textbooks and a backpack for her youngest daughter.

loans.use: to pay for enrollment,textbooks and a backpack

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en:
Agustihna is 35 years old. She is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $200. She earns a good income from her business.
 
She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, oil, Fanta, Coca-Cola, slippers and rice. She is a very hardworking woman in her business activities. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future. She is very happy get this loan to improve her living conditions in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To  buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, oil, Fanta, Coca-Cola, slippers and rice

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Georgina to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like fish, biscuits, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, salt, sugar, coffee, noodles and water. 

Georgina is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy fish, biscuits, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, salt, sugar, coffee, noodles and water

loans.name: Justino

texts.en: This loan of $800 will allow Justino to send his son Densio to secondary school.He will use the loan to pay for tuition and school supplies.Justino loves his son very much and hopes that future education will help his son to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay tuition and buy school supplies for his son

loans.name: Octavio

texts.en: A loan of USD 800 will help Octavio to send his daughter to university school . He hopes that by continuing his daughter's education, they will have more opportunities and a better life. The money will be used to cover educational costs, including tuition, books, school supplies, textbooks, and a backpack for his young daughter.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, books, and school supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is taking an 800 USD loan to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. 

Maria will use her loan to buy supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, biscuits, oil, water, sugar, beer, and cigarettes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 300 USD. 

Maria is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, oil, water, sugar, beer, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Saeeda, age 42, is a married woman shown in the photo with her nephew. She deals in a business selling livestock. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. Currently she has accessed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. It allowed her to purchase another buffalo to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 39-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the engine of his van as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil. That is why Shabana has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband, who will buy a new engine for the van to provide better service to his customers.  Shabana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better service for customers.

loans.name: Savin

texts.en: Savin is a nineteen-year-old freshman who is from the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree at an institute, majoring in accounting. Her mother is a farmer who cultivates rice and fattens pigs to sell and also runs a grocery store. Savin is short of the money she needs to pay her university fees, so she would like to apply for a loan. This loan will help her have enough finances to cover her study expenses in earning a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, she dreams of working in a bank to help her widowed mother.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en: Sayohat is a cheerful woman. She was born in rural area. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a taxi driver. About ten years ago, she started a business buying and selling food stuffs. She sells at home and is working hard to have satisfied clients. She does not take any complaints from customers. Sayohat is strategic, goal-oriented and a responsive person. She is planning to do well her business. She is seeking better ways to succeed in her business. Sayohat is asking for financial support for buying food stuffs to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy food stuff

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en:
Maimuna is married and the mother of four children, one in school and three grown. She was born in 1965 and during her lifetime she has learned a lot of business tasks. Fish and charcoal selling are preferred by Maimuna, since she has been doing this for a long time. For the past five years, she has been in her business working from 10am to 10pm daily and has been able to earn a good profit. 

This is her third credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Mti Mrefu, a four-member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous two loans, which were paid back in full, she bought sacks of charcoal and fishes. Maimuna earned extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. She will invest part of her loan to replenish her business with sacks of charcoal and fishes to resell. Her desire is to grow her business and be able to sell more stock.

loans.use: to replenish her business with sacks of charcoal and fishes to resell.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
El Sr. Anastasio, continua  dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, el socio lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a cada uno de ellos, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar abono y semillas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the Communal Bank “San Martin de Zurite” which is located in the village of Zurite in Anta Province, Department of Cusco.  Anastacio continues to engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.  He has had these businesses for a long time, and they are doing well thanks to the effort that he puts into them each and every day.  The member wants to be able to keep working so that, in this way, he can continue supporting his family.  The member requests a credit to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Sabina pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como leche, azúcar, golosinas entre otros.
texts.en:
The presented member is Sabina, who belongs to the communal bank "San Martin de Zurite". The bank is located in the Zurite district, belonging to the Anta province and Cusco department.
Sabina makes a living managing her grocery store and selling vegetables. She has been going about this business for some years and it is working out well thanks to her daily efforts. She hopes to continue working in her business and thus continue supporting her family.
Sabina is asking for the loan to buy foodstuffs such as milk, sugar and sweets among other things.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as milk, sugar and sweets among other things.

loans.name: El  Aguacatillo Group

texts.es:
Aguacatillo es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socios esforzadas en sus labores diarias, quienes llevan ocho ciclos trabajando con el financiamiento de ADIM. Lo coordina la señora María de 42 años de edad, soltera, dedicada a la elaboración y comercialización de almohadas y semillas de marañón en diversos mercados del país, con esfuerzo se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace quince años y el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de esponja, conos de hilos, pelusas, y cajas de manzanas, este último es un nuevo producto que ofrecerá ya que es uno de los productos que más demanda tiene en esta temporada lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos.
Ana es otra de las integrantes de este grupo, tiene la edad de 54 años y comercializa derivados del maíz y frutas en los mercados de Masaya y Granada desde hace veintiséis años, y por último pero no menos importante el señor Danny de 27 años de edad su negocio es la comercialización de almohadas en Diriamba y Jinotepe desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
Aguacatillo is a solidarity group made up of three people who work very hard at their daily tasks. They have been working with the ADIM financing for eight cycles. María is the coordinator and she is 42 years old. She is single and works making and selling pillows and cashews in different markets in the country. She has worked hard at this business for fifteen years. She is asking for the present loan to buy foam, cones of thread, fluff and boxes of apples. This last item is a new product that she will offer because it is one of the products that are most in the demand in this season and this will allow her to improve her income. 

Ana is another one of the members of this group. She is 54 years old and sells corn products in the markets of Masaya and Granada for 26 years. Last, but not least, is Danny. He is 27 years old and his business has been selling pillows in Diriamba and Jinotepe for five years.

loans.use: to buy foam, cones of thread, fluff and boxes of apples.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
Meerim is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“It was a pity that I couldn’t go to my school graduation party. My schoolmates chose an expensive restaurant, booked a limo and party show at a local event agency, which forced us to spend a huge amount of money. My father wanted to borrow money and let me go, but I couldn’t accept it seeing my family’s financial condition. My father is a power engineering specialist with a salary of 200 USD per month. My mother is a doctor, whose salary is around 100 USD per month. This amount of money is not enough to support six members of my family. Despite daily necessities, my father has to pay for their schooling and transportation as we don’t have a car. 

I have a very strong desire to study at AUCA and I firmly hope that Kiva lenders will give me financial support because indeed I need it. Having been provided with financial support, I guarantee to do my best to achieve high academic results and contribute myself to the development and prosperity not only of AUCA but of my whole country.

I have an excellent school background. I was a brilliant school-girl with high grades and I needed just 17 more points to get a Gold Certificate at the General Republic Test. I participated with my school group in the AUCA’s Brain-Ring competition and we were awarded first place. 

For the above reasons and more, I want to get a degree at AUCA, so I will be able to build a bright future and make my parents be proud of me. I await for Kiva lenders' mercy.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She is married and has four children. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like wheat and sugar. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in the business. She is living in a town with her family. Her husband is a farmer.  

She is very happy with her loan because it will help her to improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: To buy wheat and sugar

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz, age 33, is a married woman. For the past 10 years, Mumtaz has been involved in a business stitching bed sheets and covers. After purchasing cloth from the market, she sews bed covers, pillows and spreads. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family's income. To improve her business, she has borrowed 10,000 PKR from Murabaha to purchase cloth in different colors and designs, spools of thread, ribbons and needles. Mumtaz aspires to save money for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase cloth in different colors and designs, spools of thread, ribbons and needles

loans.name: Marwah

texts.en:
Marwah is forty-two years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children, one son and one daughter. Her daughter is twelve years old and her son is fourteen years old. Marwah is a teacher for a playgroup she has taught at for ten years. This helps her husband to increase her family income. 

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 3,300,000 Rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for families. Her family income is still not enough to pay by cash to build a toilet and buy water resources but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of the lenders.

loans.use: To buy and build a bathroom

loans.name: Sar Phyu Su Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Sar Phyu Su Village, in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, there are five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of 28 village customers (18 males, 10 females). This loan will help some village customers purchase high-quality duck feed, while other group members will use the funds to purchase ducks and repair destroyed duck farms. 

Sar Phyu Su Village has 143 households and over 600 people.  Many are farmers of rice, seasonal vegetables, and betel nuts. It is also common to raise livestock, including pigs, ducks, and chickens.

The members pictured above are the five CBO members from Sar Phyu Su Village: U Sein, U Tin, U Than, Daw Aye, and Daw Khin. 

U Than, included in the picture, (second from left) is 31 years old and married, with a child. He looks after his 100 ducks and also farms his crop farm. His wife takes care of their child and helps to farm. With Proximity Design's loan, U Than will purchase duck farm materials and high-quality feed.

loans.use: to help a member purchase duck farm materials and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Ah See Ka Lay Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Ah See Ka Lay Village, in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. 5 Community Based Organization (CBO) members oversee a group of 33 village customers.  

This loan will help some group members purchase ducks and other members to buy high-quality feed for ducks, costing $20 to feed 100 ducks for 5 days. More ducks will increase income by increasing production of duck eggs.
  
Ah See Ka Lay Village has 130 households and over 600 villagers. Most of the men are farmers while some are fishermen. In addition to their rice paddies, households plant seasonal foods and raise pigs, ducks, and chickens. 

Pictured above are 4 CBO members and 1 village customer from Ah See Ka Lay Village Group. They are Daw Hnin, Daw Win, Daw Myint, U Kyaw, and U Myint. 

Daw Hnin, pictured in the middle, is 33 years old and is married with 3 children. She takes care of her livestock - 110 ducks and pigs - while her husband fishes twice a day and sells his catch in the town market. Proximity Design's loan will help Daw Hnin to purchase high-quality duck feed.

loans.use: to purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed.

borrowers.first_name: Ah See Ka Lay Village Group

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Él se gana la vida gracias a su pequeña granja de pollos actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos y que le solicitan por encargo. Daniel desea invertir en una mayor cantidad de productos ya que en época navideña y de fin de año las ventas son mejores y desea tener suficiente productos para ofrecer a su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para ofrecer una gran cantidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daniel, 48 years of age, lives in his own house with his life partner and his family. He makes his living thanks to his small chicken farm business that he has operated for 8 years. As a result he already has a lot of customers requesting his products and placing orders. 

Daniel wants to invest in a greater number of products since sales are better during Christmas and New Years and he wants to have enough products to offer his customers. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins to offer a large quantity of products to his customers.

loans.use: to invest in: chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: I Made

texts.en:
I Made has a welding shop business. He has been running the business for ten years. He is married and has two children. The first child is already in elementary school and the second child is a toddler. 

I Made uses welding to create an iron fence, pigsties, and fix cars or motorcycles. To help him, he invites two of his brothers to go to work in his shop with him. Because his welding service is popular with customers, he has received an order to make a toy train for children. To complete orders on time, he requires a loan to purchase iron, paint and equipment for welding. I Made hopes he can finish the order on time, earn a satisfactory income and pay the salaries of his employees. I Made has a dream of expanding his workshop area in order to work better and be more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase iron, paint and equipment for welding

loans.name: Magona Group

texts.en:
Ashura is 40 years old, married and has three children, one in school. For one year now, she has been supporting her family by running a charcoal store. She purchases a few sacks, divides them into small-sized bags and resells. She is doing great, working from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. to make a good profit every day.

This is her second credit request from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to replenish her store with charcoal. With the extra income, she covered part of her household expenses and school fees. She managed to pay back the first loan in full. With her second credit request, she will buy sacks of charcoal to resell. 

Ashura's dream to grow her business capital. She will share this loan with her loan group,"Magona," which consists of eight women. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6 mujeres emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “MANOS UNIDAS”. Una de ellas es la Sra. Livana  de 38 años de edad casada  y madre de 4 hijos, la Sra. Livana   es una mujer muy emprendedora, la Sra. Livana   tiene una pequeño negocio de venta de comida en un pequeño mercado  el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar productos para su negocio (menestras,verduras,cubiertos etc) y así generar ingresos para su posterior venta y también poder  apoyar a sus hijos para que concluyan sus estudios. La Sra. Livana  es la es la tercera de la mano derecha se le distingue por su chaleco de color marrón, ah la vez se encuentra muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada, se despide con un fuerte abraso sabiendo que cumplirá todas sus metas.
texts.en:
'Manos Unidas' is a group of six enterprising women who have a lot of imagination for business.  One of the members is Livana, 38, who is married and has four children.  She is a very enterprising woman who has been able to progress due to her hard work.  She has a small business selling food in a market.  It is the only source of income for her and her family.  

She will use the loan to buy products for her business such as rice, beans, chairs, tables and cutlery.  She will also expand her business to generate more income and be able to support her children as they complete their studies.  

Liviana is the third from the right in the photo.  She is wearing a brown waistcoat.  She is very grateful for the help that this service offers.  She gives thanks and believes that with this help, she will achieve her aims.

loans.use: to buy products for her business such as rice, beans, chairs, tables and cutlery.

loans.name: Izolat

texts.en: Izolat is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1972, is married with three daughters and one son and lives in a rural area. Her husband helps her to run an agricultural business. She is an honest, goal-oriented and hard-working woman. She did not finish her education and has dreamed that her children will be educated. Her son could not enter the university. This year, she wants her daughter to enter the university. Unfortunately, they have financial difficulties. She and her husband are trying to work hard and earn enough profit. Her son went abroad to earn additional money. Izolat is asking for financial support to pay tuition for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay tuition of university for her daughter

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat is a business woman. She was born in 1960, is married with four children and lives in a rural area. She is from the northern part of the country. Salomat has a grocery store at the center of their domestic market.  She gets enough profit from her business. She wants to expand her business. She is a bright, honest, generous and kind person. She has a lot of clients and all clients are satisfied with her store. Salomat is asking for financial support to buy furniture for her household.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal EL AMANECER, él socio continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de huevos de codorniz y venta de pantalones, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a sus negocio, el socio es una persona responsable, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando en sus negocios ya que mediante estos el socio puede continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de huevos de codorniz.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank of El Amanecer where he engages in his business of selling quail eggs and pants. The borrower's business is going well thanks to the effort he puts in to his business everyday. He is a responsible person, and wants to continue working in his business to continue helping his family. He is seeking a loan to purchase more quail eggs. 

He is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: para la compra de huevos de codorniz.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (María Auxiliadora, Francisca y María Emelina)  que se organizaron hace 10 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

María Auxiliadora: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, una mujer alegre, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 42 años de edad, casada, tiene cuatro hijos: Tres son mayores de edad y la menor de  17 años, estudia tercer año de secundaria. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 3 años comenzó con su pequeña pulpería en su vivienda, también vende frito y enchiladas, que son distribuidas de manera ambulante con apoyo de su esposo. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: chiverías, gaseosas, granos básicos, insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de frito y enchiladas. Su sueño es llegar a tener un comedor  que ofrezca más comodidad a sus clientes, pueda vender más y así generar más ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida su familia.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hard-working women, Maria Auxiliadora, Francisca and Maria Emelina.  They got together ten months ago so that they could apply for financing for their small businesses which would help them generate a better income and improve their standard of living.  This would include being able to pay for household expenses and assuring their children's education.

Maria Auxiliadora is the coordinator of the solidarity group and is a cheerful woman who comes from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 42 and is married with four children,  Three are adults and the other is 17 and studying in third year of high school.  

In order to help with the household expenses she started a small grocery store in her house.  She also sells fried food and enchiladas which she offers on the streets with the help of her husband.  

She is asking for a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, basic grains, supplies and ingredients for making her fried foods and enchiladas.  

She dreams of having a dining room where she can offer her customers more comfort, selling more and generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, basic grains, supplies and ingredients for making fried snacks and enchiladas.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana is a 34-year-old married mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. He has been running a food stall for about five years. He earns sufficient income to cover the family’s expenses. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Rizwana has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy crockery and utensils along with oil, spices and food items. The loan will help him to increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy crockery and utensils along with oil, spices and food items.

loans.name: Ma. Consuelo

texts.en:
Ma. Consuelo is 52 years old and a married woman with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Consuelo has a bakery business in the Philippines. Ma. Consuelo requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Consuelo has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Consuelo would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dulamkhand

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulamkhand, 53 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working as an operator at a post office for thirty years. Her husband teaches physical training at a secondary school. 

Her daughter studies at a university and due to lack of cash, the tuition fee isn't still paid. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,700 USD to pay her daughter's tuition fee. As a result, her daughter will study hard without worrying about the tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, cement, sand, wood, and nails to improve his home.

loans.name: Dolores Dalisse

texts.es: Dolores de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, y así continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Dolores is 35-years-old and lives in her own house with her two daughters.  She has been making a living selling tortillas for the past 15 years and has many clients because of her good prices.  The sales allow her to achieve success.   She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime, so that she can continue her business to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en: I Wayan is a father with two adult children. They are married and living with their families. I Wayan is a chicken farmer who specifically sells the chicken eggs. Currently he has fifty chickens. Each chicken can lay an egg every day. The price for one egg today is 1.000 IDR. I Wayan already has a permanent buyer and they will buy all the eggs every day. But this time, the problem is the high feed prices. I Wayan applied for a loan of 10,000,000 IDR to MUK to buy feed, medicine and to improve the chicken cages. To obtain higher sales, I Wayan’s wife will try to sell the eggs directly in the market. With alternative sales, I Wayan is optimistic that they will get better results. I Wayan and his wife have a dream to repair the house with the results of this effort.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and to improve the chicken cages

loans.name: Robinah Prossy

texts.en:
Robinah Prossy is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for nine years. She generates additional income from selling charcoal stoves. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material. 

She works from a shop she rents six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and defaulters. She aspires to own a tailoring school and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing material.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat is a peaceful woman. She was born in 1962 and she lives in a remote district. She is married and her husband is a pensioner. She has two children.

For almost three years she has been running a business, and she is supported by her son. She is a baker and she bakes tasty breads. She has a permanent place of activity. 

Now Karomat needs to buy coal and flour. She is asking for financial support in order to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy coal and flour for baking breads

loans.name: Metria

texts.en:
Metria is 55 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Metria works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Metria has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future, Metria would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Sonita

texts.en:
Sonita is 36 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Sonita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additiohal stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc.

She has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. April Rose works very hard to provide for them.

April Rose runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

April Rose has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, egg, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, April Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Adilet

texts.en:
Adilet is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Sociology. Here is his story:

“I am one of the happiest students in the world because I have a chance to get a higher education in the most prestigious university in Central Asia. I am happy to be a freshman at AUCA and hope I will get a Diploma. As for me, I am from a poor family, so studying at AUCA was always a big dream. I passed the entrance exams due to my good knowledge of English, Math and other skills, which I gained at the New Generation Academy of AUCA. Finishing school, I was a finalist of the NGA Program to study one year for free, to live in the dorm and to get a monthly stipend. Thanks to NGA I got familiar with the American education system, for the first time learned about GPAs, e-courses and so on. Now I know how to be successful in my education and how education may help me in my future career and life as a whole.

As in many poor families, the main problem in my family is the lack of money. I live with my mother. She is a teacher and gets about 120 USD per month. Maybe for some people it is a laughable sum, but for us it is enough to buy food and pay utilities. In addition to this, my mom tries to find part-time or seasonable jobs that may also contribute to our family income. With such a small income, my mother can’t afford my university tuition but she also can’t stop me from studying at AUCA. When we were told about Kiva loans, I understood that it was the only opportunity to continue my studies at AUCA. I am an expectant sociologist. Being a sociologist means to me to be closer to people, to better understand their lives and be able to help them with the help of communication, which is so needed for orphans and old people to name but a few groups. I believe that Kiva changes lives for people like me, who are very much in need of a change."

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Khateb

texts.en:
Khateb is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is involved in the cattle selling business with the support of her husband. Both are working together to run their household activities. They look after the cattle, and after raising them up for a year or two sell them in their neighborhood. 

Khateb has requested a murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase stock of good quality grass and feed for the cattle that she already has. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of good quality grass and feed for the cattle.

loans.name: Nafisakhon

texts.en:
Nafisakhon is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1988. She lives in a rural area. She is divorced and has three children. She wants to open her own business. She is planning to buy and sell clothes for kids. Nafisakhon wants to have a business like her mother did. 

In order to start her activity, she needs a place to rent. She has good practice as a seller. She helped her mother with her business. She likes to be helpful and responsible. She needs financial support for renting a place of business. Nafizakhon is asking for support to rent a place.

loans.use: To pay for renting a place to organize a new business

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary is a 33-year-old married rice farmer with two young children, and she lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 7 years. 

Her husband has shares in a construction material supply business. Both can earn around USD 15 per day. 

Theary wants to improve her family’s finances, so she would like to request a loan for her husband to buy more construction materials to resell. 

For her future plans, she hopes that she will be able to build their own shop for her husband to run his business, to help her children to get a higher education, and to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials for her husband to resell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom lives with her. 

Nieves managed a hog raising business before, but now she has stopped it and has become a snack vendor. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy bananas, flour and cooking oil which will be used to cook snacks to sell. 

She hopes to keep offering delicious food and to earn good profits from it.

loans.use: to buy bananas, flour and cooking oil which will be used to cook snacks to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming rice.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional varieties of vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Victoriano would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ah Shae Kyaung Su Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Kyaung Su Ah Shae Village in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region of Myanmar. Kyaung Su Ah Shae Village has over 300 villagers who mostly work as farmers. Some villagers are fishermen and raise livestock such as ducks, pigs and chickens. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 22 village customers (11 males, 11 females). This loan will help group members purchase ducks and buy high quality duck feed. Duck feed costs $26 for four days' feed for 100 ducks. 

Pictured above are five CBO members from Kyaung Su Ah Shae Village Group named U Hte, U Kyaw, U Aung, U Naing and Thein. Included in the picture, U Hte (second from right) is 47 years old and married with three children. Two of his children are students and the other has migrated to Yangon for work. U Hte farms his rented three-acre crop farm, and his wife takes care of the livestock: 130 ducks, pigs and chickens. With Proximity's loan, U Hte will purchase fifty ducks and higher quality feed. This will be critical in boosting duck egg production and thereby boosting income.

loans.use: To help Kyaung Su Ah Shae villagers to purchase ducks as well as high quality feed

borrowers.first_name: Ah Shae Kyaung Su Village Group

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 43-year-old married woman who, for many years, has been selling animals with the help of her son (shown in the photo with her). Her business has provided her family with a decent life. Shaheen is a mother of two children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business, she has sought a murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales and generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales and generate greater revenue in the future

loans.name: Thae Ei Kyaung Su Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Thae Ei Kyaung Su Village of Myanmar, in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 28 village customers. This loan will help the group members purchase ducks as well as high quality feed ($25 per packet and a week's feed for 100 ducks). As the price of eggs fluctuates greatly, income can vary significantly for each household. High quality feed improves egg quality, which more commands a steadier, higher price.

Thae Ei Kyaung Su Village has over 170 households and 748 villagers. Most villagers are farmers, and some households fish to sell in the town market. In addition, many villagers plant seasonal vegetables and raise ducks, pigs, and chickens.  

The above pictures shows three CBO leaders and two village customers from Thae Ei Kyaung Su Village. They are named U Pyae, U Myint, U Hla, U Aung and Daw Than. Included in the picture, U Pyae (first from right) is 60 years old and unmarried. He lives with his sister's family and farms on their crop farm. U Pyae also takes care of their 200 ducks and maintains a grocery shop they run out of their house. With Proximity's loan, U Pyae will purchase high quality duck feed, essential to boosting egg production and thereby income.

loans.use: To help Thae Ei Kyaung Su villagers purchase ducks as well as high quality feed

borrowers.first_name: Thae Ei Kyaung Su Village Group

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 27 лет, замужем, есть двухлетняя дочь. У Наргизы среднее образование. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2012 году занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Наргизы, в ее хозяйстве имеется: 5 коров и 0,50 Га земельной доли, на которой она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. В общей сложности деятельность Наргиза приносит до 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Наргиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также накопить средства на ремонт ее дома.
texts.en: Nargiza is 27 years old and she is married with a two-year-old daughter.  She has a high school education.  As an extra source of income for her family, she has been raising livestock and growing crops since 2012.  Thanks to her hard work, Nargiza now has five cows and a .50 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes and corn.  In total, Nargiza's work earns up to 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  With the goal of increasing productivity on her farm, she has turned to "Bai-Tushum" bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows.  Nargiza plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into her farm and to save money to make repairs on her house.

loans.use: to buy more cows for her farm

loans.name: Darinchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Darinchuluun, 45 years old, lives with his wife and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Mr. Darinchuluun has been running his grocery store since 2011. His wife works as a janitor at a secondary school, and their 2 daughters both go to secondary school. 

The house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years. So, Mr. Darinchuluun is requesting a 2,500 USD loan to buy building materials such as brick, cement, and wood planks for his house renovation. Once complete, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1993. She is from the southern part of the country. She lives in a rural area. She is single. 

Sayora has a business planting agricultural products and keeping livestock. She started her business with selling dairy products. She does her business alone. She is an honest, kind, patient and strong person. She tries her best to enlarge her business. 

She is seeking financial support to buy building materials for repairing her house. The house where she lives is in bad condition.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Oimkhol

texts.en:
Oimkhol is a responsible woman. She was born in 1966 and lives in the southern part of the country. She is divorced with one child. 

She has been running her business for about 17 years. She is a seller, and she buys and sells textiles and ready-made traditional dresses for women. Twice a week, she buys traditional women's dresses and textiles and sells them in a domestic market. 

After her divorce, she started to do business in order to feed her family. In the beginning, she had difficulties with money but she became stronger after some period of time. 

Her customers are all satisfied with her goods, and every day she serves a lot of clients very well. Now she wants to increase her activity and buy textiles for the new season, but she needs financial support for this.

loans.use: To buy textiles for the new season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, sheet metal and lumber for replacing the roof and improving the walls of her home.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with nine children, four of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members. 

Teopista has been doing poultry farming for the last twenty-one years, working seven days a week. She also generates additional income through selling animal feeds. She has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more animal feeds, vaccines and chicks. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transport costs. Her dream is to build her business more.       

She joined MCDT because of the terms of joining. She lives in her husband`s house which has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To buy more animal feeds, vaccines and chicks

loans.name: Cristo Moreno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lua Marina ella es conviviente y tiene 41 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de cosmeticos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Cristo Moreno" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco in the Cusco Province of the Cusco Region. 

Lua Marina is the member.  She has a live-in partner and a son.  The member works in her business selling food.  She prepares different dishes like roasted chicken, soup and “saltados de carne” (Peruvian meat stir-fry) and works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had this business for 8 years and it has been going well.  The member’s dream is to have a restaurant.  She requests a loan to buy ingredients to cook like meat, chicken and vegetables. 

The other members whose photos are attached to the group photo had their pictures taken after the meeting for work-related reasons.  The other members of the group have businesses selling clothing, cosmetics, and groceries, as well as restaurants. The member is grateful for those who are part of making her dream come true through this bank and is committed to complying with the loan repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook like meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Bertha Lydia

texts.es:
Bertha, ha tenido buenos resultados al invertir el préstamo anterior en su negocio, su capacidad de pago ha mejorado, ha cumplido con el pago de sus deudas y su núcleo familiar se mantiene en ópticas condiciones.
Como una forma de seguir trabajando y mantener su negocio competitivo, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar hieleras, pan, embutidos, azúcar, bebidas, aderezos, aceite, etc., conservara los productos en buen estado para elaborar la venta de hot dogs y de gelatinas, además seguir atendiendo bien a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bertha had good results with her previous loan.  Her ability to pay has improved, she has paid her debts, and her family lives well.

In order to stay competitive, she is asking for a loan to buy ice chests, bread, sausages, sugar, beverages, salad dressings, cooking oil, etc. so she can keep her food in good condition for her hot dog and gelatin sales and continue serving her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Kikaka Group

texts.en:
The person carrying a black bag in the photograph is Rose. She is a member of the Kikaka Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training, especially on enterprise development and financial management to improve their businesses. She is thirty-two years old, married and blessed with four children who attend school.

Rose does both dairy and poultry farming to earn a living. She is borrowing money to buy dairy and poultry feeds so that she can get more milk and also improve on chicken productivity. She looks forward to improved milk, and more eggs and chicken products, which will lead to more sales and thus more profits.

She plans to use the anticipated income to cater for family needs such as food, clothing and school fees.

Rose is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy and poultry feeds that will help improve on productivity.

loans.name: Karlygach

texts.ru: Карлыгач 24 года, замужем, есть двухгодовалая дочь. Карлыгач имеет высшее образование. Карлыгач в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, в 2012 году начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Карлыгач  приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы , 2 нетели, теленок, 10 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,50 ГА, где ежегодно Карлыгач выращивает кукурузу. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Карлыгач обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией. В будущем, Карлыгач планирует расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Karlygach is 24 years old and married with a two-year-old daughter.  She has a college education.  In search of an extra source of income, Karlygach began raising livestock and growing crops in 2012.  She put all her energy into developing her business and today her farm has three cows, two heifers, one calf and 10 sheep.  She also has a .50-hectare plot of land on which she grows an annual crop of corn.

To develop her business further, Karlygach has turned to "Bai-Tushum" bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls to fatten and resell.  In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for fattening and resale in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Kaiyrgul

texts.ru: Кайыргул 39 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. Образование у Кайыргул высшее, она работает в школе, так же дополнительно с 1999 года занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. По характеру она очень жизнерадостная женщина. В хозяйстве Кайыргул есть 4 коровы, 10 овец и 1 лошадь. Также Кайыргул вместе со своими детьми выращивает на 1,4 ГА собственной земли ячмень. Совокупный доход семьи составляет около 25,000 (KGS) в месяц. Кайыргул решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец и коровы. На прибыль от кредита планирует отремонтировать сарай для скота и начать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kaiyrgul is 39 years old and she is married with six children.  She has a college education and she works at a school.  In addition, she has also been involved in farm work, specifically growing crops and raising animals, since 1999.  Kaiyrgul is a very cheerful woman.  On her farm, she has four cows, 10 sheep and one horse.  She also has her own 1.4-hectare plot of land, on which she grows barley with the help of her children.  Their combined family income is about 25,000 som (KGS) per month.

Kaiyrgul has decided to expand her business.  To achieve this, she turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy five sheep and one cow.  She plans to use the income from this loan to make repairs to her barn and to start repairs on her house.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep and a cow in order to increase her head of livestock

loans.name: Kha Naung Lay Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy's Delta region. The group consists of 29 members (14 women and 15 men), which includes 5 Community Based Organization (CBO) members who are leading the group's loan. 

This loan will help group members purchase both ducks and high-quality feed, costing 12 USD per packet. Since a packet lasts one week, the villagers have to buy weekly to keep their ducks healthy. 

The villagers of Kha Naung Lay are mostly farmers and fishermen, and they raise livestock such as pigs, ducks, and chickens. For additional income, they plant various flowers which they sell in the town market.

The picture above shows the Kha Naung Lay CBO members. They are U Win, U Aung, U Thein, U Myint, and U Ohm. U Win (second from the left) is 36 years old and is married with a son. He farms his three-acre farm and plants different kinds of flowers to sell in the market. He also takes care of 100 ducks, and his wife sometimes does tailoring in the village. 

Proximity Design's loan will help U Win purchase 30 ducks and high-quality feed, both of which will let him increase duck egg production and boost his income.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is a hog raiser living at Enrile with her children. Wilma is a widower and relies on the income from her hog-raising business. She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 as additional capital for buying feed and medicines for hogs' sustenance. Someday, she hopes to continue improving her hogs' growth and nutrition so she can offer them at a higher cost and earn good profits.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs' sustenance

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is from Massachusetts. He is married with three children.  Rafael runs a retail business selling small business inventory control systems, like bar code labels and readers. The business has been in operation for three years. 

He says the main challenges faced are "finding financial funding to help grow my business". He says the greatest success is reaching the small business owners that need this help with their inventory systems. Rafael employs friends and family in his business. 

This is Rafael’s first loan with Accion East. Rafael has requested a loan to purchase two audit machines and two barcode scanners. He says this loan will allow him to provide more efficient and accurate service. In the future Rafael plans to be the number one physical inventory service provider for small businesses in the New England area.	

You can see his website here: http://www.maireso.com/

loans.use: to pay for audit machines and barcode scanners

loans.name: William

texts.en:
The person in the above photo is William. He is 39 years old, married, and blessed with 5 children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management. This has helped him improve his knowledge in business management.

William's economic activity is dairy farming. He is requesting a loan to purchase a cow. This will increase milk production and his income level, thus supporting his family and improving their living conditions by providing, such as, better medical care and quality education.

William is very grateful to Kiva's lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow that will improve milk productivity.

loans.name: Kiletien Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, a member of Kiletien Women Group. Margaret is forty years old, married and a mother of eight children. They all attend school. 

She runs a clothes-selling enterprise. She is now in a position to effectively manage her enterprise due to the enterprise management and financial planning training she received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. She needs a loan so that she can add more stock to her clothes-selling business. She hopes this will enable her to increase her income and she will therefore be able to provide for her family, including quality education for her children. 

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: To buy more stock of  clothes for her clothes-selling enterprise.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1985. She is from the northern part of the country. She lives in a small town. She is divorced. She has two children. She is a seller. She has done business for about ten years. She buys and sells fruits. She is a conscientious, responsive and generous person. She sells fresh fruits and has satisfied clients. She is raising her children alone. Keeping and feeding the family is hard for her. She wants to enlarge her business and make better conditions for living. She is asking for financial support to buy fruits and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy fruits and increase her capital.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 5 children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (old parents: mother and father). 

She operates a retail business. Mariam works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil. Mariam generates additional income through poultry farming. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspiration are to expand her poultry farming business. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
“When people come together, they are powerful,” says Wilson, a 45-year-old farmer who has a beautiful family and lives in the village of Kapsoit in the Kericho area of Kenya. 

As a young boy, Wilson always envied and watched women in his village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led him to join Mereonik self-help group. 

For 10 years, Wilson's primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these crop diseases. 

Wilson decided to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime last month, he applied for a loan to expand his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations and increase the overall output. 

The additional income from the expansion will go to Wilson's children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, children are forced to drop out and work to contribute earnings to their families' income.
 
With your loan, Wilson’s children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright futures.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Ma Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Mercedes se encuentra muy feliz y muy agradecida con Dios primeramente por todas las bendiciones brindadas, ya que con su primer financiamiento pudo comprar insumos agrícolas con los que pudo asistir sus cultivos de café y prevenir que estos fueran afectados por plagas entre otras como el ojo de gayo, la roya, heladas en el grano (factor clima). Gracias a las compras de insumos que hizo ella pudo sacarle provecho a su cosecha de café el cual vendió a muy buen precio en el mercado obteniendo un ingreso factible con el cual pudo salir de su compromiso. De la utilidad obtenida ella pago otros compromisos que estaban detenidos debido a lo mismo la falta de capital. Su primer financiamiento fue de mucha ayuda para que ella pudiese cumplir con sus metas y seguir trabajando de manera que hoy en día ella solicita un segundo financiamiento con el cual comprara fertilizantes nuevamente y pago de mano de obra para hacer un mejor trabajo en su propiedad de café limpiando la misma de maleza y atendiéndola aún mejor de lo que ha sido en otras cosechas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is very happy and grateful to God for all her blessings. Her first financing allowed her to buy farm supplies to care for her coffee crops and prevent them from being affected by diseases like rust and leaf spot and from weather factors like frost on the beans. Thanks to the supplies she bought, she was able to make the most of her harvest. She sold her coffee beans at a very good price in the market and made a profitable income that allowed her to pay off her loan. The profit also allowed her to cover other financial obligations she had, which were on hold because she lacked capital.

Her first loan was of great help for her to meet her goals and continue working. Today she is requesting a second loan to again buy fertilizer and pay for labor to clear the brush from her coffee plantation. She plans to care for her crops even better than the previous years.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, corn, flour, butter, cinnamon, meat, vegetables, etc., to increase the stock of ingredients to make bread, tamales and atoles.

loans.name: Wendani Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Rose, 46 years old, married and living with her husband and their five children.

She does mixed farming of maize, peas, spinach and also operates a grocery store. She is borrowing a loan to add stock of kale, cabbages and spinach to her grocery business so that she can sell more and meet her customers' demand. She hopes this will help increase her income which will improve her family's living standards such as quality education and better health care.

Rose is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kale, cabbages and spinach to help meet customers' rising demand.

loans.name: Nyaitugi Welfare Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is Joseph, fifty-four years old, married and blessed with eight children. He is a mixed farmer who does vegetable farming of kale and cabbage and also does dairy farming. He has applied for a loan to buy high quality cabbage seeds and dairy feed which will improve crop yield and milk production respectively. He hopes his businesses will flourish and looks forward to improved incomes. He plans to use the profits to satisfy his family's basic needs such as food and plough back some profits for business expansion.

Joseph appreciates Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and dairy feed to help improve his crop yield and cow productivity.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en: Munkhtsetseg, 40 years old, lives with her husband and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has been transporting goods between districts since 2007. She is currently staying at home, looking after her children. The house they live in has deteriorated and needs expansion as her children are growing bigger each passing day. So she is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Pati Ibed

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Pati Ibed  continua  dedicándose  a la ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia también continua dedicándose a la compra y venta de maíz, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "San Martin de Zurite". The bank is located in the Zurite district which is in the Anta province of the Cusco region. 

The bank's member, Pati Ibed, continues to make a living working breeding livestock. She has had her business for a long time and it's going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. Pati is a responsible and hard-working woman.

She also continues to work in the sweetcorn trade, which helps her family progress. 

Pati is requesting a loan to buy a cow. 

She feels grateful to be offered the loan and she is committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all of them go to school. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy shampoo, relaxers, hair treatments, weaves and braids. Her major challenges include seasonality and electricity shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy relaxers, hair treatments, shampoo, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, at 53 years old, is a charismatic, active and attentive man. Being a father of eight has been his main motive for fighting tirelessly day after day, seeking alternatives to earn a living and support his children. Approximately 10 years ago, he started doing mixed farming and through those years he has gathered so much experience with the techniques of farming. Through the income from farming he has been able to take care of his family and also provide the basic needs for his children.

Paul is a very enterprising man, and although he never got formal employment, he has always worked hard on his farm and he has always assured his family of a decent meal. The Kericho area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why he is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, he is sure that he will reap maximum profits and be able to increase his business.

Being a man from a marginalized community and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Paul feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising men like him. Paul is much disciplined with finances and he plans that through the accumulated profits he will be able to improve his living conditions and also secure the future of his children. Paul says that his age doesn't stop him from doing what he is passionate about. That is why he always sets new goals for himself and among them is becoming a great horticulture farmer and to generate employment opportunities. This way he will be able to improve his quality of life and the well-being of his family and those people who help him do his daily work. By supporting this loan, you will be giving a boost to the entrepreneurial ideas of a Kenyan father!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, elabora pizzas para vender, su producto lo distribuye en motocicleta en las escuelas de la ciudad, su horario es de 9:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.; tiene tres hijo de 21, 15 y 13 años de edad, ellos le colaboran con las actividades de su negocio, por el momento no representa dificultades.
Con el financiamiento adquirirá materia prima, comprará harinas, salsas de tomate, pepperoni, queso mozarela, etc., extenderá su producción, incrementara ventas y ganancias, espera cubrir las nuevas demandas y finalizar su deuda con buen record crediticio.
Su visión es cancelar sus deudas, minimizar las necesidades familiares y tener su propio local para atender mejor  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José makes pizza to sell.  He distributes his product via motorcycle to schools in the city from 9 a.m. until 3 p.m.  He has three children, ages 21, 15, and 13, who help with his business activities.  At the moment he has no problems.

With the loan he'll acquire flour, tomato sauce, pepperoni, mozzarella, and other ingredients.  He'll expand production and increase his sales and profits.  He hopes to cover the new demands and repay his debt with a good credit record.

His dream is to pay back his debts, reduce his family's needs, and have his own retail space to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, tomato sauce, pepperoni, mozzarella, and so on to expand production and increase his sales and profits

loans.name: Oscar Segundo

texts.es: Segundo es un joven de 30 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 12 años y una niña de 9 años los que se encuentran estudiando, son 7 años que se dedica a su negocio que es una carpintería, la esposa de Segundo se dedica  a vender confites de manera ambulante, Segundo  necesita el crédito para comprar madera para la elaboración de muebles, Segundo aspira mejorar su negocio por ende sus ventas y sus ingresos para darles bienestar a sus hijos y dice que mas adelante se va a  comprar una casita para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Segundo is a thirty-year-old young man. He is married and has two children, a boy who is twelve and a girl who is nine. They are both in school. He has been running his own business, a carpentry shop, for the past seven years. Segundo's wife works selling candy as a street vendor.

Segundo needs this loan to buy more wood to make furniture. His goal is to improve his business by increasing sales. This will allow his income to also increase so that he can provide for his children. He says in the future he will buy a small house to improve his children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Jerald Josue

texts.es:
Jerald Josue, es un joven emprendedor  de 23 años de edad que se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y hortalizas. En conjunto con sus padres, Jerald pone todo su empeño para sacar adelante su cosecha y así poder alcanzar un mejor mercado, el sueña con poder ampliar su área de siembra, asimismo se ve en un futuro como un agricultor y ganadero exitoso.
Para poder ir logrando con mucho esfuerzo sus metas, este joven solicita un crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abono y pesticidas, productos que le garantizan la calidad de su cultivo. Jerald es un ejemplo de perseverancia, humildad y deseos de superación, en su día a día le deja a su primer negocio todas sus fuerzas.
texts.en:
Jerald Josue is a young, 23-year-old entrepreneur who makes a living cultivating basic grains and vegetables. 

Along with his parents, Jerald puts all his effort into producing a good harvest so she can reach a better market. 

His dream is to have a bigger planting area. In the future he pictures himself being a successful farmer and cattle breeder. To reach these goals, the young man is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides, products which guarantee him good quality produce. 

Jerald is an example of perseverance, humility and a desire for self-improvement. He puts all his efforts into his business on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Specious

texts.en:
Specious is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd MDI, having taken two loans previously. She is a married woman with four children, and a resident of Masajja in Wakiso District. She is a businesswoman having a retail shop in a market located in the city outskirts. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand her business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to restock more broilers and feed for the birds. However, she is faced with the challenge of congestion in the market and competition.

Specious is one of the clients who testifies about what Ugafode Microfinance loans have helped her to achieve. like educating her children and improving the standard of living for her household.
