loans.use: to purchase more broilers and feed.

loans.name: Wendani Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Wendani Self Help Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained in savings and enterprise development to help improve their livelihoods. They are mostly involved in farming activities.

The person raising her hand in the photograph is Jane, a member of this group. She is 57 years old, married and living with her husband and their four children. She is a dairy, poultry and a pig farmer. She has applied for a loan to buy poultry and dairy feed to help improve productivity. She hopes this will lead to more income, which she will use to meet family needs such as food and clothing.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy dairy and poultry feed to improve productivity.

loans.name: El Futuro Del Mañana Group

texts.es: Dora de 42 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Este es el grupo “El Futuro Del Mañana” conformado por 11 socios dinámicos y responsables,  la cual pasa a su 10mo ciclo. Dora se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Ella lo realiza en un puesto de mercado alquilado. Su mayor deseo es contar con su propio puesto de venta. Su último crédito los destinará para la compra de bivirís, polos, shorts y camisas. El grupo “El Futuro Del Mañana” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Dora es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo  negro. En la parte superior a lado izquierdo se encuentra Karina la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the group “El Futuro Del Mañana” [Future of Tomorrow], made up of 11 dynamic and responsible members, which is entering its 10th lending cycle.

Dora, who is 42 years old, is separated with 1 dependent child. Dora earns her living selling articles of clothing. She does so in a rented market stall. Her greatest wish is to own her own sales stall. Her latest loan will be destined for the purchase of tank tops, t-shirts, shorts, and shirts.

The group “El Futuro Del Mañana” thanks the people who make this loan possible. Dora is the third person from the left and is wearing a black t-shirt. In the upper left corner is Karina, who was unable to be on time due to work reasons.

loans.use: to purchase tank tops, t-shirts, shorts, and shirts.

loans.name: Gs-Pumataki De Pilco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “GS-PUMATAKI DE PILCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Challabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nieves ella es conviviente y tiene 44 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank GS-PUMATAKI DE PILCO. This bank is located in the district of Challabamba, in the province of Paucartambo and in the department of Cusco.

Featured member Nieves is 44 and married with 6 children. She works in livestock. She raises and fattens the animals and later sells them at fairs. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. By means of this work, she is hoping to get ahead financially. Nieves' dream is to expand her cattle sales business. She is requesting the loan to buy cattle.

The other members work in livestock, cltohing sales, grocery stores and food sales.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium and agrees to comply with scheduled loan repayments.

loans.use: buy cattle.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en:
Manizha is cheerful woman who was born in a rural area. She lives in the northern part of the country and is married.

She has undergone training on how to start a new business. From this training she gained a lot and decided to open her business. The idea to start a business seemed incredible, but she is determined to do so.

She is planning to open a shop, where she will sell clothes for kids. She has requested financial support for her startup. She needs to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to open a shop, where she will sell clothes for kids

loans.name: Nueva Generacion De Putucusi Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION DE PUTUCUSI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quellouno, provincia de La Convención.

La socia Gavina continua con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo  diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Featured member Gavina belongs to the NUEVA GENERACION DE PUTUCUSI communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Quellouno in the province of La Convención.

Gavina still operates a grocery store. She is grateful for the loan granted and promises to comply with the repayment schedule. She continues to sell various products including rice, sugar and milk, among others. She has had her business for quite some time which has gone well thanks to her daily dedication. Through her work, she hopes to help her family get ahead.

The member requests this loan to buy soft drinks, milk and more.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, milk and more.

loans.name: Lorohuachana Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOROHUACHANA AL PROGRESO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Mary ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agrucultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de ganaderia.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank “Lorohuachana al Progreso”. This bank is located in the district of Quellouno and belongs to the province of Convención in the department of Cusco.

One member is Ruth Meri. She is married, 34 years old, and has 2 children. She works in the business of growing fruit. She has land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins, and oranges. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She already has several years in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her land for growing. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other group members work in the businesses of animal sales, agriculture, grocery stores, and livestock.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva lenders who form a part of her dream and she agrees to comply with the payment of the loan by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 41 years old, married and has three children. Her spouse is a jeepney driver while she is a hog raiser in their village. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed and medicine for hog growth. This will help ensure good nutrition for the hogs leading to better sales. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for hog growth

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, está satisfecha con el impacto que han tenido los préstamos  en su negocio de agricultura, con el hecho de saberlos administrar ha logrado estabilizar sus ingresos mejorar la alimentación, educación y ofrecer un mejor futuro a su familia.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar una vaca parida, concentrado y zacate para alimentar a su ganado, espera dar un mejor cuidado a sus animales y aumentar la producción de lácteos.
texts.en:
María is satisfied with the impact that previous loans have had on her farming business; combined with her knowledge on how to use them they have allowed her to achieve a steady income and improve the diet, education and future that she can offer her family.
She has decided to ask for a new loan to buy a newly calved cow, concentrates and fodder to feed her cattle. She hopes to be able to give her animals a better quality of care and improve milk production.

loans.use: to buy a newly calved cow, concentrates and cattle fodder

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance LTD. She is 43 years old and married to Charles with whom she has eight children aged between 4 and 25 years old. All of them are still in school. She is a farmer with a banana plantation and a micro business from which she gets income to meet her household needs. She is a hardworking woman who strives hard to get income to sustain her large family. She will use the loan to buy organic fertilizers and mulch for mulching her banana plantation. She is grateful to Kiva for the financial boost.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Mariano

texts.es:
Todos los días José Mariano se levanta de mañana a buscar por todo su pueblo una oportunidad de construcción en la cual él pueda ser el contratista.  Se ha ido abriendo paso poco a poco en este negocio, trabajando muy duro ya que este es su única fuente de ingreso, para él y para su familia, formada por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 16 y 22 años de edad, quienes aún están en la escuela y también son sus mejores ayudantes. 
José desea expandirse a las zonas turísticas de gran auge en su departamento y para esto necesita invertir en nuevas herramientas que le faciliten y modernicen su trabajo, es por esto que ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar una batidora de concreto. Esto aumentara sus herramientas en su pequeña empresa y logrará realizar sus trabajos más rápido. Seguro de que va aprovechar la alta demanda de construcción y así sacar adelante a su familia que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Every day Jose Mariano gets up in the morning and goes out in his village to look for opportunities to work as a construction contractor. 

Little by little he has developed his business, working very hard because this is his only source of income for himself and his family, made up of his wife and his two sons of 16 and 22. His sons are both still studying but they are also his best assistants in his work. 

Jose hopes to expand his business to the tourist areas which are now booming in the region, but to do this he needs to invest in new tools to make his job easier. He is requesting the loan specifically to buy a concrete mixer. This will increase the amount of tools in his small business and help him to get jobs done more quickly. 

He is sure that by benefitting from the high demand for construction, he will be able to help his family progress in a way that they greatly need.

loans.use: to buy a concrete mixer.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, who is 30 years old, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has two children that live under her support. To make a living and support her family, she opened a grocery store to serve people in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for four years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 8. a day.

Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
A married parent of one child, Mylene works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns income from raising pigs. Mylene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring materials

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a smoked fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish for her smoked fish making business.

Edita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Rowena is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Jean has been in this business for 17 years. She earns more income from food vending and motorcycle transport.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 31-year-old married and hardworking man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where he operates an electronics workshop together with an electronics shop to generate his income. 

He used the previous loan to buy more electronic wires to sell. He has three children, all attending school, and has a desire of educating all his children despite the challenges of competition leading to low returns. 

Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy radios and solar panels for selling.

loans.use: to buy radios and solar panels to sell

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain es un hombre casado de 36 años tiene  4 hijos todos estudian en la escuela de su comunidad, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá. 

Efrain es un hombre que se dedica y me esmera en trabajar para el bienestar de su familia, desde hace 20 años, se dedica a la venta de bananos es una actividad que le gusta hacer, solo de esa manera él se siente útil a su comunidad.
Con esta actividad Efrain es muy reconocido por la comunidad él  vende al menor  y también vende al por mayor a otras personas que revenden en otras comunidades.  Pues son muchas las necesidades que se le presenta a Efrain, este vez el necesita comprar un terreno ya que se le presento una oportunidad, por esta razón él está buscando un prestamo para poder comprarlo  , pues el sueño de Efrain es adquirir terrenos para que después el donara a sus hijos. Efrain para hacer realidad su  sueño necesita cinco mil quetzales.
texts.en:
Efrain is 36 and married with 4 children who study in the local school. The family lives in the community of Sololá.

Efrain is a man who has been dedicated and has honed his work for the benefit of his family for 20 years. He sells bananas, an activity which he enjoys. Only in this way does he feel useful to his community.

Efrain is well known in his community for his work. He sells his product at retail and at wholesale to others who resell in other communities. 

Efrain has a lot that he needs. This time he needs to buy land since he was presented an opportunity. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to be able to buy it. Efrain's dream is to acquire land that he can later leave to his children. He needs $676 (5,000 quetzales) to make his dream a reality.

loans.use: buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Reshat

texts.en:
The borrower, Reshat, is 26 years old, single, and lives with his entire family. He is fortunate enough to be able to earn a salary from his employment and generate income from a shop that his family rents to others. His main source of income is his salary at his work, that he does with his brother, making Kebabs. Kebabs are a favorite food for Kosovars; many people love the taste and the convenience of them, and makes the food very profitable.  

Reshat is requesting a loan in order to purchase some new inventory for his shop and a new fridge. His goal is to be the owner of a big restaurant, serving different foods and being able to accommodate a variety of tastes. 

He is grateful for this opportunity, and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase some new inventory for his shop and a new fridge

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn, 36 years old, is a lovely mother of three dependent children who are currently in school. She lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing and selling rice to the local dealers. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost 20 years.

Savoeurn is living in an old house and she wants to build a comfortable one for her family. Due to shortages in her budget, she is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as bricks, cement, iron, stone, timber and sand to build a new house. Through this loan, she hopes she can experience living in a comfortable house. She is thankful to all lenders with their financial support to poor people.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Viborth

texts.en:
Viborth, 38 years old, is a married man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been involved in this career for around 20 years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

The earnings that he receives from his farming is every low. He wants to have one more business as supplementary income. However, his limited capital doesn't allow him to do so. That is why he is applying for a Kiva loan as capital to run a business buying and selling scrap. This loan will allow him to have one more source of income, which will help to remove poverty from his life. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support to poor people.

loans.use: to run a business buying and selling scrap

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and earns more income from buying and selling nipa roofing. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 for her dried fish making business, to buy additional fish to dry and sell. Dina's dream is to save enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Lucia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, coffee, etc.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Rosa works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, soap, noodles, etc.

Rosa has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 45 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Naneth has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Lolie

texts.en:
A married parent of one child, Lolie works hard to support her family. She has a rice "buy and sell" business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lolie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF for her rice business, to buy a sack of rice to sell.

Lolie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 31 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenalyn has been farming rice for five years and also earns income from buying and selling fish. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Eden

texts.en:
Ma. Eden is 32 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Eden is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Ma. Eden has been raising pigs for two years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet, 37, is a seasoned mixed-farmer based in Kipkoiyan village, situated in the southern part of the great rift valley. Just like most farmers in the area, he keeps dairy cattle for milk. He also grows vegetables and cereal foods. He is always on the constant look for ways to boost his family's income. Just recently, he found one.

Instead of just selling his cereal harvest, why not aggregate and transport cereal produce from other farmers to a market with fairer prices?
In order for Japhet to aggregate produce from farmers, he needs to lay out capital that is to be recovered once the sales are closed. The challenge he is dealing with is inadequate capital. 

To make the cereal trade a reality, Japhet is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to aggregate cereal produce and transport it to the market. He plans to settle initial loan repayments using income from milk. Part of the profit off the cereal trade will be rolled back into the business, while the rest will help him to meet some of his family's basic and educational needs.

loans.use: to purchase cereals from other farmers to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph and his wife have worked on their current farm situated in the outskirts of Kericho town, Kenya, since 2008. Since then, their farm and family have grown in more ways than one. In 2008, the couple started working on a rundown farm. Today, they are making money off the poultry and dairy animals they raise and also the maize and vegetables they grow. Joseph has further invested in a side hustle business to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. 

Joseph loves to dairy farm, especially since it was always a life goal of his to be a farmer. His wife understands this and together they joined hearts and hands to make the farm’s success to date happen. Joseph is seeking a loan to purchase a pedigree dairy cow. There are more than 100 cattle breeds in Kenya. However, not all are good producers of milk. In fact, very few are. Cattle aside, the tastes and preferences of milk in the market is really growing diverse in Kenya. Taking milk is no longer a matter of pouring it into our cereal bowl, adding it to our coffee, or drinking it straight from the glass; we now have preferences in the type of milk we drink. Today, milk consumers are spoiled by choices. In the market, we have old-fashioned cow’s milk and lactose-free milk, not to mention non-dairy options such as almond, rice and coconut milk. It takes dairy masters like Joseph to pick these shifts in the market and adopt ingenious techniques in farming to ensure that their product qualities adapt to the changes in consumer preference. Purchasing a pedigree cow goes to show how Joseph is keen on controlling lameness levels in his dairy cattle. He considers breeding to be the core of his overall strategy of ensuring that milk quantity is way above average and the milk quality is second to none in the market. He anticipates that feeding will be his highest cost of milk production. This, to him, is acceptable because to get cows that milk well and remain healthy, they have to be fed properly. 

Your loan will make a significant difference to Joseph's farm profitability. The couple will make use of the returns from this investment to pay for the loan and to pay for their children’s education. The rest will be reinvested in the business. It has always been their ambition to share their passion about farming with their children. They hope the kids will be thrilled to join the business of running the family farm.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree cow

loans.name: Milikije

texts.en:
Milikije is once again requesting a loan for her same business, this time to purchase food for her cows. She is very satisfied with the loan process and the results of her first loan, and anticipates the same results and ease now. 

She loves her work, and hopes to continue working with her farm, expanding it and making it better all of the time. Selling the milk and dairy products has been successful for her, and she is optimistic that she will be able to sustain her success in the future. 

She promises to pay on time again, and continue to be a good client for the company. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase food for her cows

loans.name: Lungkhat Group

texts.en: Hatneineng, 24 years old, is the featured member of ‘Lungkhat’ group. She is pictured with her hand raised. She is a married woman with a baby daughter who is a year old. She resides in the northeastern part of India that has a moderate climate. Most people residing in that area are engaged in daily wage earning. Although she had a baby girl, she had to do something in order to meet her family's expenses. She planned to open a tea stall, which she thought could help her manage her household expenses. She rented a place at Tuibuong district Head Quarter, aspiring to earn more income for her family's maintenance. Her husband supports and helps her in running the tea stall. To keep her business in full swing, she used to go and buy the necessary items twice a week from the main market in town. She also mentioned that there was no other tea stall like hers in that area so she wanted to expand her tea stall, which will eventually help her in increasing her income and meet her family expenses. The income that she gets was not enough for her family's expenses so she was unable to buy the necessary items for the tea stall. With the help of her Kiva loan, she plans on purchasing more items for the tea stall, which would help her increase her income. Most of the villagers come to her tea stall as it is the only tea stall available in her village. She thanks WSDS for helping her by providing loans at a low interest and making her life much better than it was before.

loans.use: To purchase items such as tea leaves, edible oil, wheat flour, milk powder and noodles for her tea stall.

loans.name: Kyon Thout Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Kyon Thout Village, in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 26 (24 men and two women) village customers. This loan will help some village customers purchase ducklings and high-quality feed ($22 for a packet, which is 5 days' feed for 100 ducks). 

Kyon Thout Village has 117 households and 430 villagers. The men at the village mainly focus on farming and livestock, including pigs, chickens, and ducks; a few households fish.

In the above picture are the five CBOs from Kyon Thout Village: U Hla, U Tin, U Maung, U Nyout and U Chit. Included in the picture is U Hla (first from left), a 57-year-old who is married with five children. U Hla farms his five-acre crop farm, getting help from his two children. U Hla also takes care of his livestock, which consists of 100 ducks, 260 ducklings, and pigs and chickens. This loan enables U Hla to purchase high-quality feed for his ducks and ducklings.

loans.use: To help Kyon Thout Village Group, purchase ducks as well as high quality feeds.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of ginger business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of ginger to sell for her buy and sell of ginger business.

Morena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Morena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of ginger to sell for her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is married, and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP, through NWTF, to purchase fishing nets, gasoline, etc.

Francisca has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a 57-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are currently in school. 

Lita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP, through NWTF, to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lita has been in this business for 8 years, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, 30, lives in the South Rift region of Kenya. This area is popular for dairy and tea farming.The most common crops in this area are fodder (to feed cows to produce milk) and tea (to mix with milk). Robert, who has been farming for the last seven years, keeps cattle, poultry and trees on his 2-acre piece of land. 
Robert is seeking a loan for purchasing a chaff cutter. Dairy cows prefer their fodder cut into pieces of a certain size: not so big that it is hard to digest, and not so small that it is not "fun" to chew. A chaff cutter solves this problem perfectly. Electrically operated, a chaff cutting machine chops fodder into small, even pieces that the cows will enjoy chewing. The other advantage of the machine is that different grasses can be fed into it to achieve a desired feed ration. This creates mixtures that lead to higher milk production since the cows cannot select what to eat and what not to. 
The increase in income from this asset will uplift the livelihood of Robert's family, which consists of Janet, his wife of 12 years, and five children ranging in age from 3 to 10.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells soft drinks and beers in a bar. He started the business to earn a living. To generate more income, Lawrence built guest houses, using the proceeds from his business.

Lawrence intends to use the loan to buy more beers and sodas to sell. Although he is challenged by competition, he desires to expand his business into a renowned pub in his town.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Muzafaru

texts.en:
Muzafaru is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells sport bikes and has started up a business renting out a public-address music system to generate extra income. 

Muzafaru would like to access a credit facility to buy a music system. He faces a challenge of competition and the business being seasonal, yet he needs income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy a music system to rent out, to generate extra income.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Priscah faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES, Priscah wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Elías

texts.es:
Elías es papá de un hermoso bebe de 6 meses, él tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su familia en una comunidad  llamada Xojola. 

Elías es un hombre que gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres y el empeño de él logro culminar sus estudios, pues él ahora trabaja como profesor en una escuela de su comunidad,  lleva dos años trabajando, es un trabajo que le gusta hacer y se siente muy comprometido y útil a la sociedad, además recibe un pago y esto le beneficia para poder sustentar los gastos de su hogar. Elías para ir avanzando con los proyectos de su vida, ahora necesita comprar un lote de terreno y más adelante pueda construir su propia casa.
 Elías con el conocimiento de  su esposa solicita un préstamo de  cinco mil quetzales,  para poder conseguirlo, pues él se ha acercado a la institución ADICLA para obtener este préstamo, Pues con los ingresos que genera su actividad él estaría pagando el prestamo, El sueño de Elías es conseguir el préstamo para cumplir este primer proyecto que tanto ha esperado.
texts.en:
Elías is father to a beautiful six month old baby.  He is 28 years old and lives with his family in a community called Xojola.  Elías is a man who, thanks to the effort of his parents and his commitment, was able to finish his studies.  Now he works as a teacher in a school in his community.  He has been working for two years.  It is a job that he likes to do and he feels very committed and useful to society.  Furthermore he receives a salary and this helps to support the expenses of the family.  

In order to advance with the projects of his life, now Elias needs to purchase a plot of land so that in the future he can build his own house.  Elias, with the knowledge of his wife, is soliciting a loan of five thousand quetzals.  In order to receive it, he has approached the institution ADICLA to obtain the loan.  With the income that he generates teaching, he would be paying the loan.  Elias' dream is to receive the loan to complete this first project which he has so hoped for.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Erias

texts.en:
Erias is a married man with three children. He comes from Kanaara cell, Nyabihoko in the Kamwenge district.
Erias sells agricultural cereals as his main source of income. He also sells gasoline for a side income. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more corn and beans to sell so he can increase his working capital. Erias will use a portion of the loan to buy more gasoline to sell and also to pay school fees for his children. His major challenge is price fluctuation.
He hopes to construct a permanent house for his children. He is a very honest and hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy dry corn and beans

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig, 41 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Using his previous loan, he not only repaired the heating system of his home but also renovated the house. His two older children go to secondary school. His wife is currently staying at home, looking after their newborn. He has been transporting goods between districts for 23 years.

Now Ganzorig is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy an electric car for personal use. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. The city council is urging people to use electric cars and is reducing tax on their ownership. He will use the car to drive his children from home to school during the harsh winter period.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for personal use

loans.name: Flor De Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nieves es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, reciclaje de chatarra, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, reciclaje de botellas, venta de accesorios de celulares, tienda de ferretería, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nieves es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio reciclaje de chatarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un pequeño capital que tenía de un negocio anteriormente, al observar el amplio comercio de estos materiales reciclables decide emprender este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chatarras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras recicladoras al menor y posteriormente lo vende a las empresas recicladoras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución y el compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The A.C. "FLOR KANTUTA" will begin the third cycle in Pro Woman, as part of the Focal Center of Cascada.  It is composed of eight members and is led by a directive board with Mrs. Nieves as the President.  The businesses that the members of the communal association work are varied.  Among them are:  transportation service, scrap metal recycling, neighborhood store, blanket sales, bottle recycling, sale of cellular accessories, hardware store and food sales.  

The credit that they will get will benefit small micro businesses where Mrs. Nieves is integral.  She says that ten years ago she joined Pro Woman, at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Presently she has a scrap metal recycling business.  She let us know that she started that business with a little capital that she had from a previous business.  Upon observing the large business of those recyclable materials, she decided to undertake this business.  

The loan that she will now get is for an increase in capital (purchase of scrap metals mostly) which she will acquire from the smaller recycled goods vendors and later will sell to the recycling companies.  This type of work permits her to generate funds to support her family economically, since she is single and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Woman, she responds that she likes the trainings that the institution offers and the sharing with her companions.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal primarily.

loans.name: Ironbi

texts.en:
Ironbi is a welcoming and pleasant woman to talk to. She is married, and has three children. Her husband is engaged in farming. He has rented 2 plots of land, and plans to plant potatoes. Her eldest son earns money in the Russian Federation to help his parents with the financial burdens of the family. He is a guest-worker.

Ironbi has engaged in sewing at home for over 7 years. She sews a national style of women's clothing. Her current machine broke down, and Ironbi has asked for a loan to buy a new sewing machine, so as not to lose revenue. This loan will help Ironbi. Her dream is to open a workshop for sewing national styles of women's clothes, and hiring some workers. Ironbi expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children, all of whom attend school. Additionally, she is looking after other family members. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

Nulu has been selling charcoal at retail in the market for 11 years, working six days a week. She does not have any additional income. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to buy a vehicle and stop having to hire one for transportation.

Nulu joined MCDT because of the good customer care she receives from MCDT staff. She has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT SACCO to enable her to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Sopheak is a 22-year-old married mother with a child in her care. She lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. Sopheak and her husband, 27, work on a yam plantation, where they have worked since 2012. They make approximately US $8 per day. Since Sopheak’s present wooden house is old, and she would like a proper house to live in, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy lumber to build a house. She hopes to have an additional business to improve her family’s standard of living and to support her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house.

loans.name: Sreylin

texts.en: Sreylin is a 19-year-old student who majors in accounting in her second year at an institute in the city. She is from Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Her father is an electrician; her mother and two sisters are working in a health center. Sreylin is short of financing to pay her tuition fees from her third to fourth year, so she has decided to take out a loan. This loan will help her to have enough finances while earning her bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo tiene un taller de elaboración de todo tipo de artículos elaborados con bronce, su nivel de educación es de secundaria, vive en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones con acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz.
Justo recicla desechos de bronce para la transformación de productos artesanales como ser pendientes, adornos de pared y otros. A través de esto obtiene su principal materia prima de excelente calidad, a menor costo y  además con un alto ahorro de energía.
El trabajo de Justo  le permite cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, pago de servicios básicos y otros.


Justo requiere un nuevo credito para hacer refacciones en su taller, sucede que las lluvias han humedecido las paredes y es necesario que Justo haga reparaciones y tome medidas contra la humedad
texts.en:
Justo has a workshop where he makes all types of bronze items. He completed secondary school. He lives in his own brick, three-room house with a cement floor in La Paz. Justo recycles bronze scrap metal to create artisanal products such as pendants, wall art, and other items.

This way, he is able to obtain excellent raw material at a low cost. Further, this saves a great deal of energy. The income from Justo's work covers his costs for food, utilities, and other expenses.

He is seeking another loan to make repairs in his shop because the rain has moistened the walls and Justo needs to make repairs and take measures against the water.

loans.use: to make repairs in his workshop.

loans.name: Adolyat

texts.en: Adolyat is wonderful, polite, woman who lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 63 years old. She lives with her brother. During the past eight years she has been engaged in sewing. She is sews blankets and pillow cases and sells them. She likes her job and wants to improve it. As she is already old, it is difficult to sew with her legacy sewing machine. She wants to buy a modern sewing machine. That is why she submitted an application for a loan. Adolyat is a hardworking woman, and she believes that, with your support, she can expand her activity and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Leonice

texts.en: Leonice is a 25-year-old Lebanese woman. She got married at a very young age and has two children so far. Her husband works in repairing cars but his revenue is not sufficient to cover the high costs of living. Therefore, Leonice was obliged to work as a female hairdresser and beautician with the aim of supplementing the family’s income. She has been in this occupation for four years and she is skilled. However, Leonice suffers from a lack of materials and she declares that she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the necessary hairdressing supplies and cosmetics and please her customers. In the future, she seeks to open a beauty salon and she says that more Kiva loans will definitely be on the way after.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary hairdressing supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 52 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children, who are still in school. Marilyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Marilyn has been in business for twelve years, and she has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en: Cora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cora is 33 years old and has two children, who are still in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business. Cora has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase certified potato seeds and supplies for replant and fertilization of the same.

loans.name: Mwahonza

texts.en: Mwahonza is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for school fees and household consumables. For over ten years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.  With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat for her home-based food business.
